Event Description: Alauddin Akonjee, an Imam in Queens, New York, and his assistant, Thara Miah, are shot and killed in broad daylight by Oscar Morel of Brooklyn, New York.
Niala Mohammad, a journalist for Voice of America, and a friend are removed from an American Airlines flight for non-compliance after inquiring into a lengthy delay.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Shan Anand, Faimul Alam, W.H., and M.K., four of six friends returning home to New York from Toronto, are removed from an American Airlines flight because they made the crew uncomfortable. Three of the four removed are Muslim, while the fourth is Sikh.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A fire destroys the Islamic Center of Fort Pierce, Florida. A security camera captures someone fleeing from the scene as the fire broke out. Omar Mateen, who killed and injured dozens of people at the Pulse nightclub in Orlando, was once a member of the congregation.
An unknown suspect or suspects throws three rocks through the windows of the Islamic Society of Greater Nashua mosque.

Emirjeta Xhelili of Brooklyn, New York, assaults two Muslim women walking their children in strollers, trying to forcibly remove their headscarves, pushing the strollers to the ground, shouting obsenities, and telling the women to leave the United States.

A Minneapolis man sends an anonymous letter to the Tawfiq Islamic Center, threatening to blow up the building. The letter also inlcuded racial and religious slurs. The suspect was identified and federal hate crime charges were subsequently filed, to which he pled guilty.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Khalid Jabara is shot and killed by his neighbor, Vernon Majors, in Tulsa, OK. Jabara and his family, Lebanese Christians, filed repeated reports with law enforcement about the neighbor, who regularly verbally abused them with profanity and racist comments about Muslims.

Former President Bill Clinton, speaking at the Democratic National Convention, welcomes Muslims who love America and freedom and hate terror to help build a future in the United States. Many American Muslims objected to their inclusion only in the context of terrorism.
A Muslim cabdriver is assaulted by a drunk man in Farifax VA who blames him for the September 11 attacks.æThe man's attack is unprompted and caught on video on the driver's phone.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A small Muslim community in Culpeper, Virginia, was prevented from moving forward in building a mosque in a rural location outside of town. The county denied the proposed construction over questions about waste disposal, butæmembers of the community have experienced discrimination before and suspect that the incident is related to anti-Muslim sentiment in the town. Members of the county government noted that they had been deluged with anti-Muslim opposition to the project.

Justin Bouma pleads guilty to sending a threatening letter to an Oklahoma City mosque that contained white powder meant to be mistaken for anthrax.æThe man also spray-painted Muslim businesses with anti-Muslim sentiments and faces felony charges.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Georgia Security Force III%, a militia based in Georgia, protests the possibility of a mosque and cemetery being built in Newton County.æSome protesters are armed, and the demonstration followed the group's release of an anti-Islam video that was later taken down.

A Muslim-AmericanæMarine recruit dies after being hazed by his drill instructor, who regularly referenced the soldier's religion. The recruit jumped down a stairwell after being denied permission from the instructor toægo on sick call despite visible symptoms of injury.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Ben Carson, a candidate for the Republican Presidential nomination, makes a series of statements reflecting his belief that a Muslim would not be fit to be president due to their religious beliefs and (his perception of) the incompatibility of these beliefs with the US Constitution. This belief is echoed in other statements given by Carson during his bid for president.

Voters in Alabama approve a ballot measure clarifying the state constitution, making clear that state courts cannot apply foreign law in a manner that contravenes state law. The measure is similar to other efforts around the country to target shari'a.

A thinly-veiled anti-shari'a law is passed in Florida, generating controversy due to the impact on Jewish law as well as Islamic law. As in similar efforts around the country, the law does not mention shari'a specifically, but organizations behind such legislation are known to target Islamic law.

A pastor promotes and plans a protest outside a mosque in Dearborn, Michigan. This is the pastor's fifth organized protest in opposition to Islam, and his Facebook page about the event reveals that he has some pubilc support.
Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump reaffirms his support in banning Muslims from the US following the massacre in Orlando.

A Coachella county mosque is set on fire by a man later arrested on suspicion of hate crime and arson potentially related to retaliation for the San Bernardino shootings. No one was injured, but the event followed a series ofæevents targeting the Muslim community.
A passenger attacks a Sikh (non-Muslim) bus driver, calling him a "terrorist" and "suicide bomber."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Self-proclaimed atheist Craig Hicks shoots and kills Deah Shaddy Barakat, Yusor Mohammad Abu-Salha, and Razan Mohammad Abu-Salha, in Chapel Hill, North Carolina. Hicks had made comments in the past about the victims' religious identities, although the incident allegedly resulted from a parking dispute.
A Muslim-American couple is asked to get off of a Delta Airlines flight from Paris back to the U.S. because a flight attendant reports being uncomfortable with the two being on the plane.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A family is removed from a United Airlines flight to Washington D.C. from Chicago after a delay involving a question from the family about their child's booster seat.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Two teensæshouting about ISIS physically attack a Muslim man in the Bronx.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Virginia lawmaker tweets about Donald Trump, calling him a "moron," and receives angry and threateningætweets in return linking him with Muslim terrorism and Sharia law.

A court of appeals prevents the American Freedom Defense Initiative, an anti-Muslim group, from showing advertisements on buses that show photographs of wanted terrorists. The group claims its freedom of speech has been violated.
Michelle Bachmann, a Republican Representative from Minnesota, makes statements about wanting to halt refugee resettlement and links new mosques being built to the Muslim Brotherhood.

Mushtaq Hussain discovers strips of bacon spelling "pig" and "chump"æoutside of the Florence, S.C. mosque he attends. At first, he considers it a joke, but soon realizes the hateful intention behind the message and police investigate the graffiti as a case of harassment.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Christian legal advocacy group files a complaint against an Islamic Cultural Association's purchase of a building in West Bloomfield, MI. The group accuses Islamic organizations of waging "stealth jihad" and appeals a judge's original dismissal of the case.æ
After attacking a Muslim woman at the mall and trying to pull off her abaya, Jonathan Deuel is charged with ethnic intimidation and assault and battery.

The ACLU investigates and makes public a covert national security program started in 2008 under George W Bush that grants immigration authorities the power to delay immigration benefits to Muslims and those from Muslim countries.
Hours after President Obama announces the death of Osama bin Laden, graffiti saying "Go home" and "Osama today Islam tomorrow" are found on the walls of a Portland mosque.
Speaking in New York City, New York, Mayor Michael Bloomberg advocates secret police monitoring of mosques and Muslim student groups.
Two Muslim men wearing so-called traditional dress are asked to leave a Delta flight from Memphis, Tennessee, to Charlotte, North Carolina, without any explanation.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The North Carolina state legislature passes legislation barring judges from considering foreign law, including sharia.
Missouri Governor Jay Nixon (D) vetoes a foreign-law bill, claiming it would make international adoptions more difficult.

Proponents and opponents of the Park51 Islamic cultural center, a project proposed for a site near Battery Park in lower Manhattan in New York City, New York, face off in counter-protests in the wake of President Obama's announcement of support. Opponents of the project begin calling the proposed center the "Ground Zero Mosque."

President Obama speaks out in favor of Park51 Islamic cultural center, a project proposed for a site near Battery Park in lower Manhattan in New York City, New York, stating that "Muslims have the same right to practice their religion as anyone else in this country." A tremendous controversy ensues as opponents of the project begin misleadingly calling the project a "Ground Zero Mosque."
A man is arrested for two counts of arson after being shown in surveillance photographs at a mosque that was targeted with an intentionally-set fire in Ohio.

Reverend Terry Jones founds "International Burn a Koran Day" and plans to burn copies of the Koran on the 11th anniversary of the 9/11 attacks in protest of the Park51 project in New York City. The plan and event receives significant national backlash.

After facing vandalism and discrimination when making plans to build a new mosque in Murfreesboro, TN, non-Muslims rallied around their neighbors to elect supportive representatives and form support committees. However, anti-mosque forces still filed suit against the mosque for what they percieved as "stealth jihad."

Following a viral anti-Muslim video, obscene racial insults are scrawled on a mosque building in VA. The vandalism was a surprise to the Muslims in the community, who had always felt included before the video in combination with a recent car vandalism targeting those who were at an early prayer service in the mosque.

Adil Imdad, a St. Louis Muslim man recieves a phone call from a stranger who is threatening to burn a Quran. After some conversation, the man reveals himself to be Roman Conaway and divulges that he plans to harm the president and start a war between Muslims and Christians. Imdad calls the FBI, who arrest Conaway and charge him with making false threats to detonate an explosive device and threatening the president.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Republican candidate for PresidentæDonald Trump uses the backdrop of the Twin Cities, among the most segregated cities in the country, to decry immigration from Muslim-majority countries. In this case, candidate Trump is discussing Somali immigrants, an incredibly small number of whom have joined al-Shabab or ISIS.

A man is arrested for violent assault of a Muslim man outside a mosque in Florida. The event is investigated as bias-motivated because a witness claims to have heard anti-Islamic statements before the attack began.

After intense public disapproval of the plan (first introduced in February 2016), an Islamic society's proposal to build a cemetery on unused farmland in Dudley, Massachusetts, is refused.æThe group files a lawsuit against the town, claiming that the justification for refusing to allow the purchase is actually based in prejudicial treatment.æ

A Muslim group purchases an old home in a New York suburb to fix up in order to use it as their mosque. However, a neighborhood group successfully files for the home to be declared a city landmark, making any exterior changes difficult if not impossible.

Shan Anand, Faimul Alam, W.H., and M.K., four of six friends returning home to New York from Toronto, are removed from an American Airlines flight because they made the crew uncomfortable. Three of the four removed are Muslim, while the fourth is Sikh.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Ted Nugent, a famous rock star,æspeaks at an NRA rally in support of Trump. Reminiscent of Ben Carson's earlier comments comparing Muslims to rabid dogs, Nugent expresses his support for Trump's Muslim ban idea with an allegory to banning a specific breed of dog if there were a "rash of dog bites in [his] neighborhood."

President Obama denounces Trump's rehtoric regarding immigrants from nations linked to terrorism, saying that "Mr. Trump's views divide the nation and make it harder to work with Muslims here and abroad." He continues to criticize Trump on his lack of understanding of foreign policy.
Two Muslim men are injured in a shooting early in the morning after the assailant makes derogatory remarks about Muslims. The shooting is investigated as a possible bias-motivated crime.

An Iraqi refugee who is a student at UC Berkeley is removed from a Southwest Airlines flight and question by the FBI after another passenger became uncomfortable at hearing him speak Arabic to his family on the phone.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Muslim woman files a discrimination suit regarding her dismissal from a job as a nurse and claims that a formal policy regarding the reason for her dismissal was not implemented until the day afterwards. Other former employees testify about bias regarding the Muslim faith.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Ted Cruz, a candidate for the Republican presidential nomination, makes a statement following the attacks in Brussels outlining his support for greater patrolling of Muslim neighborhoods. He does not define "Muslim neighborhood" but mentions empowering law enforcement to prevent radicalization.

Donald J Trump is elected as the President of the United States. Trump's campaign for President is rife with statements and policy proposals questioning the place of Muslims in the United States, among other things calling for a ban on Muslims entering the country, surveilling mosques, and creating a registry of Muslims in the United States. The Islamophobic tenor of his campaign emerged early on in his candidacy. At a September 2015 New Hampshire rally a supporter described Muslims in America as "a problem" and asked,æ"When can we get rid of them?" Candidate Trump responded,æ"We are going to be looking at a lot of things."

President-elect Donald J. Trump names retired Lt. General Michael Flynnæas his national security advisor. Flynn has a well-established history of Islamophobic views and public statements, claiming that Islam is a political ideology that naturally gives rise to extremism and violence. He has also spoken publicly aboutæconspiracy theories claiming that Muslims seek to impose Shari'a on communities in the United States.

President-elect Donald J. Trump names Representative Mike Pompeo (R-KS) as theædirector of the Central Intelligence Agency (pending Senate confirmation). Pompeoæhas made public remarks decrying the purported silence of Muslim leaders in response to religiously-inspired violence, suggesting that it makes them complicit in attacks.æ
A Sudanese American resident of Cedar Rapids, Iowa, returns home to find a note taped to his door saying, "You can all go home now. We don't want n______ and terrorists here. #Trump."æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A letter addressed to the Children of Satan arrives at the Islamic Center of Long Beach, California. It states that Donald Trump's election is a day of reckoning for the Muslim community. Trump, it continues, is going to cleanse America,ædoing to Muslims what Hitler did to Jews. The same letter was sent to twelve other mosques across the country.

A letter addressed to the Children of Satan arrives at the Islamic Center of Claremont, California. It states that Donald Trump's election is a day of reckoning for the Muslim community. Trump, it continues, is going to cleanse America,ædoing to Muslims what Hitler did to Jews. The same letter was sent to twelve other mosques across the country.

A letter left at multiple residences in McKiney, Texas, claims that Donald Trump is a gift to the White Nation because he will make it possible to get rid of Muslims, Indians, Blacks, and Jews. It then continues ominously, claiming that the group behind the message is everywhere and watching every move, with members in law enforcement and government.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A patron harasses and assaults a man in a restaurantæin the Pittsburg, Pennsylvania, area, using anti-Muslim slurs before physically attacking him. The victim, who is South Asian, is not Muslim.

A letter addressed to the Children of Satan arrives at the Evergreen Islamic Center in San Jose, California. It states that Donald Trump's election is a day of reckoning for the Muslim community. Trump, it continues, is going to cleanse America,ædoing to Muslims what Hitler did to Jews. The same letter was sent to twelve other mosques across the country.

A Republican lawmaker in Georgia pre-files and thenæabandons legislation that would have banned women from wearing face coverings in public.æHe decides to not pursue the bill (HB 3) in the 2017 session because of the visceral reaction it caused. In an interview, he says he is mindful that although it does not specifically target a specific group the bill may create an impression. He claims to have crafted the bill in the name of public safety.

Approximately 150 Muslim workers are fired from their meatpacking jobs atæCargill Meat Solutions after protesting restricted break time. The workers claim that management made plans to cut back on their breaks, restricting their ability to pray during the day and that the decision was religiously-based. The company disagrees and encourages employees to re-apply.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A teacher at a public school in Arizona accosts and accuses one of her Muslim students, whose family arrived in the United States with refugee status, of being a terrorist and states, in front of her class, thatæshe "can't wait until Trump is elected" because "he's going to deport all you Muslims."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A letter addressed to the Children of Satan arrives at the Islamic Center of Savannah, Georgia. It states that Donald Trump's election is a day of reckoning for the Muslim community. Trump, it continues, is going to cleanse America,ædoing to Muslims what Hitler did to Jews. The same letter was sent to twelve other mosques across the country.
Three members of a Kansas militia are charged with plotting to blow up a building housing Somali immigrants, many of whom work at Garden City, Kansas, meat packing plants.

A letter addressed to the Children of Satan arrives at the Islamic Center of Stockton, California. It states that Donald Trump's election is a day of reckoning for the Muslim community. Trump, it continues, is going to cleanse America,ædoing to Muslims what Hitler did to Jews. The same letter was sent to twelve other mosques across the country.

A letter addressed to the Children of Satan arrives at Masjid al-Kareem, a mosque in Providence, Rhode Island. It states that Donald Trump's election is a day of reckoning for the Muslim community. Trump, it continues, is going to cleanse America,ædoing to Muslims what Hitler did to Jews. The same letter was sent to twelve other mosques across the country.

A letter addressed to the Children of Satan arrives at the Islamic Center of Ann Arbor Michigan. It states that Donald Trump's election is a day of reckoning for the Muslim community. Trump, it continues, is going to cleanse America,ædoing to Muslims what Hitler did to Jews. The same letter was sent to twelve other mosques across the country.

A letter addressed to the Children of Satan arrives at Masjid al-Fajr Islamic Center of Greater Indianapolis, Indiana. It states that Donald Trump's election is a day of reckoning for the Muslim community. Trump, it continues, is going to cleanse America,ædoing to Muslims what Hitler did to Jews. The same letter was sent to twelve other mosques across the country.

A letter addressed to the Children of Satan arrives at the Islamic Center of Greater Miami, Florida. It states that Donald Trump's election is a day of reckoning for the Muslim community. Trump, it continues, is going to cleanse America,ædoing to Muslims what Hitler did to Jews. The same letter was sent to twelve other mosques across the country.
A North Carolina man, who subsequently pled guilty to obstructing the free exercise of religion, accosts a woman on flight from Chicago to Albuquerque,ægrabbing and pulling off her headscarf.

A letter addressed to the Children of Satan arrives at the Islamic Center of Davis, California. It states that Donald Trump's election is a day of reckoning for the Muslim community. Trump, it continues, is going to cleanse America,ædoing to Muslims what Hitler did to Jews. The same letter was sent to twelve other mosques across the country.

A letter addressed to the Children of Satan arrives at the Islamic Center of Boston in Wayland, Massachusetts. It states that Donald Trump's election is a day of reckoning for the Muslim community. Trump, it continues, is going to cleanse America,ædoing to Muslims what Hitler did to Jews. The same letter was sent to twelve other mosques across the country.

A Muslim-owned restaurant in Galviston, Texas, is vandalized twice in one week. In the first incident, vandals smeared bacon grease on the restaurant's door handles, while in the second incident vandals covered the front of theæbuilding with bacon.

Ariens, a power equipment company, reorganizes break schedules to minimize the impact of breaks on assembly lines. Muslim employees are fired for failing to abide by the 2 breaks per day policy while others resign.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A group of Muslim employees files suit against a hardware manufacturer for denying them a place to pray while at work. The employees were fired for "violating the bathroom policy" while performing ritual ablutions.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Muslim police officer is suspended without pay for wearing a beard in observance of his faith. The officer files a suit and is reinstated while an internal review happens.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A panel on a campus bridge that is reserved for the Muslim Student Association at the University of Minnesota is vandalized with the word "ISIS."æ

The Citadel, a 174-year-old unaffiliated military institution, decides that it will not amend it's uniform to allow for the religious needs of a hijab-wearing applicant. The institution previously has made accomodations for prayer and diets based on religion.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Three men are charged with assault and a hate crime after beating a Somali man in a pizza parlor. The incident began with hate speech referencingærace and religion directed at the victims.
The Kansas state Republican party sends out a series of mailers utilizing stereotyping as a means of connecting all Muslims to terror groups.

A letter circulates insinuating that a Muslim candidate for city council, a longtime resident of the Tampa, Florida, area with deep community roots, has ties to terrorist organizations and may seek to impose Islamic law in Tampa.

In New York City, New York, a man accostsæan off-duty NYPD officer, Amr Elsokary, who had intervened in a dispute. He threatens to kill heræand tells her to go back to her country. The man is subsequently charged withæaggrevated harassment and menacing as a hate crime.
Waterford, MI, passes a resolution refusing to participate in the federal government's refugee resettlement program, citing concerns about refugees from the Middle East.

A post on Drudge Reportæleads to a torrentæof hate mail and phone calls directed atæAmerican Muslim Women, a political action committee. The organization's main goal is to foster political participation among female American Muslims. The Druge Report post included the names and phone numbers of American Muslim Women organizers.

John Guandolo, a former FBI agent, speaks at a church inæWarroad, Minnesota, warning the audience about the existential threat Islam poses to the United States. Guandolo's talk is one of many similar events across rural Minnesota, a state with a significant Somali refugee and immigrant community.
An unknown suspect or suspects spray-paint TRUMP on Masjid al-Noor Islamic Center in Waterloo, Iowa.æ

President-elect Donald Trump names Ben Carson asæsecretary of the Department of Housing and Urban Development. As a presidential candidate, Carson made a series of remarks questioning the fitness of American Muslims for political office and comparing Syrian refugees to rabid dogs.

An unknown suspect accosts longtime NYC transit workeræSoha Salama in Grand Central Stations, yelling at her to go back to her country and calling her a terrorist. She suffers injuries in the incident.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A man accosts RabieæAyoub, Marwah AbdulHussein, and their four children as they were house hunting in St. Louis. Brandishing a gun, the man cites his right to own and use guns and threatens to kill the family. The suspect is subsequently arrested and taken into custody.æ

A letter addressed to the Children of Satan arrives at the New Haven Islamic Center, Connecticut. It states that Donald Trump's election is a day of reckoning for the Muslim community. Trump, it continues, is going to cleanse America,ædoing to Muslims what Hitler did to Jews. The same letter was sent to twelve other mosques across the country.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A controversy unfolds after a school board member inæRoseville, Michigan, posts publicly visible stories and comments disparaging African Americans, Muslim Americans, and Islam.æThe posts elicit community questions about the private speech of elected officials.

A restaurant owner inæLonsdale, Minnesota, posts an anti-Muslim message on the establishment's sign. The owner claims to have posted the message in response to a violent incident in which an American Muslimæstabbed nine people. When asked why he posted the message, he maintained that Islam preaches violence and hatred.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A local chapter of ACT! For America holds an event inæKalispell, Montana, to address what it identifies as the so-called soft and gentle treatment of Islam in public school textbooks, claiming that understating the threat posed by Islamic law, among other things, contributes to the erosion of American values.
John Guandolo, a former FBI agent, speaks at a public event sponsored by theæCulpeper County Sheriff's Office,æwarning the audience about the existential threat Islam poses to the United States.

A cab driveræharassesæIlhan Omar, who was elected to the Minnesota statehouse in November 2016 as the first Somali-American lawmaker. Omar, who was attending a White House policy training conference, reported that the cab driver called her ISIS and threatened to remove her headscarf while she was a passenger in his cab.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown suspect grabs 19-year-old San Jose State studentæEsra Altun from behind and attempts to remove her headscarf.æThe incident took place on campus.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Brooklyn man accostsæ22-year-oldæGehad Elsayed after a traffic incident,æverbally insulting her and yanking off her headscarf.æThe assailant was arrested and subsequently charged with aggravated harassment and criminal mischief as a hate crime.

At a public meeting, State Representative John Bennet ofæOklahoma stands behind earlier comments about Islam, depicting Muslims as a cancer that needs to removed from the country and shari'a as an existential threat to the United States.
Two men deposit a pig carcassæat theæIslamic Center of Lawton (OK).
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unidentified driveræcrashes into a Laurel, Maryland, mosque twice, causing $10,000 in damage. The mosque had been subject to previous threats.

An unidentified suspect breaks into a family's home and starts a fire in the kitchen. This was the third break-in in a three-week period for the family. The earlier break-ins resulted in property damange and anti-Muslim messages scrawled on the wall.
An unknown suspect vandalizes a mosque sign inæMankato, Minnesota. The incident occurred in broad daylight. The mosque has been subject to numerous incidents of vandalism since its opening in 2014.
Americans for a Secure Wyoming hold an anti-Islam rally atæa public park in Gillette, Wyoming. The group calls for a ban on Islam in the state. The event closed with a Qur'an burning.
The FBI arrests a Massachusetts man after a friend reports that he intends to burn down a mosque with the intent of killing Muslims, among other crimes.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Police and apartment complex residents discover notes in a Portland apartment complex claiming that all Muslims are terrorists and that they should be killed.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown suspect vandalizes a Muslim-owned grocery store, spray-painting ethnic and religious slurs, some of which single out a leader in the local Muslim community.
An unknown suspect vandalizes a mosque sign in New York City. The mosque has been subject to numerous incidents of vandalism.

AæWatauga, Texas, man is arrested for leaving a violent voicemail at a local mosque, calling Islam a violent religion and claiming that he and other military veterans are heavily-armed and that heæand others will cut their heads off. He is charged with misdemeanoræharassment. He later calls the mosque and apologizes.
Two men tellæa Somali resident of LittleæFalls, Minnesota, that they will burn down her hourse if she and her family do not leave town.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: On a radio news program, Paul Nehlen, a candidate in the Republican primary for a Congressional seat, claims that Muslims cannot abide by the United States constitution because the shari'a will not permit them. He also advocates a debate about the possibility of deporting all Muslims.

Republican candidate for President Donald J. Trump criticizes the family of an American Muslim armed service member killed in action. The soldier's father,æKhizr Khan, spoke at the Democratic national convention, where he raised questions about candidate Trump's policies around Muslims in America. In an interview with George Stephanopoulos, Trump suggests that the soldiers's mother, who was present but did not speak during the address, was silent because she was not allowed to speak by her Muslim husband.
An unidentified suspect spray-paints ethnic slurs on a Muslim-owned business. The proprieter indicates that this is the latest in a string of similar incidents.æ

A man leaves a voicemail message at the Council for American-Islamic Relations in San Francisco, saying Muslims are terrorists and that if he had his way all Muslims, including citizens, would be banned from the country.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown suspect attacks Suthahar Subburaj, an Indian resident of Omaha, Nebraska. Subburaj, who is not Muslim, reported that the attacker called him ISIS and punched him repeatedly in the head.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A note appears at a Staten Island (NY) home calling the residents ISIS and threatening to kill the family's baby.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Kentucky man uses social media to spread a rumor that men were unloading rifles and other weapons into a mosque in Florence, Kentucky. He later admits his son made up the story. The mosque has been subject toæprotests in the past.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A recylcing bin outside the Islamic Center of Tucson is set on fire. The mosqueæhas been subject to multiple incidents of vandalism in the past.
A man accosts and stabs a worshipper outside a mosque in Simi Valley, California. One suspect was taken into custody andæbooked on suspicion of a hate crime.
An unknown suspect vandalizes a woman's car in Hicksville, Long Island, breaking the windshield and scratching a message about Trump and Islam into the paint.

Arkansas State Representative BrandtæSmith files HBæ1041, which seeks to ban foreign law fromælegal proceedings in the state. Although the bill does not name shari'a, Smith acknowledges that he was thinking of Islamic law when he crafted the bill. Smith filed a similar billæin 2015.

An unidentified man verbally harasses a convenience store employee,æunleashing an anti-Muslim, anti-immigrant diatribe in the name of Donald Trump. He also threatens to have his son stab the employee.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Two unidentified suspects attack a non-Muslim Indian resident of Brooklyn, NY. He suffered a broken Jaw in the incident after they asked him whether he is Indian or Muslim. They did not wait for a response.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: In the wake of attacks in Nice, France, New Gingrich, former Speaker of the House of Representatives and campaign surrogate for Donald Trump, advocates testing all Muslims in the United States, citizens and non-citizens alike, regarding their devotion to shari'a. He maintains that the United States should deport anyone with a commitment toæshari'a.

A man, known to law enforcement, enters two Muslim-owned businesses in Fort Myers, Florida, and threatens to return to kill everyone present if the owners do not close their businesses in a specified time period.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Palm Beach County Elections Supervisor Susan Bucher removes the Islamic Center of Boca Raton as aæpolling station after public criticism. Other houses of worship serve as polling stations throughout the county.

Unidentified assailants attack a woman and her daughter, striking the mother and breaking eggs over her head. [Editor's note: The editor of this project has opted to depart from practice in creating an entry for this event. For the vast majority of cases, especially those concerning crimes against people and property, entries reflect reports made to civil rights organizations and/or law enforcement, which then generate media coverage by outlets with clear editorial protocols. In this particular case, the victim's son captured the event on camera and posted on social media, through which civil rights organizations and law enforcement became aware of the situation. The victim did not report directly to a civil rights organization or to law enforcement. Tracked down by local police, the victim declined to comment or to pursue criminal investigation, citing a desire to avoid media attention.]
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic Center of Tustin receives a voicemail in which an unknown suspect threatens to bomb the mosque.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown suspect fires live rounds at theæIslamic Community Center of Bryan-College Station, hitting the building's facade and front door.

An unknown suspect approaches a group of Muslim men and makes disparaging remarks about Islam. The suspect then opens fire, hitting two of the men, who were treated and released from a local hospital.

Fredy Burgos, a member of Virginia's Republican State Central Committee, posts anti-Muslim, anti-immigrantærhetoric on social media accounts. The state party criticizes the posts and Burgos apologizes, though he maintains that the party needs a diversity of views.

A man calls the Islamic Center of Southern California twice in the month of September threatening to kill members of the congregation. The police investigate and eventually arrestæMark Feigin, charging him with a variety of crimes.

A man threatens members of Masjid al-Madina in Raeford, North Carolina, waving a gun outside the premises. The police arrestæThomas Russell Langford, finding multiple weapons in his car. He faces charges of ethnic intimidation, stalking,æand assault with a deadly weapon.
A vandal writes an anti-Muslim message in a Boston-area subway car.
A man bursts into a mosque andædemands everyone's attention before declaring the Jesus is Lord. Members of the congregation report assuming it was the beginning of an attack.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Mosques in the Chicago area receive threatening email messages in wake of the Pulse Night Club shooting in Orlando, Florida. The congregations who received the messages, in Naperville andæWheaton, had both already publicly announced sorrow over the attacks.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Employees at the Islamic Society of North American (ISNA) in Plainfield, Indiana, discover bullet holes in the organization's sign.æISNA's headquarters has been subject to vandelism in the past.

A suspect follows Omar Siddiqi from a gas station and attempts to run him off the road, shouting expletives, anti-Arab epithets, and threatens to kill him. The suspect's truck is adorned with bumper stickers from anti-Muslim hate groups.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A fire breaks out at the Islamic Society of Greater Houston. According to the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives, the fire's multiple points of origin suggest arson.

Led by Mayor Beth Van Duyne, the Irving, Texas, City Council endorses an anti-shari'a bill introduced by state Representative Jeff Leach. The endorsement comes in the wake of a controversy around The Islamic Tribunal, a mediation panel staffed by Dallas-area Imams. Catholic dioceses and Jewish synagogues offer similar services.æ
Assailants attack Mohamed Rasheed Khan outside of the Center for Islamic Studies in Queens, New York. The incident leaves Khan with multiple broken bones.

After a traffic incident, a woman berates another driver and her daughter, making anti-Muslim comments and spraying the mother and daughter with baby oil. The woman is subsequently arrested and charged with two hate crime counts. She denies making the comments.

The Sterling Heights, Michigan, planning commission votes 9-0 to reject the construction of a proposed mosque in town. The proposal sparked significant public outcry. Similar controversies unfolded in cities and towns around metro Detroit, including West Bloomfield, Plymouth, Pittsfield Township, and Warren. In December of 2016, the Department of Justice sues Sterling Heightsæfor allegedly violating the religious freedom of the organization seeking to build the mosque,æthe American Islamic Community Center.
Congressman Peter King, R-New York, meets with President-elect Donald Trump and calls for surveillance of Muslim communities akin to (now discredited) programs established after September 11, 2001.

A controversy unfolds after planning commissioner in Huntington Beach, California, posts a publicly visible YouTube video and other social media posts disparaging Islam and Muslims as well as suggesting sympathy with white supremacist material.æThe posts elicit community questions about the private speech of elected officials.

A Republican candidate for the Louisiana state house stands by earlier comments suggesting that he will not patronize businesses owned or staffed by Muslims. In his statement, the candidate,æMichael Lowrie, suggests that Muslims have no place in American society.
Unknown suspects vandalizeæthe sign of theæMuslim Association of Puget Sound. Similar damage was done to the sign in late November.

The Islamic Society of Vermont receives a letter stating that Islam is incompatible withæAmerican society. Faith leaders and congregations from across Vermont rally in support of the Muslim community in the state.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Vandals spraypaint anti-Muslim references to terrorism on the front window of a convenience store, which is owned by non-Muslim Indian Americans.

The HouseæJudiciary Committee passes the VisaæIntegrity and Security Act of 2016, which singles outævisa applicants from a number of Muslim-majority countries for stricter scrutiny. Proponents say the legislation is meant to prevent terrorist attacks.

James Simpson of the Center for Security Policy speaks to a packed house at theæRutland Free Library in Vermont. Simpsonæwarns the crowd about the threat of refugee settlement, including disease and crime, as well as the threat of mosques in general, the vast majority of which he claims espouse armed struggle.æ

Town Meeting voters in Dudley, Massachusetts, vote overwhelmingly to take measures blocking the purchase of land by the Islamic Society of Greater Worcester, which had hoped to build a cemetery on the land.

A member of the Islamic Center of Golden, Colorado, receives a series of threatening emails from an unidentified man, known to the mosque and to authorities, threatening mass murder of members of the congregation.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A report finds that a former SeaTac, Washington, city manager sought information mapping Muslim residents in the name of public safety. He has since resigned.
A local church in Hood River, Oregon, installs an anti-Islamic message on its road-side display.æLocal residents protest the sign.

A group calling itself The Heart of the Texas announces a protest of the newly opened IslamicæDa'wah Center in Houston, Texas, encouraging people to bring legal firearms. The group never shows, and while about a dozen protesters assemble they are met by a larger counterprotest in support of the Muslim community.
Laurie Bartlett, a Republican candidate for the Florida state house, hosts a public event about the various threats posed by Muslim refugees, radical mosques, and Muslims in general.æ
An unidentified suspect attacks Serajul al-Khan, a New York City cab driver, punching and kicking him repeatedly while screaming anti-Muslim invective. The suspect also robs Khan.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: At a meeting of the Harris County Republicans, a man attempts to prevent Syed Ali, a Muslim resident of Houston,from being instated as a precint chair, citing the incompatibility of Islam with Christian American values.Though his motion gains some support, Ali is eventually voted into the party position.

A small group of protesters demonstrate against the City of Rutland's acceptance of 100 Syrian and Iraqi refugees, citing scarcity of resources, the inability of Muslims to assimilate, and the threat of shari'a.
Flyers are left at a proposed mosque site in Mukilteo, Washington, advocating for a ban on Islam in the United States.
Flyers are distributed in Sacramento, California, advocating the murder and torture of Muslims and Latinos in the name of white supremacy.

A bill banning shari'a from South Carolina state courts is narrowly defeated inæthe state Senate Judiciary Committee. The author of the bill, which passed the full House, said, "The Senate can be the graveyard of many good ideas."
An Oklahoma man is charged with attempted murder, with the possibility of a hate crime charge, after stabblingæa man of Bangladeshi origin while calling him a terrorist.

Three South Carolina state legislators, Steven Long, Bill Chumley, and Mike Burns, pre-file a bill with the state House of Representatives that would prevent any form of law not based on the Constitution from state courts. According to Long, the bill is proactive, saying "We don't have any immediate problems with that." Similar measures have failed to make it through the South Carolina state senate in the past.

Flyers promoting white nationalism are left at the Sunbury Islamic Center and affixed to public sites around the city.æSimilar fliers have been found at the University of Iowa, Iowa State University, University of Buffalo, and the University of Texas at Dallas.

A New Jersey Labor Department Employee grabbed a woman's headscarf and threw it on the floor at the Once Stop Center, a state-run career services office. The state has suspended the employee, who was also arrested, and is pursuing termination.
President-elect Donald Trump reiterates his support of a registry of Muslims in the United States and a ban on Muslim immigrants to the United States after an attack in Germany.

Republican candiate for President Donald Trump relates a story about US Gen. Jon J. Pershing fighting terrorism by capturing "50 terrorists who did tremendous damage and killed many people," dipping 50 bullets in blood, having his soldiers execture 49 of them, and telling the 50th to return to his people and tell the story. "And for 25 years, there wasn't a problem. Okay?" The Pershing story is popular on right-wing web sites, where amateur historians claim that Pershing was in the Philippines at the time.

Republican candiate for President Donald Trump relates a story about US Gen. Jon J. Pershing fighting terrorism by capturing "50 terrorists who did tremendous damage and killed many people," dipping 50 bullets in blood, having his soldiers execture 49 of them, and telling the 50th to return to his people and tell the story.æAfter Trump related the story for the first time in February 2016, historians weighed in and proved the story to be untrue.

Posters appear on the San Diego State University Campus naming seven students participating in the Boycott Divest Sanctions (BDS) movement, which seeks to pressure colleges and universities to divest and avoid contact with Israeli state institutions. The posters, which list the website of the David Horowitz Freedom Center, identify BDS as part of a genocidal campaign and the seven named students as being allied with Palestinian terrorists to perpetrate hatred of Jewish students on campus.

Andrew Rhoades, an assistant director in the Office of Security Operations inæthe Transportation Security Administration, reports that his supervisor instructed him to share the names of Somali-American visitors with a field intelligence officer to check for terrorist ties. In testimony before Congress regarding TSA practices, Rhoades, who works with the Somali American community in the Twin Cities area to build trust and cooperation, identified the request as racial profiling.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Three unidentified men assault a 19-year-old man in Astoria, Queens (New York) yelling ISIS during the incident.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A report surfaces alleging that Tom Angel, a Los Angeles County Sheriff Department official,æforwarded anti-Muslim and racist emails from his work account when he was a high-ranking official in the Burbankæpolice department in 2012-2013. Angel admitted culpability andæresigned a few days after the emails became public.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Burlington, Vermont, man is arrested and charged with disorderly conduct with a hate crime enhancement after he pointed a gun at a woman wearing hijab and called her a terrorist.

Carlos Beruff, a Republican candidate for the US Senate, speaking before the Broward County Republicans, advocates a ban on immigrants fromæthe Middle East. Reports suggest that the audience responded very positively to the statement.
A controversy unfolds after anti-Muslim social media media posts made by a member of the Elmwood Park Board of Education become public.

A female assailant verbally harassesæa woman in an anti-Muslim, profanity-laced tirade. The victim called the police, who arrived and informed her that freedom of speech prevented them from pursuing the matter. After they left the assailant returned and poured liquid over the victim's head.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Anti-Muslim activists JamesæStachowiak and Pastor Terry Jones hold an anti-Islam rally at the Georgia State Capitol. The two are the only people in attendance, other than security officials, who were obliged to attend because Stachowiak and Jones had called for supporters to attend with arms, and media.
Airport police escort Hakima Abdulle, who wears hijab,æoff a flight from Chicago to Seattle just after she boards. The airline gave no reason for the removal.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Montoursville, Pennsylvania, school board appointsæKaren Wright to an open seat despite her known history of posting anti-Muslim andæanti-gay messages to social media.

Peter Zieve, a prominent aerospace businessman, sends out postcards to residents of Mukilteo, Washington,æalerting the city about pending mosque construction. Sent anonymously, the postcards provided an email address to contact for further information:æmukilteostaysafe@gmail.com. The businessman, long-known by employees for his anti-Muslim messages, admitted sending the cards.

A member of the Tennessee state house, Representative Susan Lynn, distributes a DVD to other lawmakers that presents conspiracy theories about Islam and Muslim communities. Lynn has a history of proposing legislation targeting Muslim communities.

Newton County, Georgia, commissioners issue a moratorium onæthe development of houses of worship to explore the implications of a proposed mosque and cemetery. Without any prior zoning restrictions on the construction of such properties, the county Development Services Departmentæissued administrative approval, which prompted opposition from couny residents. Over five weeks of open hearings and public protests ensued, with residents opposing and in favor of the mosque speaking out.  Eventually, the moratorium lapsed, but the countyæpassed a new ordinance requiring public hearings for the development of sites of 10 or more acres.

State SenatoræTravis Holdman introduces a bill to ban the application of foreign law in state courts. As in similar proposed and enacted legislation across the country, the bill does not mention shari'a specifically, but Holdman acknowledges that the bill derives from constituent concerns over Islamic law.
An unknown suspect smashes the windows of Al-Ahram Halal Market in Portland, Maine.

A middle school teacher in Sugar Land, Texas, claims to have been making a point about stereotypes when she toldæWaleed Abushaaban, a student in her class, that everyone thinks he is a terrorist. Students taunted him after the incident.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Anti-Muslim chalk writing appears on the University of Michigan campus.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: After being taunted by fellow students as a terrorist, a developmentally disabled twelve-year-old Muslim student claims he is going to blow up the fence at East Islip Middle School in Long Island, New York. The school's principal and vice-principal then force the student to admit allegiance to ISIS and call police, who subsequently search the student's home for bombs. They find nothing.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A 13-year-old student is called a terrorist and has her headscarf pulled off. She had just begun wearing the headscarf again after having suffered from bullying.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A security officer atæthe Watha T. Daniel/Shaw Neighborhood Library threatens to arrest and handcuff a Muslim woman after she refuses to remove her headscarf upon her entrance to the library.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Senator Ted Cruz, a candidate for the Republican nomination for President, calls for the implementation of law enforcement programs to patrol and secure Muslim neighborhoods. Speaking after violent attacks in Brussells, Belgium, Cruz suggests that then-discredited New York Police Department surveillance programs could serve as a model.

The Idaho State Affairs Committee approved, with recomended changes, the American and Idaho Laws for Idaho Courts for a House vote. The bill seeks to ban the application of so-called foreign laws, aping similar legislation across the country that implicitly targets Islamic law.

Idaho state lawmakers introduce questions about Islamic law when debating legislation to manage and fund child support enforcement efforts, suggesting that the potential for shari'a provisions regarding custody and support to be part of court proceedings in the United States could erode American sovereignty.

In an interview with CNN's Anderson Cooper, Donald Trump, a candidate for the Republican nomination for President, says he thinks that Islam hates us. He is unable to explain whether he is talking about the religion or its adherents.æHe also calls for the United States to use enhanced interrogation techniques in terrorism-related investigations.

A controversy unfolds after a member of town government inæNorth Attleboro, Massachusetts posts publicly visible stories and comments disparaging African Americans and Muslims.æThe posts elicit community questions about the private speech of elected officials.

An unidentified assailant attacks Kozen Sampson, a Buddhist monk, mistaking him for Muslim. Sampson said he was saddened by the attack, bemoaning that Muslims have to live every day knowing that such anger toward them exists.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A kindergarten teacher allegedly engages in a campaign of harassment against a 5-year-old boy, singling out the student for ridicule, forcing him to carry a heavy backpack throughout the day, all culiminating in a choking incident on November 16.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Vincent Casella is arrested and charged withæcriminal mischief as a hate crime and unlawfully making graffiti after writing an anti-Islam message on a light pole.

David Hook approaches Balmeet Singh, who is Sikh, outside a restaurant and throws liquid in his face, saying that he was retaliating for blowing up the country.æThe local distrinct attorney charges Hook with battery and a hate crime.

An unidentified assailant attacks Rashid Dar, a researcher at the Brookings Institute, as he made his way to Friday prayer. He was wearing clothing often associated with Imams, prompting him to believe the incident was motivated by bias. He also reported that his wife, who wears a headscarf, is subject to much more harassment than he.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Alabama state representative Ed Henry makes a blanket anti-Muslim statement while commenting on a presidential debate, Tweeting that Muslims, abroad and in the United States, want to kill non-Muslims.æHenry served as the Alabama co-chair of Donald Trump's campaign for President of the United States.

Arkansas state representative Jason Rapert posts anti-Muslim statements on social media, saying that the United States needs to round up Muslim anti-Americans and advocatesæa ban on Muslim immigration.

The Tennessee Board of Education releases new middle school social studies standards for public review. They omit basic information about Islam, including the physical location of Saudi Arabia, the origins of Islam (including connections to Judaism and Islam), information about the Qur'an, information about the different communities with Islam, and historical trade routes relating to the spread of Islam. The change in standards appear to reflect public complaints about indoctrination.

An ad for football tickets on Stanford University's Facebook page featuring Tesay Yusuf, a Somali American who wears a headscarf, elicits so many hateful responses that the university removes those comments making direct threats and other hateful speech from the post.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Wendy Long, Republican candidate for the United States Senate from New York, Tweets a series of anti-Muslim and anti-Islam Tweets during a visit to a Syracuse, New York, neighborhood in which a former church has become a mosque.
A man calls Shifa Abuzaid and her family a bunch of terrorists during a vist to Sugar Land Town Square, a mall outside Houston.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Two men throw eggs and yell at two girls wearing headscarves in Buffalo, New York, as they got off a school bus.æAt the time of newsreports the girls had declined to file a police report, though witnesses did record the license plate number of the assailants car.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Dennis Murdy, of East Peoria, Illinois, displays handmade, life-sized silhouettes of a hunter with a rifle pointing at a kneeling figure wearing a turban. In an interview, Murdy acknowledges that the figure wearing the turban is supposed to depict a Muslim man.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Three people, including Arthur Roman, a police officer in Oak Forest, Illinois, attack Karam Jarrah, stabbing him twice, after verbally harassing him and a friend with anti-Muslim taunts. Police arrest Roman and two other suspects, charging them with assault with a deadly weapon and battery.

The Tennessee House of Representatives approves a bill banning proselytizing in public schools. The bill comes in response to a contoversy around teaching basic information about Islam and the history of Muslim communities in Middle School social studies.
Three men spray-paint the front wall of the Islamic Society of North America in Plainfield, Indiana, writing racist, anti-Islamic, and anti-Muslim messages.

Employees at Security National Bank refuse to serve a Muslim woman unless she removes her headscarf. A bank spokesperson maintains that the business asks all customers to remove face, eye, or head coverings of any kind for security purposes.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Contacted by a parent in the district, anti-Islam activist PamelaæGeller publishes an article online alleging that the Chesapeake Bay Middle School did nothing when a student from Saudi Arabia made terroristic threats. The school district investigated and sent a message to parents stating that no such student exists and that the rumor began when a student repeated an Islamophobicælimerick they found online. Geller refused to retract the story.

The Florida HouseæJustice Appropriations subcommittee approves a bill giving the Governor authority toæuse all force necessary to prevent a restricted person from enteringæor resettling in the state. The bill, meant to prevent refugee resettlement for people coming from the Middle East, defines a restricted person as someone from or from near a place in which terrorist networks are thought to operate.

A man with a bat confronts two men exiting the Idriss Mosque inæSeattle. Police find the suspect in a nearby park with a gun, arresting him foræproperty damage, assault, andæmalicious harassment as a hate crime.

At a public planning meeting, residents of Dudley, Massachusetts, voice opposition to a local Muslim community building a cemeteryæoutside of town. Some oppose the project in the name of public health, a common refrain across the country, while others voice opposition in explicitly Islamophobic terms.

Anonymous flyers begin appearing inæmailboxes across Palos Park and Palos Heights after plans of the Muslim American Society to convert an old church into a mosque become public. The flyers warn residents about dropping property values and the potential influx of large Muslim families with women wearingæburkas.

Campaigning for the Republican nomination for a Congressional seat, Maryland State DelegateæDavid Vogt announces that he intends to introduce a bill curbing the tax-exempt status of mosques deemed to haveæties with terrorist organizations. He does not spell out a process by which this determination would be made.

A group protestsæthe possibility of Syrian refugees being resettled in Missoula, Montana, after a local organization, Soft Landing Missoula, begins to work with the International Rescue Committee to put forward the city as a potential resettlement site.æSome protesters cite bible versus to oppose resettlement, some cite the strain on local resources, while others draw on sterotypes of refugees as hateful criminals.

Harry McNevin, a resident of Longmont, Colorado, displays a homemade sign bearing an anti-Islamic message in his front yard. He declines a request from town officials to remove the sign after complaints from other residents.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: President-elect Donald Trump nominates Senator Jeff Sessions to serve as Attorney General. Sessions, a longtime Senator from Alabama and former federal prosecutor, was an early proponent of Trump's proposed ban on non-citizen Muslims entering the United States. In 2014, he excoriated the National Endowment for Humanities funding a project called Bridging Cultures, which provided funding to pubic libraries for books about Islam and the history of Muslim communities, suggesting the initiative was part of a nefarious plot.

Anti-Islamic and anti-Muslim Facebook posts by Dan Close, a public school history and social studies teacher in Dewey, Oklahoma, become public after screen shots of his account are anonymously released to the media. One post appears to condone killing Muslims.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A partially-constructed mosque on Lake Travis, Texas, burns to the ground under suspicious circumstances. Community leaders declined to speculate about possible causes, but did note that there were not gas or electric hookups at the site.
A sign-up sheetæfor a Muslim student association at Sacramento State University is defaced with anti-Islamic messages.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The South Carolina House of Representatives approves a bill banning the use of foreign law in defense motions in state courts.æAs in other similar measures across the country, the target of the bill is shari'a.æThe bill's sponsor, Republican Chip Limehouse, acknowledges that there have been no references to shari'a in any court proceeding in South Carolina.

The South Carolina Senate approves a bill to track refugees resettled in South Carolina. The bill proposes a refugee registry to be monitored by state law enforcement, with organizations involved in resettlement programs assuming liability for any criminal acts perpetrated by refugees resettled under their auspices. Sponsors of the bill, the first of its kind in the country, note the presumed insufficiency of federal refugee vetting processes as well as the threat that Muslim refugees pose to public safety.

A Muslim resident is booed when speaking and called a murderer and terrorist at a public meeting to debate the repeal of a resolution designating West Bloomfield Township welcoming of immigrants. Residents express concern the designation will attract refugees from the Middle East. The city, a wealthy suburb of Detroit, has a substantial immigrant population from the former Soviety Union.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: State SenatoræDavid Brown confirms that he will speak at an event calledæShariah 101 hosted byæJeffrey Bauman, an anti-Muslim activist. Brown describes the event as an opportunity to discuss the anti-shari'a legislation he plans to introduce and sponsor.

Amine Aouam, a self-described immigrant from Morocco and victim of a violent attack, alleges he was assaulted after he said good evening in Arabic to a group he and a friend were passing on the street.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Three Tennessee state legislators introduce a bill banning proselytizing in public schools. The legislation grows out of a controversy surrounding middle school history and social studies materials presenting basic information about the history of Islam and Muslim communities.

The Tennessee Senate approves a bill banning proselytizing in public schools.æThe legislation grows out of a controversy surrounding middle school history and social studies materials presenting basic information about the history of Islam and Muslim communities.

Tennessee Governor BillæHaslam signsæa billæbanning proselytizing in public schools.æThe legislation grows out of a controversy surrounding middle school history and social studies materials presenting basic information about the history of Islam and Muslim communities.

The Chisago County, Minnesota, Board of Commissioners cedes to public pressure and goes against the earlier recommendation ofæthe county's planning commission, denyingæthe Islamic Community of Bosniaks' proposal to build a small cemetery in Lake Chisago Township.æ

A Dakota County district judge compels Castle RockæTownship (Minnesota) to offer a conditional use permit for a cemetery to the Maghfirah Cemetery Association. The Township rejected the original cemetery proposal in August 2014, citing a shifting litanyæof reasons for its decision.æAfter rejecting the proposal, Castle Rock Township changed zoning ordinances to forbid cemeteries in the area under question.

Oregon state Senator Brian Boquist submits Senate bill 479, which proposes to ban shari'a from judicial proceedings in the state. The bill differs from some other similar efforts across the country in that it singles out shari'a specifically, rather than the more common general concept of foreign law. Boquist submitted an identical bill in 2015.

A lone, armed and masked protesteræcarrying an American flag appears for the day in front of the Islamic Center of Boseman (Montana). The protester put his shotgun away in response to police request, but he remained in place for the remainder of the day. When journalists asked the man why he was protesting he named the threat of Islam and Muslims.

Mary Durnstein, a social studies teacher at Huntington High School in Huntington, West Virginia, is suspended for a pattern of racist, anti-Muslim, and anti-Islamic social media posts. Students brought the posts to the attention of school officials, and the districtæreleased a statement saying that it expects educators to comport themselves on social media as they would in the classroom.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Residents in Bayonne, New Jersey, protest a proposed mosque and Muslim community center.æOpponents of the project claim to be opposing the new center on zoning grounds, but materials promoting the opposition are sprinkled with references to 9/11, terrorism, and anti-Muslim sentiment. The organization seeking to build the new center has been in Bayonne foræover 15 years.
Two men vandalizeætheæOmaha Islamic Center, wrapping bacon around door handles and throwing rocks at the building. The Center has been a target of vandalism multiple times over the past months.
The white nationalist American Freedom Party sponsors robocalls throughout Iowa urging voters to support Donald Trump, listing among other reasons his opposition to Muslim immigrants.

An unknown suspect vandalizes the Islamic Center of Central Florida (Masjid al-Mumin).æThe incident left shattered windows, brokenælights and security cameras, andæbacon scattered around the front door.

Senator Ted Cruz and Representative Mario Diaz-Balart introduce legislation designating the Muslim Brotherhood as a terrorist organization. Were the bill to become law, the designation would have far-reaching consequences for American Muslims and American Muslim organizations. Anti-Muslim activists use the Muslim Brotherhood name to refer to a wide range of organizations, including those that have spun off from the organization because of its official disavowal of violence. Applying the designation to the Muslim Brotherhood, which would be the first time the United States took the step against an organization that has never directly attacked the United States or its vital interests, would allow the United States government to shut down American Muslim organizations with even tenuous ties to the Muslim Brotherhood, among the largest Muslim organizations in the world.
An unknown suspect vandalizesæthe sign of the Islamic Center of Peoria. The graffiti, a series of numbers, is associated with white supremacist thought.

A state appeals court upholds two Superior Court rulings against Linda Tisby, a corrections offers fired for her decision to wear a headscarfæto work. Camden County officials contended that the headscarf, even a tight-fitting variety worn by Tisby, posed a security risk and violated rules about uniform neutrality.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A controversy in New Albany, Indiana, ensues when parents complain about a worksheet in a middle school social studies class that seeks to teach students about a diversity of views on Islamic law, presenting the thoughts of a fictional young woman in Saudi Arabia. The same worksheet, developed by a national educational materials company, was at the center of controversy in 2011.

Texas state Representative Kyle Biedermann sends a letter on official stationary toæmosques across Texasæasking congregational leaders to fill out a survey in advance of Texas Muslim Capitol Day. The survey, the results of which Biedermann will share with Texas lawmakers, inquires intoæopinions about shari'a and proposed federal legislation, introduced by Senator Ted Cruz in January 2011, designating the Muslim Brotherhood as a terrorist organization. Although the survey is not official state business, the correspondence suggests that a reply is required.

Following a dispute over a cab fare, Andrew Plachecki draws a weapon andæuses slurs to threatenæthe driver. New York State police apprehended Plachecki andæhe is charged with menacing,ædisplaying a weapon as a hate crime, and reckless endangermentæas a hate crime, all felonies.
An unknown suspect vandalizes the Islamic Center of Davis in Davis, California, breaking multiple windows and wrapping bacon around the door handles.

An unnamed suspect is charged with second-degree arson for allegedly setting a fire that destroyed the Islamic Center of Eastside in Bellevue, Washington. Authorities believe there is no evidence of a hate crime, though members of the community express wonder about what role a general environment of anti-Muslim sentiment has in such situations.

Kamal Samater, a self-identified Muslim, threatens to assassinate members of the Islamic Center of Eastside community.æDuring the incident, Samater is alleged to have said that Muslims have no place in America. Authorities arrested Samater and charged him with felony harassment and malicious harassment, a hate crime.

Montana State Senator Keith Regier introduces Senate Bill 97, which seeks to ban the application of foreign law in state courts. As in similar legislative efforts across the country, the bill does not mention Islam or shari'a specifically, but hearings over the bill in the Senate Judiciary Committee focus almost exclusively on these subjects.

Texas state Representative Kyle Biedermann hostsæDefending Against Radical Islamic Terrorism In Texas at the state capitol. Speakers include current and former elected officials from across Texas who claim that shari'a is a threat to the United States and that the presence of mosques in communities promotes radicalization.

Robin Rodes, traveling through John F. Kennedy airport in New York City, verbally and physically assaults Rabeeya Khan, a Delta Airlines employee. Among other things, Rodes tells Khan that President Trump will get rid of all Muslims. Authorities arrested Rodes and charged him with assault,æunlawful imprisonment, andæmenacing and harassment as hate crimes.æ

Residents of a Mason, Ohio, neighborhood report finding circulars accusing Rawd Saleh, a resident of the area, of ties to terrorism.æThe claim refers to a case involving her father dating back over a decade in which he and others were charged with funding a charity with potential links to terrorist activity. The charges were dropped.

President Donald J. Trump signs an executive order ceasing entry of all refugees into the United States for 120 days,æbars Syrian refugees in general,æand blocks entry to the United States by citizens of seven Muslim-majority countries for 90 days: Syria, Sudan, Somalia, Iran, Iraq, Libya, andæYemen. At the time it went into effect, the ban extended to holders of valid visas, those with green cards, and dual citizens. People in these categories currently in the United States cannot leave the country with certainty about being able to return. The order also reduces the overall refugee quota by more than half and empowers federal officials to add countries to the list on an as-needed basis.

The New York City Human Rights Commission announces allegations againstæPax Assist, a services contractor at John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City.æSupervisors at the company are alleged to have openly denigrated Islam and denied Muslim employeesæbreak schedules accommodating daily prayer and breaking fast during Ramadan.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: President Donald J. Trump signs an executive order ceasing entry of all refugees into the United States for 120 days,æbars Syrian refugees in general,æand blocks entry to the United States by citizens of seven Muslim-majority countries for 90 days: Syria, Sudan, Somalia, Iran, Iraq, Libya, andæYemen. At the time it went into effect, the ban extended to holders of valid visas, those with green cards, and dual citizens. People in these categories currently in the United States cannot leave the country with certainty about being able to return. The order also reduces the overall refugee quota by more than half and empowers federal officials to add countries to the list on an as-needed basis.

A man begins photographing AsmaæElhuni, who was sitting in a coffee shop, and when she confronts him he asks if she has a green card. Elhuni is an American citizen, a graduate ofæGeorgia State University, and works in a state legislator's office. She recorded the incident, garnering significant media attention.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Senate Bill 97, which seeks to ban foreign law from Montana courts, passes through the state senate judiciary committee and moves to consideration by the full senate. It was introduced on January 24. Hearings about the bill focused on the threat of Islam and shari'a.

Danielle Elamrany, aæ10-year veternan of the New York City Police Department, files a lawsuit contending that suffered years of harassment and discrimination at the hands of supervisors and co-workers after her decision to begin wearing a headscarf in 2008, despite receiving religious accomodation from the department.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Unknown suspects vandalize the Tarbiya Center in Roseville,æCalifornia, spray-painting its front wall with anti-Muslim and anti-Islamic messages.

Idaho state representativeæEric Redman introduces a bill banning foreign law from Idaho courts. Similar to other bills across the country, it does not mention shari'a specifically, but the law-maker acknowledges that it is a significant motivating factor behind the bill. Redman introduced a similar bill in 2016.

Employees and customers at Smashburger in Edina, Minnesota, harassæKadra Abdi andæSadia Warfa. The two women allege thatæthey were harangued because of their headscarves and were told to return to their country. The restaurant denies that employees were involved. The incident occured in front of Warfa's three-year-old daughter.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Amidst a bid for reelection, vandals deface six campaign signs of South Brunswickæschool board member Azra Baig. The graffiti suggests links with ISIS and used ethnic slurs to describe Baig's heritage.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
