Event Description: While shopping at Modell's Sporting Goods in North Brunswick, New Jersey,  Azra Baig overhears another customer loudly say that the Muslim ban, referring to President Donald J. Trump's executive action on immigration and refugees, is long overdue. Baig, a member of the South Brunswick school board, was the target of hate speech during the election campaign in November 2016.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: House Billæ1041, which bans foreign law from state courts, passes the Arkansas House judiciary committee by voice vote. As in similar legislation proposed in state houses across the country, the bill does not mention shari'a specifically. Debate, however, focuses exclusively on the supposed threat it poses to the American justice system. Proponents admit the bill will have no effect on judicial procedure if it becomes law.
A family files a lawsuit after being forcibly removed from the observation deck at the Empire State Building in New York, New York, foræpraying.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Philadelphia police, the FBI, and the city's Human Relations Commission launch an investigation after a severed pig's head is found early in the morning on the doorstep of the Al-Aqsa Islamic Society in north Philedelphia. Security camera footage captures a red truck throwing the head at the mosque the night before.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A woman wearing an abaya and hijab is struck on the shoulder from behind by a young man when entering a WalMart in Avon, Indiana. The woman's husband confronts the man, who continues to be aggressive, but there is no further violence andæthe suspect flees.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A man grabsæan anonymous victim's hijab from behind as she is loading items into her car in a Long Beach, California, parking lot. He curses the Muslim faith and the hijab that he tore from the woman's head before fleeing.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: All four sides of the Central Minnesota Islamic Center in St. Cloud are vandalized over the course of a few weeks. Cars outside the mosque are also targeted after a history of racial and cultural tension in the area.
Leaders of the Islamic Center of Pflugervilleæfind the front door of the center covered in feces and torn out pages of the Quran scattered around the scene as they enter for morning prayer.
After news of violence in Gaza that upset both Muslims and Jews in Brooklyn, men throw eggs at worshippers entering a Coney Island Avenue mosque during Ramadan.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A group ofæteenagers repeatedly drives past theæIslamic Society of Bay Ridge shouting "Burn to the ground!"æThe hecklers waved Israeli flags and used sirens and lights to interrupt the dawn prayer during Ramadan.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown suspect or suspects leave a package of pork at the door of an apartment in Davis, California. UC Davis police confirm that Muslims reside in the apartment.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A witness alleges thatæmembers of theæKappa Alpha fraternity targeted a Muslim couple and their two children with ethnic slurs as they walked passed the fraternity house after attending a protest in downtown, Tallahassee, Florida.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Chattanooga, TN, Christian pastor is indicted for solicitation to burn down a mosque in Islamberg, NY. In a plea agreement filed in federal court Robert Doggart admits he spent months gathering weapons and plotting an all-out assault on the small Muslim community.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown suspect or suspects sets fire to the Islamic Center of Victoria in Victoria, Texas. The mosque is completely destroyed.

Muhammad Almuttan files a lawsuit alleging that the City of Country Club Hills is denying him a business license application because he is Muslim. Among the supporting materials is a sworn affidavit from the city's former police chief, who claims that a former city official instructed him to harass Almuttan. The suit names the city's mayor and three members of the Board of Aldermen.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Representative Sean Duffy, in an interview with CNN, dismisses white extremist nationalism as a threat on par with Muslim extremism, claiming that there is something different about what he termed the systematic nature of attacks perpetrated byæMuslims.

A federal judge finds that Bernards Township, New Jersey,æacted in discriminatory fashion by rejecting a proposal by theæIslamic Society of Basking Ridge to build a mosque. The decision is a culmination of a process that went on for over five years, and the settlement included a $3.5 million payment and a mandatory public hearing that forbade criticism against Muslims or Islam. The group filed the lawsuit after the township rejected the proposal in December 2015 on the basis of a parking ordinance.

A local Philedelphia, PA, man shoots Muslim cab driver in the back as he drives away after questioning the cab driver about his country of origin and opinions on ISIS. The suspect is facing charges of attempted homicide, aggravated assault and recklessly endangering another person.

A voicemail left at the Islamic Society of Pinellas County in Pinellas Park, FL, threatens to bring militia and firebomb the mosque.æThe caller is arrested on federal charges of making a telephonic threat to kill, injure or intimidate using fire or an explosive.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown suspect vandalizes a reflection room at the University of Michigan, urinating on a carpet Muslim students use for prayer.

North Dakota state Representative Kim Koppelman introduces House Bill 1425, which seeks to ban foreign law from judicial proceedings in the state. The bill, similar to many others around the country, does not mention shari'a specifically.
House Bill 1041, which seeks to ban foreign law from judicial proceedings in Arkansas, passes through theæHouse Judiciary Committee. It now moves on to the full House for a vote.
A teacher at Dacula High School in Dacula, Georgia, receives a note telling her to hang herself with her headscarf. The note is emblazoned with American flags.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic Society of Saint Petersberg, FL, recieves a voicemailæin which a man threatens to firebomb the building and shoot every person on sight.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The parking lot of the Gurdwara Singh Sabha Sikh Temple in Buena Park, CA, is found graffitied with words containing 'Islam' and 'ISIS'.
The owner of Fatima Food Mart inæLong Island City, NY, is attacked in his store by a man who repeatedly insists "I kill Muslims".æ
The St. Louis, MO, chapter of the Council on American-Islamic Relations receive a phonecall that makes threats against the organization.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Andr_ Carson,æU.S Representative for Indiana's 7th congressional district, receives death threats over the phone after speaking out against Donald Trump's suggested Muslim ban.æRepresentative Carson is one of two Muslim members of congress and had recieved threats in the past.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Documents leaked by Edward Snowden reveal that the FBI had been monitoring the emails ofævarious Muslim-Americans with unclear legality, although the monitoring was meant toætarget foreign terrorists and spies.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: After the proposed project to build a Muslim community center and school is approved by aæMaryland judge, town residents continue toæpush back against the development. The Cooksville residents claim that this development would be disruptive to the neighborhood, despite previousæchanges being made to the proposal that were meant to address the issues raised.

A New Jersey federal judge rules that theæsurveillance of 11 Muslims by the NYPD did not harm the people who filed the suit and was meant to find "Muslim terrorists hiding among ordinary, law-abiding Muslims". The plaintiffs claimed that the surveillance and its publishing had damaged their livelihoods and reputations.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A man that had been harassing a Somali Muslim community in Kansas City hits and kills a young Muslim man with his car. The car has anti-Muslim statements scrawled on the windows.

Legislators introduce Florida bill SB 386, which declares that any attempt to use foreign law isævoid if it breaches state law.æThe bill is criticized for targeting shari'a law, although it makes no direct reference to it.
The New Hampshire GOP platform adopts a new stance thatæit will "protect against the implementation of any part of Sharia law in NH, including legislation outlawing Sharia law."
An unidentified suspectæscrawls anti-Islamic graffiti on the front foor of the Ahlul Bayt Society Islamic Center in Perry Township, Ohio.æ
Tim Donnelly (R-CA) uses posts on social media to tie his campaign opponentæNeel Kashkari (R-CA) to shari'a law because he once participated in a US Treasury conference about Islamic finance.

Tom Chereck (R-OR) runs for state senate under the platform of requiringæverification of citizenship or legal residence to work in Oregon, banning classes in English as a second language, and outlawing shari'a law.æ

South Dakota state SenatoræStace Nelson introduces a resolution before the SenateæState Affairs Committee suspending communication betweenæstate government, including law enforcement, and the Council on American Islamic Relations, a Muslim civil rights organization.æNelson citesæthe organization's possible, and completely unsubstantiated, ties to terrorist organizations, echoing proposed federal legislation targeting the Muslim Brotherhood.

An anti-Muslim flier appears atæthe Islamic Society of Greater Shreveport, in Bossier, Louisiana. The flier, which espouses white nationalist extremist ideas about a Muslim-free America,æadvertises an organization calledæAmerican Vanguard. Similar fliers, available on the organization's web site, have appeared at locations across the country.

An anti-Muslim flier appears atæthe Rutgers University Paul Robeson Cultural Center, a frequent gathering place for Muslim students. The flier, which espouses white nationalist extremist ideas about a Muslim-free America,æadvertises an organization calledæAmerican Vanguard. Similar fliers, available on the organization's web site, have appeared at locations across the country.

Anti-Muslim fliers appear at multiple locations on the University of Texas Austin campus. The fliers, which espouse white nationalist extremist ideas about a Muslim-free America,æadvertise an organization calledæAmerican Vanguard. Similar fliers, available on the organization's web site, have appeared at locations across the country.

Anti-Muslim fliers appear at Rice University in Houston, Texas. The fliers, which espouse white nationalist extremist ideas,æadvertise an organization calledæAmerican Vanguard. Similar fliers, available on the organization's web site, have appeared at locations across the country.

Anti-Muslim fliers appear at Texas State University in San Marcos, Texas. The fliers, which espouse white nationalist extremist ideas,æadvertise an organization calledæAmerican Vanguard. Similar fliers, available on the organization's web site, have appeared at locations across the country.

Anti-Muslim fliers appear at the University of North Texas in Denton, Texas. The fliers, which espouse white nationalist extremist ideas,æadvertise an organization calledæAmerican Vanguard. Similar fliers, available on the organization's web site, have appeared at locations across the country.

A man enters the Islamic Community Center of Des Plaines and, when confronted by staff in the basement,æclaims that a bomb will detonateæin the facility the next day during community prayer. He then flees.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A woman is attackedæwith a beer mug after being shouted at for not speaking english in a Coon Rapids, MN, Applebee's. The assailant is charged withæthird-degree assault.
A student at Mac Arthur High School in Irving, TX, is arrested for creating a 'hoax bomb' after showing his teachers a homemade clock.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Three muslims students attending local universities in Chapel Hill, NC, are shot and killed by a neighbor over an alleged parking dispute. Friends and neighbors urged the police to consider the event a hate crime.
Liquor store clerk in Rapid City, MI, is shot in the face during a robbery after the assailant called him a terrorist and accused him of working with ISIS.
Sunday morning worshippers at theæAhmadiyya Muslim Community Baitus-Salaam Mosque in Hawthorne, CA, discover the wordæ"Jesus" painted on the outside wall and a plastic grenade in the doorway.æ
An unknown suspect writes "Jesus is the way" on the outside of theæIslamic Center of Hawthorne in Hawthorne, CA.

A dozen armed protesters from the Bureau of American Islamic Relations gather outside of theæIslamic Center of Irving in Irving, TX, to protest rumors of the 'Islamic rule' in Irving and the 2015 Paris Attacks.

Retired Airforce Lt. Colonel Roy White, a member of ACT for America, an organization the Southern Poverty Law Center identifies as a hate group, speaks at the Texas state Capitol. He warns lawmakers that the Council on American Islamic Relations (CAIR), a Muslim civil rights organization, seeks to undermine American civil society by waging a stealth jihad. He calls members of CAIR jihadists in suits.
A $100,000 ad campaign sponsored by Pamela Geller is approved to run on New York City public transportation. The ads depict graphic images of ISIS beheadings and anti-Islamæstatements.

A Heritage Foundation panel about the Benghaziæcontrovery turns ugly when a Muslim-American student wearing a hijab stands and tries to point out Islamaphobic rhetoric.æShe is then taunted and mocked for citing statistics about peaceful Muslims around the world.
A Bosnian Muslim cemetery is vandalized in Maltby, Washington. The event is suspected to be a hate crime.

Tennessee state Senator Mae Beavers reports to constituents that, according to a briefing she received from retired intelligence officials, Muslims are moving to the Bible belt and infiltrating churches in order to wage a stealth jihad.

Conservative activists gather in a restaurant outside Winston-Salem, North Carolina, to discuss the looming threat of Muslims in the United States. Some attendees advocated violence to address the threat, while others argued for undermining Muslim civil society organizations. [Editor's note: No direct threats were made. We made the decision to include this post with full recognition of the right to free speech of those at the gathering.]
The Hoover Crescent Islamic Center, outside Birmingham, Alabama, receives an emailæthreatening to kill all Muslims in the United States. Other mosques in the area receive the same message.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Iowa HouseæJudiciary Subcommittee approvesæa bill banning foreign law from judicial proceedings in the state. Like other similar measures around the country, the bill does not mention shari'a specifically. The bill's sponsor,æRalph Watts, reports that the bill is meant to ensure assimilation of immigrants. The bill now moves to full committee for consideration.

Aæfire is set intentionally at the Islamic Society of Coachella in Coachella, CA. The fire caused significant damage but no people were injured. The suspect was taken into custody on felony charges, including commission of a hate crime, maliciously setting a fire, second-degree burglary and two arson charges.
A large window is shattered by a brick at theæIslamic Center of Alameda in Alemeda, CA.æ

A man verbally threatens and brandishes a knife at a Muslim woman in a car wash in Chino, CA.æThe assailent faced charges of a hate crime and was arrested on suspicion of criminal threats and brandishing a weapon.

The national headquarters of The Council on American-Islamic Relations in Washington D.C is sent a suspicious white powder that is later found to be not dangerous. The letter also contained a hate-filled message. This incident happened on the same day that an envelope containing an unknown white substance was sent to the Council on American-Islamic Relations Bay Area office in Santa Clara.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An envelope containing an unknown white substance and a message signed 'infidel' is sent to the Council on American-Islamic Relations Bay Area office in Santa Clara, CA. The substance was later deemd not harmful. This incident happened on the same day that an unknown white substance was sent to the national CAIR headquarters in Washington, D.C.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An Arab civil rights activist is assaulted in the streets of Brooklyn, New York, by a man she had previously reported to the police as suspicious. The man shouts insults at her in Arabic, threatens beheading, and throws a trash can at her.
A Muslim woman running for state office in the Cincinnati, Ohio, area receives threatening phone calls and comments after local press reports about her candidacy.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Harlem, New York, man is arrested after taunting and attacking a Sikh professor who he mistook to be Muslim.

A young Muslim girl on a New York, New York,  bus is harrassed and threatened after accidentally bumping into a fellow passenger.æThe man she bumped called her a terrorist and threatened to kill her before running off of the bus.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown suspect sets fire to theæIslamic Society of New Tampa, damaging the prayer hall. It is the second mosque arson in Florida in the space of six months.
An unidentified caller leaves a message atæMasjid Dearborn, disparagingæIslam and making vague threats against the community's children.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Adam Purintonæof Olathe, Kansas, is charged with first-degree murder and first-degree attempted murder after shooting three men in a bar. Just prior to the shooting, Purinton yelled atæSrinivasæKuchibhotlaæandæAlokæMadasani, both engineers at Garmin originally from India, to go back to their country. He later bragged to a bartender at another establishment that he had killed two Middle Eastern men.æKuchibhotla died from his wounds.

Invited by members of the West Virginia Houseæof Delegates,æBrenda Arthur of theæAmerican Congress for Truth addresses lawmakers. The Southern Poverty Law Center calls American Congress for Truth the largest anti-Muslim hate group in the United States.æ

The Garden State Islamic Center in Vineland, New Jersey, files a federal anti-discrimination lawsuit, alleging that the city has used local land-use ordinances to prevent the community from expanding its facility.æThe suit alleges a decade-long, concerted city-wide effort to prevent the expansion from moving forward. The allegations are similar to those levied in cases across the country.

Police arrest King Edwards and HoseaæMoore in connection with the beating death ofæRamadhamæMohamed, a Somali-born cab driver. Police allege the men requested the cab with the intent to rob the driver.

Muhammad Ali, Jr., and his mother are detained by Customs and Border Patrol agents at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport upon their return from a trip abroad. Ali's attorney alleges that during their detention agents asked them repeatedly if they are Muslim, raising questions about the treatment of Muslim US citizens by the agency.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A woman in Tampa, FL, isænearly driven off the road trying to enter a mosque. The woman reported that the unknown man was throwing rocks out of his car and proceeded to accelarate towards her and block her vehicle from entering the mosque parking lot.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A woman's car is shot at in Eastern Tampa, FL, as she drives away from a mosque. The woman told the local Sheriff's office that she did not notice the bullet hole in her car until she was later in a car wash.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown group of three assailants throws a rock through the window of a family's home in Plano, TX. The family had just moved into the neighborhood six weeks prior. Another rock isæthrown through their windows the very next night.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Somali owned Juba Coffee House and Restaurant in Grand Forks, ND, isæbadly burned as an unknown suspect breaks the front window and lights the restaurant on fire. No one was injured in the fire. The fire occuredæa few days after the words "go home" were spray-painted onto the building, below the letters "SS" in the style of the Nazi symbol.
A Lebanese woman in Tulsa, OK, files charges against a man who hit her, slashed her tire, and called her a "Muslim b****" for supposedly parking too close to his car in a strip mall parking lot.

An unnamedæteacher at Shiloh Middle School in Snelville, GA, asks 8th grader Faiza Osman if she has a bomb in her backpack. Another student in the class stood up for Faiza, and the teacher later apologizes for making an inappropriateæjoke. The Gwinnett County school district reviewed the case and decided not to discipline the teacher because there was no 'ill intent'.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Kennesaw, GA City Council requires theæapplication for a storefront mosque to be modified heavily before it will be considered, then rejects it outright despite conciliatory actions from the would-be congregants.æThe congregation will likely file a lawsuit.

The Linn County (IA) Attorney speaks out against an idea within the county's diversity education initiative that would give government employees paid time off to learn about Islamæand Muslim history in Iowa. The attorney does not appear to be on record opposing a past program involving Hinduism, but claims that this event is problematic because it creates the impression of government promotion of a single religion.

Tennessee Rep. Scott DesJarlaisæposts on his Facebook page about his concernæover the vote to allow an Islamic Center to build a cemetery in Murfreesboro andæ"the impact it might have on [his] community."

Tulsa Police Department Captain Paul Fields refuses a superior’s order to attend or assign other officers to attend an event at a local mosque meant to thank the Tulsa Police Department for its service to the community. After the department suspended Fields for insubordination, he filed a federal lawsuit alleging that the order infringed his first amendment right to freedom of religion. The department countered that attending similar community events was a common occurrence for officers, including events held at religious institutions. The Tenth Circuit Court of Appeals rejected Fields’s claims.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An Ohio seventh grade student is accused of threatening to shoot and kill a Muslim schoolmate in Vandalia, OH. The two students were overheard arguing on the schoolbus. The seventh grade boy asked the muslim student if he was going to bomb them, calling him a 'son of ISIS'. The seventh-grader then allegedly threatened to bring a gun to the school. He wasæarrested then transported to a juvenile detention center where he faced charges of aggravated menacing and ethnic intimidation.æ

After a civil rights suit is filed against the town of St. Anthony following the rejection of theæAbu-Huraira Islamic Center's request to use an existing building as a mosque,æthe city and group settle out of court and agree that the building use can proceed as planned.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A muslim man and his friends were yelled at and had hot coffee thrown in their faces by a woman after spending a Sunday afternoon barbequeing, playing volleyball, and praying in the Alameda County Regional Park in Castro Hills, CA. The womanæyelled anti-Muslim slurs at the man and his friends before throwing her hot coffee at his face. The incident was investigated as a case of battery but no charges were filed.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Hector Gastelum, an elected official on the Otay Water Board in San Diego, California, posts anti-Muslim comments via his Twitter account. He regularly uses the account to identify himself as a public official, leading some of his constituents to report his social media activity.
Robin McGreer approaches another man in a parking lot inæTysons, Virginia, and proceeds to threaten him with anti-Muslim slurs. An altercation ensues and McGreer bites the man in the face.æ
An unknown suspect throws a rock through the window of Masjid Abu Bakr in Denver, Colorado.

The Ku Klux Klan posts fliersæin several neighborhoods around Augusta, Maine,æpromoting a neighborhood watch program. Although the fliers do not mention Muslim refugees specifically, local clergy believe the move comes in response to refugee resettlement in the area. Similar fliers have appeared in other area towns.
The Muslim Community Center in Silver Springs, Maryland, receives a letter threatening harm toæMuslims.æThe Islamic Education Society, also in Silver Springs, receives a similar letter.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic Education Society in Silver Springs, Maryland, receives a letter threatening harm toæMuslims.æThe Muslim Community Center, also in Silver Springs, receives a similar letter.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Plymouth, Michigan, City Clerk Linda Langmesser posts disparaging anti-Islamic remarks about Rumana Ahmed, a White House staff member removed by the Trump administration.æShe denies having made the post. The City Manager has opened an internal investigation.

The White House announces that Sebastian Gorka, former Breitbart News editor and Fox News contributor, is joining the national security staff. Gorka is well-known for his views on the inherent violence of Islam. æ

Aaditya Shah, a æresident of Washington, DC, hires an online painting company, 'paint1ing', off of the internet to paint his house only to have the owner threaten him when he cancels the service. After the service was canceled the owner of the company,æRich Trevor Dickey, messaged Shah threatening him with a picture taken off of Shah's Facebook and saying 'death to Muslims'.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Leilah Abdennabi and Sirat Al-Nahi, two students of the Universtity of Texas, are seated in the Kerbey Lane Cafe in Austin, TX, and are told by another man waiting to be seated to go 'home to Saudi Arabia' andæasked if they have guns. When the women drew attention to the comments the staff of the cafe still seated the man and told Abdennabi and Al-Nahi that there was nothing the cafe could do. After a Facebook post about the incident got attention the owner of the Kerbey Cafe releasedæan apology statement denouncing the incident.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Manassas Mosque inæManassas, VA, recieves a threatening voicemail in which an unnamed caller said he wanted to kill Muslims in retaliation for the recent mass shooting in San Bernardino, Calif.æIf the call had been succesfully traced the police said that the man would have been charged with making a threat by phone and potentially with a hate crime.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Alex Pino, an officer at the Hudson County Sheriff's office in New Jersey, is suspended with pay and under investigation for an expletive-laden anti-Muslim Facebookæpost. He deleted the post but a Facebook friend of his took a screenshot and posted his comment back online.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A group of Sikh men are intially denied entry to a Broncos-Chargers game at Qualcomm Stadium in San Diego, CA, for wearing turbans. They were allowed into the stadium eventually, but told that they would not be able to wear turbans there again. An unknown person called the police on the group after seeing them rummage through the trunk of their car before entering the stadium. A bomb-sniffing dog was called onto the scene.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The office of Oklahoma state RepresentativeæJohn Bennett requires three Muslim students to fill out a questionnaire before making an appointment to see him. The questionnaire, written by ACTæfor America, asks respondents to report on their beliefs. Bennett has a well-documented history of Islamophobic remarks. The students were visiting the Captiol building to mark Muslim day, meant to build bridges between state government and Muslim communities in Oklahoma. The questionnaire is similar to one circulated by a Texas state representative.

Masjid al-Iman in Jersey City, New Jersey, receives a letteræthreatening to behead Muslims. It is signed by someone calling themselves Muslim Slayer. Mosques in Maryland and Virginia receive similar letters. All are postmarked in Sheffield, England.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Muslim Center of Middlesex County inæPiscataway, New Jersey, receives multiple violent threats via voicemail and email in one week.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Sana Rashid, a pharmacist in New York, NY, is verbally attacked in a Herald Square pharmacy by a customer. This unknown man called her a terrorist and told her to get out of his country, among other things. The incident continued for a few minutes while Rashid tried to defend herself, but the assailant left without any interference from anyone in the store.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The webpage of theæIslamic Community Center of Pheonix in Pheonix, AZ, is hacked by an unknown hacker group which left the message 'Vivre la France' on the website. Staff at the Mosque found the intrusion early in the morning and the website was 'under construction' for the rest of the day.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A local Brooklyn woman, Kameelah Rasheed, isæcalled for further questioning by custom officers Newark LibertyæInternational airport in Newark, NJ, after going through the regular security checks. After she boarded her flight from Newark to Istanbul she wasæforced to leave the aircraft to be interrogated by an FBI agent forætwo-and-a-half hours. She was the onlyæpassenger from the 200 aboard the plane to be removed and had her phone and passport confiscated by customs. According to Rasheed, she was the onlyævisibly Muslim passenger aboard the flight.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An Islamic Cultural & Student Center associated with the Islamic Center of Lubbock in Lubbock, TX, is vandalized by an unknown suspect. One of the two glass front doors was found smashed and external light fixtures were also broken.

A 30-year-old woman is pushing her baby down the street when she is elbowed and spit on by a U.S postal worker in Brooklyn, NY. The woman was wearing a hjab and reported that the postal worker, Dainton Coley,æshouted anti-Muslim statements and threatened to burn down the woman's mosque.æColey was arrested and charged with aggravated harassment, menacing, and acting in a manner injurious to a child for making the tirade in front of the infant.

The Islamic Society of South Texas in Corpus Christi, TX, recieves a suspicious letter from Los Angeles that contains a cartoon of the prophet Muhammad holding a sign that references the Charlie Hebdo shootings in Paris. The letter also said "Convert to Christianity Before It's Too Late!!!" All the members of the mosque also recieved this letter, and the incident was investigated by the FBI.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A middle school girl is attacked by three classmates at Public School 89 in Bronx, NY. Her attackers allegedly referred to her as 'ISIS' and tried to rip her hjab off while physically attacking the girl. The police responded to the incident but no police report was taken. The attack was reported as a bias incident to the school board but the disciplanary hearing was postponed so the families could secure legal representation. No charges were filed.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The American Turkish EyupæSultan Cultural Center in Brookly, New York, receives a letteræthreatening to kill Muslims.æIt is signed by someone calling themselves Muslim Slayer. Mosques in New Jersey, Maryland, and Virginia receive similar letters.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Madani Masjid inæLawrenceville, Georgia, receives a letter threatening violence against Muslims.æSimilar messages have arrived at mosques in New York, New Jersey, Maryland, and Virginia.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Masjid Omar binæAbdul Aziz in Norcross, Georgia, receives an email threatening mass violence against Muslims and other groups on March 15. Other mosques in the Atlanta region and around the South receive the same message.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Al-Farooq Masjid in Atlanta, Georgia, receives an email threatening mass violence against Muslims and other groups on March 15. Other mosques in the Atlanta region and around the South receive the same message.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Huntsville Islamic Center, in Huntsville, Alabama, receives an emailæthreatening to kill all Muslims in the United States. Other mosques in the region receive the same message.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Attorney General Jeff Sessions announces a new Executive Order on immigration and refugees, replacing the executive action taken by the White House earlier in the year. The new Executive Order, set to take effect on March 16,æsuspends the refugee program for 120 days,ædecreases the refugee cap from 110,000 toæ50,000,æand imposes a 90-day ban on new refugee applications and visas for citizens from Somalia, Libya, Iran, Sudan, Yemen, and Syria. Unlike the previous Executive Order, the new measure does not extend an indefinite ban to refugees from Syria, nor does it apply to people already granted refugee or asylum status or current visa or greencard holders. The issuance of the new Executive Order effectively ends legal challenges to the previous measure.
Masjid Bilal Ibn Rabah in Lexington, Kentucky, receives a letter threatening to bomb the mosque.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Chester H. Gore is charged with using a hoax explosive device, entering property of another for the purpose of causing damage based on religious conviction, destruction of property of less than $1,000 and possession and use of illegal fireworks after he tried to forcibly enter the Dar Al-Hijrah Islamic Center in Falls Church, VA, and lit off a hoax explosive device in the parking lot. A bystander report also indicated that Gore may have thrown molotov cocktails into the parking lot.

After more than a year of consideration, the Bayonne, New Jersey, Zoning Board fails to pass a proposal by a non-profit organization, the Bayonne Muslims, to convert a warehouse into a community center with a mosque and a soup kitchen. Officially, those voting against the project did so on the basis of traffice and parking concerns on the dead-end street. However, public opposition to the project was often explicitly Islamophobic, including one case of property crime against the local Muslim community.

Jonathan Hussey of Bayonne, New Jersey, spray-paintsæanti-Muslim and pro-Trump messages on a building members of the local Muslim community use for prayer. He is charged with criminal mischief, bias intimidation, and criminal trespass.
An unknown suspect leaves a bomb threat on the voicemail of theæIslamic Center of Greater Cincinnati inæWest Chester Township, Ohio.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Anti-Muslim fliers appear on the windshields of worshipers of the Foothills Unitarian Church. The congregation has been vocal locally about supporting Muslim community members. No group has claimed responsibility.
Students at JoaquinæMoraga Intermediate School inæMoraga, California, discover anti-Muslim fliers on school grounds. The school has disciplined one student and held an assembly on hate.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Muslim man, Hameed Alawsi, is shot and killed outside a Home Depot in Sacramento, CA, by a man who allegedly had a "severe hatred" for people of Middle Eastern descent. The shooter saw Alawsi with his sister, who wears a hijab, and proceeded to follow Alawsi and shoot him in the parking lot.

Adan Ali Gaal, a Somali Muslim cab driver, is physically assaulted after one of his customers is annoyed with how long it takes his credit card to process.æThe attacker called Gaal a terrorist and told him he would shoot him before knocking him unconscious.
At 11:30 pm, a Muslim woman in Staten Island, NY, is awoken by a knock on her door and finds a package of pork left for her there. The incident is investigated as motivated by hate.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Altaf Chowdhury files a lawsuit against a popular Long Island steakhouse, claiming that he was denied family leave and that he was denied wages. The lawsuit came about after being tricked by coworkers into eating a pork hotdog, which they had told him was chicken.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: At a basketball game between the Brooklyn Nets and the Maccabi Electra Tel Aviv teams, a Muslim woman holding a Palestinian flag claims she is punched in the stomach and her flag is stolen by a Jewish community leader. The alleged assailant denies all claims.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Town Attorney and Town Supervisor for Buffalo, NY receive hate mail and hateful phone calls about the purchase of a local restaurant by someone who wants to turn it into an Islamic Center. The town had nothing to do with the purchase, and there were no problems with the transaction or arrangement.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Queens, New York, woman reports to police that while she was wearing a headscarf another womanæpunched her andædenigraded Muslims. The New York Police Department is investigating the incident as a possible hate crime.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Parascandola, R. (2017, Mar 09). "Cursed and Hit Me for Muslim Garb. New York Daily News.

Event Description: A man who identifies himself as a sergeant of the Los Angeles Police Department in Los Angeles, CA, posts an Instagram message supporting false claims that the country of Japan does not let Muslim residents become citizens. The post also asserted that Syrian refugees should not be let into the U.S and that there should be more scrutiny of immigrants already living in the United States. The post was called anti-Muslim by prominent civil rights groups. The LAPD launched an investigation to find out if this post was in fact created by an LAPD officer.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Maher Khalil and Anas Ayyad are taken out of the line to board a flight in the Chicago Midway Internantional Airport in Chicago, IL, when another passenger overhears them speaking arabic and tells the Southwest Airlines employees that they are scared to fly with the two men. Khalil called the police after being barred from the flight, and the flight was delayed while the two men were interrogated by the police and airport security.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Police arrest Mariano Talavera for trespassing and harassing members of the Islamic Center of San Antonio in San Antonio, TX. Talavera allegedly entered the mosque and deliberately kept his shoes on as he walked on prayer rugs, ignoring the complaints of the mosque worker. The worker then called the police when Talavera refused to leave, and Talavera was charged withæcriminal trespassing.

A plane was diverted from takeoff at theæBaltimore/Washington International Thurgood Marshall Airport in Baltimore, MD, when four passengers are taken off of the plane for 'suspicious activity'. When approached, Spirit Airlines declined to describe what the suspicious activity was, only that the captain was approached by a stewardess after passengers alerted the staff. Allegedly one of the men removed was watching a newsæreport on his mobile phone. The four passengers were questioned, though ultimately not arrested or charged with any crimes.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Clayton Alexander Cansler is arrested and charged with making a terrorist threat in Sugar Land, TX, after a New Jersey man alerts the media to a post Cansler made online declaring his intention to shoot up a mosque, including pictures of an assault rifle and ammunition.

Haneen Jasim, a pre-med student at the University of Cincinnati in Cincinnati, OH, isæshouted at and almost run over by a car as she walks home from studying. As she was crossing the street a man pulled up in his car and yelled anti-Muslim insults, including calling her a terrorist and telling her to 'go home' to her country. He then proceeded to accelerate towards Jasim, almost hitting her with his car.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Instead of adding Muslim holidays such as Eid al-Adha to the school vacation calendar, a Montgomery County, MD, school district simply removes the names of other religiously affiliated breaks from school and does not change any of the holiday times.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Following a controversial school assignment in San Bernadino, CA that required students to evaluate whether the Holocaust actually happened, the school's secretary recieves a call saying that a better assignment would have been to cut her and the interim superintendent up with a knife. Both threatened individuals are Muslim.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Muslim group in Culpeper, Virginia, files a federal lawsuit against Culpeper County, claiming that the September 2016 decision to reject a proposal to build a mosque on a rural property was discriminatory. The county denied a waste removal permit for the property, which does not have access to a sewage system. The county has acknowledged that it received a deluge of anti-Muslim messages prior to its decision. The Department of Justice also sued the county in December 2016 regarding the same case.æ

Law enforcement arrests Richard Lloyd and charges him withæfirst-degree arson after he admits that he tried to burn down Met Mart in Port St. Lucie, Florida, because it is owned by Middle Eastern Muslims. The owners of Met Mart from Indian and are not Muslim.

Police arrest Jason Lee Kendall after he enters Al-Aqsa restaurant in Salem, Oregon, and proceeds to verablly harass and physically assaultæan employee. He claims to have received a message that the restaurant was keeping a woman as a slave.æPolice are investigating the attack as a possible hate crime.

The Bureau of Alchohol, Tobacco,æFirearms, and Explosives is investigating a fire at the Islamic Center in Ypsilanti in Pittsfield township, Michigan.æLocal officials informed the Bureau of the fire because of the building's designation as a mosque.æThe Township recently settled a discrimination lawsuit with a local Muslim school.æ

An unknown suspect burgles the Islamic Center ofæBosnia and Herzegovina in Long Island City, New York. He makes off with over $7000. Of particular note is that the Center reports worshipers staying away from evening prayers as detectives investigated, with one member suggesting that the police presence and media attention makes the congregation nervous.

Representative Steve King of Iowa retweets praise of Dutch anti-Muslim politicianæGeert Wilders for speaking out about the dangers of Muslims. In turn, white nationalist activist David Duke retweets and praises King.æ

A Washington State University, Vancouver associate researcher files a suit against the institution following his refusal to add his supervisor as an author on one of his papers. The researcher claims that his supervisor attacked him based on his Muslim faith, and that the incident was not isolated in terms of religiously-motivatedæharassment.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Muslim congregation in Bensalem township, PA, sues the town after their application to build a mosque is rejected without comment.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: After seven years, a Muslim teacher's lawsuit against the East Ramapo, NY school district appears before a federal judge.æThe lawsuit claims that he was wrongfully terminated from his job as a high school chemistry teacher and that he suffered harassment and discrimination from colleagues while employed.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Muslim immigration officer who is a native to Algeria files a discrimination suit against US Immigration and Customs Enforcement in Boston, alleging that he had been passed over for a promotion in favor of an unqualified candidate.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The US Department of Justice sides with a Muslim school security officer in his suit against the Philadelphia public school system. The school district mandated a new policy that did not allow for beards longer than a quarter inch, which is restrictive to the man's ability to wear a beard that represents his faith.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Dar al-Hijra mosque in Falls Church, Virginia, receives two calls threatening violence against Muslims. The mosque has been subject to numerous threats and threatening incidents in the past.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The head official at a high school basketball game inæPrince George's County, Maryland, informs Donita Adams, coach ofæWatkins Mill High School's women's basketball team, thatæJe-Nan Hayes, who wears a headscarf, needs certification of religious need in order to participate in the event.æThe rule appears in the NationalæFederation of State High School Association rule book.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A group of residents in Sterling Heights, Michigan, file a lawsuitæagainst the city for its February 21 settlement in a legal case involving the American Islamic Community Center's proposal to build a mosque. The city originally cited zoning laws in rejecting the proposal, prompting lawsuits by the AICC and the federal government for violating the Religious Land Use and Institutionalized Persons Act. Opponents of the settlement claim that the city is favoring Muslims and that the original denial based on land use ordinances is legitimate.

The Montana House Judiciary Committee passes Senate Bill 97, which bans the application of foreign law in Montana Courts. Proponents and opponents alike referred to the bill as the Shari'a law bill in hearings, though the legislation does not mention shari'a specifically, as is the case in similar legislative efforts across the country. The bill now moves to the full House for consideration.
An unidentified suspect breaks into the Islamic Center of Tucson in Tucson, Arizona, and rips up copies of the Qur'an before departing.
Staff at the Santa Fe Public Library report to police that they suspect a library patron urinated on three copies of the Qur'an.

Santa Clara, CA policeæuse a battering ram to break down the door of a Muslim man accused of possessing stolen property (a dashboard camera). The police are armed,æand ransack the entire house, including squeezing toothpaste tubes and photographing Islamic art containing Arabic words as evidence. It seems to prosecutors and media that the incident is motivated by a suspicion that the victim is a terrorist on the part of the police.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: New York City representatives argue that a prolonged period of unwarranted surveillance by the NYPD of New Jersey Muslims did not actually harm the people being watched. The report filed by lawyers representing New York Cityæinstead blames the media for any harm incurred, and asks that the Federal District Court affirm the finding that the case should be dismissed despite an appeal from the Muslim plaintiffs.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Muslim employees of a Hertz rental car office located in the Minneapolis-St. Paul airport sue the company over wrongful termination based on religious and ethnic bias after suffering discrimination in the workplace based on prayer times and locations.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Westchester County, NY school superintendent is placed on "administrative reassignment" while charges are brought against him for widespread discrimination and derogatory comments. Some comments included those to a Muslim English teacher, who he told was not fit to teach children becauseæher "husband or people could come in at any time and blow up this place."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: State Rep. John Kavanagh, R (AZ) tells jokes in bad taste at aæpublic event. The jokes were meant to be roasting a Maricopa County sheriff, but made light of racial and religious profiling by police, as well as the newly introduce "right to serve" act. Some of the comments explicitly targeted and offended the Muslim community in the town when they became public.

A San Antonio man with ties to national anti-Muslim organization ACT! for America suggests that a new social studies textbook should remove text that claimsæthat shari'a law requires religious tolerance of non-Muslims.æWhether or not the edit is approved, he says he will send cards to all 1,200 schools in the district encouraging them to not use the book.

The Islamic Center of Fredricksberg holds an open meeting to discuss the possibility of moving to a new location inæFredricksberg, VA, and is met with open hostility. At the meeting concerns about increased traffic in the proposed new site were outnumbered by anti-Muslim speech. A sheriff's deputy had to halt the forum after the crowd got too angry.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Samson Woldemichael, an uber driver in Charlotte, NC, is attacked by a passenger. The passenger allegedly asked the driver whether he was Muslim, and though Woldemichael said no, the man proceeded to insult Woldemichael with anti-Muslim speech and punch him in the head.æ The passenger threatened to shoot and strangle Woldemichael and only left when Woldemichael honked his horn repeatedly to draw attention to the attack.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Anti-Muslim protestors hold a rally outside of the Portland Rizwan Mosque in Portland, OR.

Sarah Beebe, a local woman in Dearborn, MI, tweets "ñDearborn, MI, has the highest Muslim population in the United States. LetÍs [expletive] that place up and send a message to ISIS. WeÍre coming.î After this tweet went viral and was reported to local police, Beebe was invested by both federal and stateæauthorities.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Elmasri family returns to their home in Orlando, FL, to find that someone has shot a gun at their house multiple times. A bullet went throught the garage into the master bedroom, and into a dresser. Two other bullet holes were found near this one. The family live in a gated community that requires a code to enter, leading the  father to believe that the shots were fired by one of their neighbors who knew that they are Muslim. The event was investigated by the Orlando Sheriff's Department.

The Islamic Center of Omaha's cleaning crew finds a spray-painted symbol of the Eiffel Tower in the middle of a peace sign on the side of their building in Omaha, NE. This symbol refers to the terror attacks in Paris that occured the day before this vandalism.æThis incident was investigated by the FBI. This was the third time that the center had been vandalized in a four month period.æThe Monday following this incident the Islamic Center of Omaha released a press statement describing Islam's support of religious tolerance and condemning the attacks in Paris.

A Muslim student at the University of Connecticut inæStorrs, CT, comes back to his dorm room to find that someone has written "killed Paris" under his name, referring to the November 13th terrorist attacks in Paris.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Ted Hakey shoots both a handgun and a rifle at the side of the Baitul Aman mosque next door to his house in Meriden, CT.æ

Mark James Riedel calls 911 and threatens to shoot "anything that looks like a Muslim" from his house in Norman, OK. After hanging up the first call he called the police dispatcher back and said that because they were ignoring him he was going to start shooting cars. Police quickly arrived on the scene and when Riedel refused to lower his weapon they shot Riedel. Riedel was taken to the hopsital where he was in stable condition.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Martin Alan Schnitzler leaves a voicemail at the Islamic Society of Pinellas County in Pinellas Park, FL, that threatens toæpersonally bring a militia to firebomb the mosque and shoot whoever is inside of it. He was arrested by the FBI and charged with making a telephonic threat to kill, injure or intimidate using fire or an explosive.

Michael Rezk files a discrimination lawsuit against his former employer, the Florida Department of Transportation, stemming from his July 2015 dismissal and subsequent events.æThe lawsuit alleges that an employee or employees from the Department of Transportation reported Rezq, a Coptic Christian from Egypt who became an American citizen inæ2015, to the FBI as a potential terrorist.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unidentified suspect breaks into the Islamic Center of Wisconsin in Green Bay, Wisconsin, doing minor property damage and stealingæ$1000. A second burglary occurs at the same mosque on February 3.
An unidentified suspect breaks into the Islamic Society of New River Valley (Masjid al-Ihsan) in Blacksburg, Virginia, stealingæbetween $800 and $1000.
An unidentified suspect breaks into the Anniston Islamic Center in Anniston, Alabama, stealing an undisclosed amount of cash.
An unidentified suspect breaks into the Gadsen Islamic Society in Gadsen, Alabama, stealing anæundisclosed amount of cash.
An unidentified suspect breaks into the Islamic Center of Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa, Alabama, stealing an undisclosed amount of cash and a hand-made Qur'an.æ

The office of Texas Attorney General KenæPaxton contactsæschool officials inæFrisco, Texas, to urge the protection of religious liberty in the city's schools. The letter references an unused classroom that serves as a prayer space for students of all faiths, citing (unsubstantiated) concerns that Muslim students prevented others from using the space.æBraxton and Texas Governor Greg Abbott publicize the issue without waiting for a response from school officials, who claim that the classroom has served students of all faiths for years without incident, claiming that the incident is a publicity stunt by state officials. Braxton has claimed that anti-Christian discrimination is a problem in Texas (and across the nation).

The Islamic Center of Des Moines in Des Moines, Iowa, receives a letteræclaiming that Donald Trump will cleanse America, starting with Muslims. The letter makes reference to Hitler and the holocaust.æThe same letter was sent to the Islamic Center of Claremont (CA), the Islamic Center of Long Beach (CA), the Evergreen Islamic Center in San Jose (CA), the Islamic Center of Savannah (GA), the Islamic Center of Stockton (CA), Masjid al-Kareem (RI), the Islamic Center of Ann Arbor (MI), Masjid al-Fajr Islamic Center of Greater Indianapolis (IN), the Islamic Center of Greater Miami (FL), the Islamic Center of Davis (CA), the Islamic Center of Boston in Wayland (MA), and the New Haven Islamic Center (CT).
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: ZubaidahæAlizoti, a 17-year-old US citizen and resident of Knoxville, TN, is refused entry to her return flight from Istanbul to the United States. The Transportation Security Administration blames the airline for failing to provide appropriate paperwork.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Montana House passes Senate Bill 97, which bans the application of foreign law in Montana Courts. Proponents and opponents alike referred to the bill as the Shari'a law bill in hearings, though the legislation does not mention shari'a specifically, as is the case in similar legislative efforts across the country.

Hassan Aden, a US citizen and former police official in Alexandria, Virginia, and Greenville, North Carolina, is detained at JFK airport in New York City for over an hour without an explanation. He suspects that his name triggered the detention.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Brigitte Gabriel, founder and leader of Act for America, which the Southern Poverty Law Center identifies as an anti-Muslim hate group, meets with legislative officials at the White House.

Former Senator and current CNN political commentator and head of the PAC/Superpac Patriot Voices Rick Santorum claims on CNN that much of the anti-semitism in the United States comes from Muslim communities. Santorum was responding to a question about why the current President does not denounce the anti-semitism of white nationalist extremist groups. 2017 has seen a tremendous increase in openly anti-semitic activities, including threats against Jewish Community Centers and property crimes in Jewish cemeteries.æ
Fardoso Mohamed is verablly and physically accosted in a Moorhead, Minnesota, grocery store. A man, caught on video, tells Mohamed to remove her hijab and tries to do so himself.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A woman verbally and physically assaults a Muslim woman on a sidewalk in Queens, New York.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Joshua Ruano approaches a woman and her toddler son in a park in San Francisco, California, and allegedly makes anti-Muslim comments and threatens to shoot her.æAuthorities arrest Ruano and charge him with making a criminal threat with a hate-crime enhancement.
A man points a rifle at a Muslim woman nursing her infant in a parked car outside a grocery store in Charlotte, North Carolina.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Electroimpact, an aerospaceæsupplier outside Seattle, Washington, agrees to a $485,000 settlement with the state Attorney General, who had filed a discrimination lawsuit against the company. The Attorney General's investigation found that the company's president, Peter Zieve, created a hostile work environment by offering "marriage bonuses," using company funds to organize a "mosque watch" group, and sending out company-wide emails disapraging Muslims, among other behaviors. The funds will compensateævictims of the company's discrimination, harassment,æand retaliation. Zieveæhad previously admitted involvement in an anti-mosque public campaign in April of 2016.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Republican Party of Virginia publiclyæcriticizes the state Attorney General, DemocratæMark R. Herring, for visiting theæDar al-Hijrah Islamic Center in Falls Church, Virginia. The visit was designed to reassure Muslim residents that the state will actively protect their civil rights. The Center has been at the center of controversies in the past, but numerous political leaders have visited and praised the community for its outreach and public work.

Ramtin Sabet files a discrimination lawsuit against his former employer, the North Chicago Police Department in North Chicago, Illinois, alleging that he was terminated for reporting workplace discrimination regarding his religion and national heritage. Sabet claims that he was regularly harassed publicly and privately by coworkers about being Iranian and Muslim and that his supervisors denied him training and professional development opportunities.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown suspect throws a rock and a Bible through a glass door at the Islamic Center of Fort Collins, Colorado.

Marquis Bonds, of Gainesville, Georgia, is arrested and charged with aggrevated assault after threatening Imam BilalæAli of theæGainesville Islamic Center with a rifle. Bonds's motive in the crime, part of a larger spree that day, is unclear.

Connecticut state RepresentativeæRobert Sampson introducesæHB 5547, a bill banning the application of foreign law in Connecticut courts. Similar to other bills across the country, the proposed legislation does not mention shari'a specifically, but in comments Sampson notes concerns about religious law from other countries and the need to protect the American way of life.æ
Ziggy Rzig, owner of the Pyramid Cafe in Santa Fe, New Mexico, arrives at work to find the word "Terrorist" painted in front of the restaurant.

Kelvin Porter is arrested and charged with second-degree assault after allegedly repeatedly stabbing and biting a man in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Porter reportedly told police that he was trying to kill the man because he hates Muslims.

A Muslim family returns to their home inæFairfax County, Virginia, and findsæanti-Muslim graffiti scrawled on the wall. They also find that the vandals destroyed a Qur'an and prayer books and stole valuables.

Authorities arrest Michael Lamendella and charge him withæcriminal damage to property, a felony. Lamendella is alleged to have made threats to a Long Grove, Illinois, family andæthrown rocks through the front windows of their house.æ

A man in Troutdale, Oregon, returns home to find anti-Muslim hate speech scrawled on the walls of his kitchen. He also finds a note, held in place by bullets, threatening his life. The man is Iranian American and is of theæBaha'i faith.

Paul Robinson, who is running for a seat on the Omaha, Nebraska, city council, declares that there should be no mosques in Omaha. He runs a radio add questioning the inclusion of a mosque on the Tri-Faith campus, an initiative in which a Christian, Jewish, and Muslim community will each have a house of worship on the same property.

AliaæGhandi, an Iranian national with a valid US tourist visa, is detained by Customs and Border Protection officials at Portland International Airtport before being transferred to aæcounty jail, where she was held overnight. Customs and Border Patrol officals deny that Ghandi's detention is related to the the Trump administration's immigration and refugee ban, the second version of which is under review by federal courts, but refuse to provide any further explanation.

ACT Space Coast, a local chapter of ACT for America, demands changes to a world history textbook, citing inaccurately positive portrayals of the history of Islam. The organization claims that the inaccuracies are detrimental to student development. The same textbook came under similar criticism in 2013.

A Bridgewater, NJ lawsuit filed by theæAl Falah Center is resolved after three years of dispute over the location of a mosque. Originally, the group tried to build a mosque at the site of an old inn they had purchased, but the town quickly passed a zoning ordinance that made that location impossible for a place of worship. The group sued the township, citing religious discrimination, and eventually settled foræ$5 million in damages and a different site that will be purchased by the town and traded for the original site.

Pasadena, California, Public Health DirectoræDr. Eric Walsh conceals on tax forms that he is also paid by the Southern California Conference of the Seventh-day Adventist Church, which violates his contract. In finding this information, online video sermons surface in which heæcondemns Muslims and other groups asærepresentations of Satan, and an investigation into whether these biased statements impacted his work as Public Health Director is enacted. Walsh ends up resigning.

Police arrest Robert Anthony Ruetting of Jacksonville, Florida, after allegedly  threatening his neighbor, Aied Alzaidy, and his family with guns and making violent anti-Muslim statements. Ruetting is facing charges of aggrevated assault with a deadly weapon.

Unknown suspects vandalize the Muslim prayer room in Marquette University's Alumni Memorial Union in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, in the days following the release of the President's second immigration and refugee executive order. Vandals also visited the room following 2016 presidential election. Muslim students also report a rise in hate speech on campus since the election.

Former FBI agent John Guandolo holds a week-long seminar at Camp Shelby, a jointæforces military training center in Hattiesburg, Mississippi, calledæ"Understanding and Investigating the Jihadi Threat." Guandolo runs a training and consulting group focusing on the existential threat Islam poses to the United States.æ

South Dakotaæstate SenatoræStace Nelson brings a resolution before the legislative body calling for all state agencies to cut off all contact with the Council on American Islamic Relations. Nelson claims that resolution calls attention to the real threat the organization poses to the United States. Similar efforts yielded an identical resolution in Louisiana in 2016.

Colorado stateæSenator Vicki Marble introduces Senate Billæ17-277, which seeks to ban the application of foreign law in Colorado courts. As in similar efforts throughout the country, the bill does not mention shari'a specifically, butæit is nearly identical to other ostensibly religiously neutral measures across the country meant to targer Islamic law.
Students discover anti-Muslim graffiti on a poster at the University of Southern Maine. It is the latest in a string of incidents on the Portland, Maine, campus since late 2016.

Delaware state senatorsæDave Lawson and Colin Bonini protest a Muslim-led prayer openingæa legislative session.æAftward, Lawson called the event, which featured a Qur'anically-inspired prayer, despicable.æ
Authorities arrest Zachary Todd Paul and charge him with assault and a hate crime. Paul is alleged to have choked a cab driver outside of St. Cloud, Minnesota, because of his religion.

Triceten D. Bickford is arrested by the police after attacking a woman and trying to pull off her headscarf outside of a restaurant in Bloomington, IN.æThe woman was sitting outside with her 9-year-old daughter when Bickford walked up to her and began choking her and trying to remove her headscarf while yelling "white power". Bickford was arrested and charged with intimidation, strangulation, battery, illegal consumption of alcohol by a minor, and public intoxication.

A group of men target a group of Muslim women on the University of Washington Bothell campus in Bothell, WA, demanding that they remove their hijabs. The incident was responded to by campus security and then investigated as a possible hate crime by local authorities.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Five California Muslims file a lawsuit against the U.S. government, alleging that national security measures targeting Muslims have tied up and delayed green card applications excessively.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: BobæFitzSimmonds, a Virginia GOP treasurer, steps down from his position after posting a message on Facebook questioning the contribution of Muslim Americans to American society. Despite leaving his job, he does not apologize for his comments.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Rep. John Bennett (R) of Oklahoma makes a comment that people should "be wary of individuals who claim to be Muslim American." This comment claims that the Council of American-Islamic Relations is connected to terrorist organizationsæand should not be allowed in Oklahoma.

When a member of the Islamic Center of Palm Beach in North Palm Beach, FL, arrived early in the morning for prayer they found that half of the windows in the building had been smashed by a vandal.æA trail of blood led away from the bathroom window indicating that the vandal had been injured when breaking into the building. The event was investigated as a burglary and not a hate crime.

An adopt-a-highway sign recognizing the service of a Muslim group in Austin, Texas is vandalized. The name of the mosque is blacked out with paint and a note sayingæ"A Christian Community USA" is left taped to the sign.

Robert Murino yelled anti-Muslim sentiments at the staff of the Salt & Pepper restaurant in New York, NY, before slapping one of the men and throwing a chair through the window. Murino yelled at the staff asking them if they were Muslim and if they supported ISIS. Murino was charged with criminal mischief as a hate crime and attempted assault as a hate crime.

An Uber driver in Seattle, WA, is attacked and accused of being an ISIS sympathizer by a passenger.æThe attack was captured on video by a dashboard camera.æThe assailant was arrested for assault and investigated foræmalicious harassment.æ

Akram Shibly and his fiancee, Kelly McCormick, are detained at the US-Canada border by Customs and Border Patrol agents until Shibly provides access to his phone and social media accounts. He reports having received similar treatment in past crossings,æleading him to believe that as a US citizen he is being profiled because of his religious identity.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Al Tawheed Islamic Center in Jersey City, NJ, recieves a hateful letter disparaging Muslims and telling them to get out of America. The letter called Muslims 'evil' and instructed the members of the mosque to go 'back to the desert'. This letter is one of many the center recieved leading up to this event.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A woman is kicked while waiting at a bus stop inæBrooklyn, NY. The assailant told her that he couldn't wait for the U.S to get rid of "you trash". The man ran away before the police could be called and the incident was investigated asæa bias crime.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Subway workers find "Burn the Muslims, Heil Hitler!" written on a train seat in the Coney Island Train Yard in Brooklyn, NY.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Following the use of the Arabic word "haboob," meaning "wind," to describe a sandstorm by a Texas weather station, there is an uproar on the station's Facebook page by viewers making Islamophobic comments in response to the use of the word.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Employees of the Islamic Community Center of Phoenix in Phoenix, AZ, discover broken windows and light fixtures, as long as what appears to be graffiti, early in the morning. The crime had no suspects and was investigated as criminal damage.æ

David Wright III, days after organizing an armed protest outside of the Islamic Center of Irving in Irving, TX, publishes the names and addressesæof "every Muslim and Muslim sympathizer" who spoke out against a state bill targeting the influence of Islam in America. The list was copied fromæan Irving City document and posted to Facebook. This post was followed by another post on Wright's personal Facebook supporting his right to carry weapons at protests.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: About 250 mostly armed anti-Muslim demonstrators faced-off against a crowd of roughly the same size defending the faith in front of the Islamic Community Center of Pheonix in Pheonix, AZ.æDemonstrators yelled across a police line but the protest remained peaceful. The anti-Islam protest was about halting the "tyranny" of Islam in America, and the event planner,æJon Ritzheimer, urged his fellow demonstrators to bring guns to the protest to keep them safe after he recieved a personal threat from a "terrorist". Ritzheimer had organized another protest earlier that week at the same mosque, but only a few dozen people joined him.æ
Students discover copies of the Qur'an in a toilet at the University of Texas, Dallas.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Radio personality and author Brannon Howse hosts an event in Sioux Falls, South Dakota, featuring Washington-based Pastor Shahram Hadian. Both warn attendees of the existential threat Islam poses to the United States.
An unknown suspect attacks a Muslim woman in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, demanding that she remove her headscarf, punching and kicking her, and slashing her with a knife.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A teacher at Foster High School in Richmond, TX, teaches an anti-Muslim curriculum that includes handouts that demonized Islam as muderous and content taken off of popular hate websites.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A woman is stopped at an intersection in Fort Collins, CO, when a man in the car next to her rolls down his window and begins to yell anti-Muslim sentiments.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: John David Weissinger leaves a derogatory voicemail at the San Diego, CA, headquarters of the Council on American-Islamic Relations. He is also found to have an unsent, threatening email to the council's national headquarters in Washington D. C. Weissinger eventually pleads guilty to a felony charge of making a criminal threat, with a hate-crime allegation, a misdemeanor hate-crime charge as well as possession of an illegal assault rifle.

Two menæmake threats on Facebook alluding to shooting and killing Muslims at the Mosque Foundation in Bridgeview, IL. The post was shared with the public after the men turned themselves in to the Bridgeview police, though both men were released without charge after being interviewed by the local authorities.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The American Muslim Community Organizationæin Lake in the Hills, IL, recieves a threatening letter that references bombing the mosque and praying for a civil war.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A man is attacked after being heard speaking to his children inæArabic in a grocery store in Dearborn, MI. Witnesses recal hearing the attackers shouting derogatory statements about Muslims and ISIS. No charges were ever filed and the FBI determined there was insufficient evidence to call the incident a hate crime.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
