Event Description: A legal resident of New York, who is also an Afghani citizen, is deniedæentry onto a plane that he has a ticket for and is informed that he is on the no-fly list. After questioning by the FBI, the officers offer him US citizenship and compensation if he agrees to work with them.æWhen he refuses, the FBI keeps him on the no-fly listæin order to pressure him to be an informant, according to a lawsuit the man files.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic School of Rhode Island in West Warwick, RI, is found graffitied with anti-Islamic sentiments. The graffiti included "F*** Allah Now This is a Hate Crime". There were no suspects found.

A Muslim cab driver in St. Louis sues his employer afteræreceiving numerous tickets for wearing traditional Muslim attire instead of a white button down shirt and black slacks.æThe company slightly modifies the policy, but does not completely account for his religious dress requirements.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Anti-Muslim graffiti is found on the side of the Skyview Middle School in Bothell, WA, on the same weekend as similar graffiti is found on a local Hindu temple. The grafitti included a swastikaæalong with the message "Muslims get out".

Anthony Torres fatally shoots and seriously injures two customers atæOmar Wheels & Tires in Dallas, TX.æTorres drove to the store looking for a specific employee and began shooting when the employee was not there. According to the police Torres specifically used the word Muslim as he was shooting. Torres was charged with murder and aggravated assault.æ

Andrew Burke of Shrewsbury, Massachusetts,æattempts to break into the Islamic Center of Worcester. He is arrested and charged withædefacement of property,æattempting to commit a crime, andæcausing property damage for the purpose of intimidation.

Dave Agema, a Republican National Committee Member and former Michigan state representative, is pressured to step down by colleagues following Facebook posts that question if Muslims have ever positively contributed to "the American way of life."æ

A drunken passenger verbally harasses and punches Harkirat Singh, a Sikh cab driver in New York City, New York, making comments refering to stereotypes about Middle Eastern identities. The incident ends with the passenger stealing Singh's turban.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A man attacks a 14-year-old at the Perimeter Mall in Dunwoody, Georgia, calling her a terrorist and ripping the headscarf off of her head.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unidentified suspect or suspects vandalizes the sign of the Islamic Center of Hattiesburg in Hattiesburg, Mississippi. The Center has been the subject of anti-Muslim acitivity in the past. In 2014, an unknown suspect or suspects fired multiple shots at the building.

Anthony Delfillipo, a city councilman in North Miami Beach, Florida, posts a discredited story claiming that the Supreme Court had banned any presentation of information about Islam from public schools to his social media account. When confronted by constituents about the Islamophobic nature of the story, Delfillipoæcontinues to defend the article and his post.
An unidentified suspect spray-paintsæa large X on the doors of theæBosnian Islamic Cultural Center in the Richmond Hills section of Queens, New York. The act is caught on security video.
An unknown suspect etches an anti-Muslim message in a men's bathroom stall on the campus of California State University, Long Beach. The message threatens to kill all Muslims.
Two unknown suspects verbally harass and rob a Muslim student at San Diego State University. The two men allegedly referenced Donald Trump and made anti-Muslim comments during the attack.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Michigan state Representative Michele Hoitenga introduces legislation banning the application of foreign law in state legal proceedings. As with similar legislation across the country, the bill does not mention shari'a specifically, though in an email to colleagues seeking co-sponsors Hoitenga states in clear terms that the bill applies to Islamic law.

An unidentified white man in his 20s grabs a Muslim student by her hijab at San Diego State University in San Diego, CA, andæmakes anti-Muslim comments, including calling the student a terrorist.æThe incident was investigated by the local police but the perpetrator was not found.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Noor Islamic Cultural Center in Dublin, OH, recieves threatening calls and emails all throughout the month of January, starting with a call in which an unknown man threatened to destroy the center.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A lone protestor arrives at the Noor Islamic Cultural Center in Dublin, OH, after much anticipation for a large anti-Muslim rally, only to find that she is the only one who came to the protest organized as part of the movement "Global Rally for Humanity". This scheduled anti-Islam protest comes in the wake of months of threatening phonecalls to the center. The woman tells the crowd gathered in counter-protest that she cannot be friends with a Muslim, but is confused that no one else showed up to theæanti-Muslim demonstration.æ

The Williamson County school board in Williamson County, TN, proposes a resolution that would allow parents, taxpayers, and members of the school board to review curriculum and test materials before they are distributed to students. This resolution was proposed after parents and school board members expressed fear that a World History course was pro-Islam and had a religious-bias against Judaism and Christianity. The resolution includes stipulations that teachers not use material created by terrorist organizations, or materials that supported terrorist organizations. The resolution was tabled as there was no evidence that Islam was being taught more in classes than Judaism or Christianity.

Darryl Ferguson is arrested and charged with arson for setting the Quba Islamic Institute in Houston, TX, on fire.æFerguson was charged withæfelony first degree arson, though he claimed that the fire was set by accident, as he is a homeless man who lit a fire in an empty building to stay warm at night. The incident was investigated as a hate crime, and a witness at a local storeætold the police that they overheard Ferguson making inflammatory statements about terrorists.æThe mosque leaders eventually requested that the Harris County District Attorney's Office drop charges, thoughæFerguson is still facing a 25-year minimum sentence for his many offenses.

Jody Hice, a Baptist minister and candidate for the Georgia House of Representatives, makes public claims that Islam isænot a real religion and therefore "does not deserve First Amendment protection."

The Masjid of Ivy City in Washington, D.C, is broken into and vandalized.æMosque staff came into the mosque in the morning and found that shelves with holy books on them were broken and that a chair was used to break plate glass. The incident was not investigated as a hate crime.æ

The staff of the Masjid of Ivy City in Washington, D.C, arrive at the mosque to find that the sound system had been flipped upside down and that a large picture of the Kaaba, a shrine at the Grand Mosque in Mecca and IslamÍs holiest site, had been stolen. The incident was not investigated as a hate crime.

William Celli is arrested in his home in Richmond, CA, after making explosives in his home and targeting a Muslim community. The arrest was preceeded by many instances of Celli posting anti-Muslim statemets and threats on social media. The local police received a tip that Celli was manufacturing explosives, leading the Walnut Creek bomb squad to evacuate his neighborhood and search his house, finding an undetonated pipe bomb in Celli's home. Celli was officially charged with possession of an explosive device andæcriminal threat.
An unidentified suspect breaks into Masjid Bilal ibn Rabah in Maricopa, Arizona, stealing an undisclosed amount of money.
An unidentified suspect breaks into the Islamic Center of East Valley in Chandler, Arizona, stealing an undisclosed amount of money.

A high schooler inæHaines City, Florida is repeatedly bullied for wearing a hijab to school.æShe had no problems with her peers before she started wearing her hijab in December, and each time an incident occurs her mother contacts the principal. The school releases a statement in Februaryæaddressing the safety and welfare of the student.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Residents of Port St. Lucie, Florida, decry the possibility of a new mosque in the city at a City Council meeting. In opposing the mosque, the residents cite the likelihood that those attending the mosque will seek to harm the community. The City Council does not need to approve the project unless it exceeds 3000 sq. ft.

Leyla Hashi files an anti-discrimination lawsuit against SEI/Aaron's, Inc., a rent-to-own furniture and appliance business. Hashi alleges that she was wrongfully terminated from her job at the Aaron's location in Portland, Maine, after a history of harassment related to her religious identity.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Six residents of an apartment building in Lackawanna, New York, are hospitalized after suffering injuries in a fire that authorities label suspicious. The building is owned by the Lackawanna Islamic Mosque and houses Muslim families. There was an earlier incident at the same address on April 7, when someone lit a phonebook on fire on the front porch.æ

Authorities charge Sergeant MajoræDamien Rodrigues with harassment, disorderly conduct, and intimidation after he used racial slurs and allegedly assaulted a server at Dar Salaam, a restaurant in Portland, Oregon.æ
Pieces of raw bacon are found in the parking lot and wrapped around the door handles of the Islamic Society of Edmond in Edmond, OK.
Two windows are found shattered at the Islamic Society of Stillwater in Stillwater, OK. The police suspect the windows were shattered by a BB gun.

Spokane Police forward a graffiti report to their Joint Terrorism Task Force for investigation after "Death to Islam" is found graffitied on the side of theæBosnia and Herzegovina Heritage Association of Spokane in Spokane, WA, while worshippers were inside praying. æ
A teenager is arrested and charged with property damage after he was caught on surveillance cameras smashing the glass front door of theæMasjid An-Nur mosque in Roanoka, VA.

A surveillanceævideo shows two men throwing small stones at the side door of the Islamic Center of Omaha,æNE, and eventually throwing a largeæstone that succeeds in shattering the glass door. No arrests were made.

Farkhan Mahmodd Shah, an employee of American Airlines, files an anti-discrimination suit alleging that he has suffered from harassment and a hostile work environment due to his religious identity. The suit claims that despite frequent reports to human resources, the company took no action to curb the abuse and that the FBI visted his home to ask about his intentions toward other employees.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unidentified woman yells threatening anti-Muslim remarks at a Muslim woman in the Bronx in New York City, New York.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Worshippers arrive at the Islamic School of Miami, FL, and find a ceramic skull placed on top of the mosque's main entrance sign. They also found boquets of flowers typically left at grave sites, a wooden cross withæAmerican flag sunglasses,æa cable cutter, and a can of green spray paint that matched grafitti sprayed on the mosque's fence.

A customer at Trader Joe's in Reston, Virginia, verbally harasses and taunts a Muslim woman, expressing regret that the United States allowed the woman (who was born in the United States) to enter the country and suggesting that she was in trouble now that Obama (who is Muslim, according to the harasser) is no longer in office.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Washington state man posts the address and phone number of a San Diego Unified School Board member to sical media in response to the district's new anti-Islamophobia curriculum. The post does not target a Muslim individual or community, but it includes video links to Islamophobic web sites and Islamophobic public statements opposing the new curriculum, which seeks to educate students about Islam in an attempt to reduce bullying of Muslim students. In addition to posting the board member's personal information, the post ends with "Have at it, boys."

Voters in Shrewsbury, MA, receive a mailer on the eve of local elections urging them to vote against Rashid Shaikh, a candidate for the city's Board of Selectmen. The mailer besmirchesæMr. Shaikh's business and his family before urging voters to reject "any Muslim person...ruling our communities." Mr. Shaikh experienced bias in his previous campaigns for local office.

The Plan Commission in Village of Somers, Wisconsin, votes to table consideration of zoning and land use changes for a proposed mosque project after community members voice opposition. Many of those opposed to the project express anti-Muslim sentiments.
Oghenetega Edah, a substitute teacher at PS 76 in Bronx, New York,æforcefully removes the headscarf of Safa Alzockary, an 8-year-old student.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Police arrest Alexander Jennes Downing on a South Padre Island, Texas, beach after he berates a Muslim family, taunting them about the superiority of Christianity, the power of Donald Trump, and what it means to be a real American. The entire incident is caught on video.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Students discover a vulgar anti-Muslim cartoon posted in a University of North Carolina, Charlotte, dorm.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Secure Michigan event at the public library in Alma, Michigan, abruptly ends when the organization's communications director, Dick Manasseri, tells an audience member to shut up in response to a question about interpretative difference in Muslim communities. Secure Michigan is an anti-shari'a organization. The event was sponsored by theæGratiot County Republican Party.

Police in Eugene, Oregon, arrestæChad Everett Russell, after he allegedly threatens to kill worshipers leaving the Islamic Center of Eugene. He is booked on charges ofæintimidationæ(religion), menacing, disorderly conduct,æintimidation, harassment, and carrying a concealed weapon (knife).

Police are called to the Islamic School of Miami, FL, when workers find a suspicious package, two glasses, and a laptop left on the property. This is the third time in three weeks the police have been called about suspicious items left at the school. A bomb squad examined the package, after evacuating all of the children and staff from the school. After the police left, the suspect, Henri Thomas Borno, returned to the school and began to drive recklessly, almost striking children with his car. Borno is arrested for all of the suspicious activity at the school, but committed for mentalæhealth treatment under Florida's Baker Act. The police released Borno with a warning not to tresspass again, and no official charges.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic Community Center of Pheonix, AZ, recieves a threatening letter in the mail from a group calling themselves "Patriotic Friends" that quotes the bible and makes numerous threats to kill the imams of the center. The letter also threatened to burn down all American mosques, and claimed that the Pheonix mosque was beingæmonitored. The Islamic Community Center of Tempe, AZ, recieved a similar letter from the same group the day after the Pheonix mosque.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic Community Center of Tempe, AZ, recieves a threatening letter from a group calling themselvesæ"Patriotic Friends" that threatens to kill the Imams and their families, quotes the bible, and threatens violence against all Muslims in the United States. The letter was sent the day after a similar letter was received at the Islamic Community Center of Pheonix.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Syed Ali, a combat veteran and major in the United States Army Reserve and an officer in the New York Police Department, is held without explanation at JFK airport in New York City upon his return from a trip abroad. Customs and Border Patrol officers took his passport and threatened detention when he asked why he was being held.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Detroit Fire Department places aæcaptain on unpaid administrative leave (pending an investigation) after community members report racist and Islamophobic posts on his social media.æThe Council on American Islamic Relations recently filed a complaint with the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commissionæagainst the captain, claiming that he mistreated a Muslim paramedic.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A 15-year-old male student atæthe High School for Law Enforcement and Public Safety in Jamaica, Queens, verbally harasses and attempts to pull off the headscarf of a 16-year-old female Muslim student. Authorities charge the student (as a juvenile)æwith aggravated harassment andædisorderly conduct.

ACT for American holds an event in Rapid City, South Dakota,æwarning about the threat of Islam. Featured speakeræWilliam Federer, a conservative Christian radio personality, argued that Islamæis built on a foundation of bloodshed and wondered whether Muslims can be loyal American citizens.æAlso speaking at the event, Amy Wilson, spokesperson for the local ACT for American chapter, described the organization's attempts to spread the love of Christ by converting Muslims to Christianity.æSouth Dakota Attorney General MartyæJackley and Secretary of State Shantel Krebs were in attendance.

Jeremy Joseph Christian stabs three men, killing two, on a Portland, Oregon, transit train. The three victims, Rick John Best, Taliesin Myrddin Namkai-Meche, and Micah David-Cole Fletcher, intervened as Christian, known to authorities for hate speech and extremist views, verbally assaulted two women of color, one of whom is Muslim, spewing anti-Muslim sentiments and other epithets. Christian is charged in the deaths of Best and Namkai-Meche.

Bayonne Muslims,æan organization representing Muslims in Bayonne, New Jersey, files a lawsuit in federal court alleging that theæcity and the zoning board acted in discriminatory fashion by rejecting its zoning ordinance waiver application in 2016 as it attempted to refashion an empty warehouse into a community center with mosque and soup kitchen.æAnti-Muslim rhetoric from community activists played a significant role in communicating opposition to the project.

The Brazoria County Democratic Party releases a campaign video that shows anti-Muslim social media posts fromæWoody Owens, a former member of and current Republican candidate for theæPearland City Council in Pearland, Texas. Owens is running for the open seat againstæDalia Kasseb.
In Portland, Oregon, a man follows a couple in his car, screaming anti-Muslim invectives and mimicking pulling the trigger of a gun.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: George L. Hodges, a planning board candidate in Walpole, MA, is alleged to have made anti-Muslim posts to social media.

An online threat of arson is sent to the Muslim Community Center of Northeast Tennessee in Johnson City, Tennessee, prompting theæCouncil of American-Islamic Relations to call for federal hate crime investigations of both this threat and a concurrent incident of vandalism at the Masjid An Nur Islamic Center in Roanoke, Virginia.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Members of the Louisville Islamic Center in Louisville, Kentucky, arrive at the mosque to find it graffitied with phrases such as "this is for France" and "Nazis speak arabic". This event happened a week after someone ripped apart theæQuran in front of this same community.
An unidentified person rips apart the Quran in front of the Islamic Center in Louisville, Kentucky.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: As part of the Global Rally for Humanity, a national event originally conceived by organizer Jon Ritzheimer as a counter movement for the 20th anniversary celebration of the Million Man March in Washington D.C,æWilliam Teague arrives at the Khursheed Unissa Memorial Community Center in Amarillo, Texas, to protest Islam in the United States. He was wearing symbols of the KKK and the confederate flag, and was the only anti-Islam protestor to arrive. After hearing about the protests, around 100 people also came to the mosque to stand in solidarity with the Muslim community. This event was planned alongside 19 other anti-Islam rallies at mosques around the country.

As part of the Global Rally for Humanity, a national event originally conceived by organizer Jon Ritzheimer as a counter movement for the 20th anniversary celebration of the Million Man March in Washington D.C, a dozen protestors, some armed with rifles, arrive at the Henry Ford Centennial Library in Dearborn, Michigan, to protest Islam in the United States.æSigns carried by the protestors contained messages such as "stop the islamitization of America" and "no more refugees".æTwo seperate groups also arrived in counter-protest to the Global Rally for Humanity, a communist group, and a pro-gun group who wished to express solidarity with Muslim communities. Both sides were carrying weapons.

A high school student punches another student crossing the street after calling him a terrorist near Saline high school in Saline, Michigan.æThe student, Daryl Larkin, was charged with one count of ethnic intimidation and could receive a maximum of two years in prison and a $5,000 fine.

Adam Smock and two others spray-paint the walls and burn copies of the Qur'an in front of the Islamic Center of Springfieldæin Springfield, Missouri. Smock pled guilty to the charge of conspiracy to oppress, threaten and intimidate worshipers. He was sentenced to 14 days in jail and ordered to pay $10,440 of restituion.

Randolph Linn sets fire to the second-floor prayer rug at the Islamic Center of Greater Toledo in Perrysburg, Ohio, after walking through each room in the mosque with a gun in hand checking for people. He pleaded guilty to one count each of intentionally defacing, damaging, and destroying religious property, using a fire to commit a felony, and using and carrying a firearm to commit a crime of violence. He said in court that he had been specifically motivated to drive from his Indiana home to commit this act "to get some payback for Americans that had been killed" by terrorists.
An anonymous billboard appears on Interstate 465 in Indianapolis, Indiana, claiming to correct the record about the Prophet Muhammad, presenting select information about his life in negative fashion.

School officials inæthe Rosemon-Apple Valley-Egan (Minnesota) district place a security specialist on administrative leave after a Muslim student alleges that he treated her unfarily during an altercation with another student. The alleged victim claims that the other student called her a terrorist and, when she retaliated, the security specialist grabbed her and removed her headscarf in the ensuing scuffle. The district also initially suspended the alleged victim, before reinstating her shortly thereafter.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unidentified man is reported to the police by his family after making threats against the Islamic Association ofæNorth Texas in Richardson, Texas. The police and the FBI monitored the man after receiving the report,ædisclosing that the man had threatened to "disrupt the peace" at the mosque. The police determined that the man was not an immediate threat, and declined communicating any further details of the man's threat against the mosque.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Cameron S. Cappella and Derrik M. Demone are arrested after spraypainting "USA" on the side of the Islamic Center of Burlington, Massachusetts, and accused of malicious destruction of property over $250, and tagging property.æThis crime was investigated as a hate crime, but ultimately the two men were only charged with commiting vandalism.
A man wearing a mask is photographed by security cameras throwing aæboulder at the window of the Islamic Center of Omaha, Nebraska.

Jedediah Stout confesses to setting fire to the Islamic Society of Joplin mosque in Joplin, Missouri. The fire, which completely burned the mosque to the ground, was Stout's second attempt at arson at that mosque in a month. The mosque's security cameras were destroyed in the fire, but security footage after the first attempt showed a man, later identified as Stout, throwing an incendiary object onto the roof of the mosque. Stout was charged with and pleaded guilty to arson and damage to religious property.
TheæIslamic Center of Twin Falls, Idaho, is vandalized with the words "Hunt Camp?" The incident was reported to the Twin Falls Police, and a detective assigned to the case.

An unknown man is caught on camera wrapping raw bacon around the door handles on both sides of the Masjid-e-Tawheed mosque in Las Vegas, Nevada. The incident was invesitagated as a possbile hate crime.

In the midst of an armed robbery of Bottlenecks Food and Drink shop in Grand Rapids, Michigan, an unknown gunmanætakes an Indian American employee into a back room and tells him "I shot people like you in the middle east". The gunman then put his gun in the employees mouth and called the employee a terrorist, going on to assert that the employee worked for the Islamic State. The employee survived being shot by struggling for the rifle, but the gunman got away from the store without being arrested and with an undisclosed amount of money.æPolice investigated the crime as an armed robbery.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: David Conrad, 51, shoots a "high-velocity air rifle" at the Muslim Education Center in Morton Grove, Illinois,æduring a Friday night prayer service in Ramadan. Conrad did not injure or kill any of the people inside the mosque, but damaged some of the walls in the mosque and left holes there. In addition, Conrad had allegedly madeæstatements against the building and expansion of the mosque æin 2003 and 2004, when the mosque was being debated for expansion, saying that it had no place in the neighborhood, an incident some speculated may have still lingered with Conrad. æConrad was charged with three counts of aggravated discharge of a firearm and one count of criminal damage to property. æ

A threatening email is sent to the Islamic Center of Lexington, Kentucky. The email containedæthe message ñI'm going to kill everyone I there [sic] you Muslim f**ks. Salabis is coming for you." The threat was sent from the personal email account of Anthony Catapano, who was subsequently charged with third-degree terroristic threatening.

Lisa Sallaj and her son accidently cut somebody off in their car in Murfreesboro, Tennesse, and the driver yells anti-Muslim slurs at them. He displayed a knife through the window, yelled anti-Islamic statements, and threatened to kill to Sallaj and her son.æ

Ebadi survived the incident after his son took him to the hospital.

Georgia state SenatoræMichael Williams, a Republican candidate for governor, poses with members ofæGeorgia Security Force III%, after an anti-shari'a rally. The militiaæis known for armed anti-mosque protests.
Authorities investigate a fire at Boo Boo's Drive Thru in Mathis, Texas, as a suspected hate crime after the owners receive anti-Muslim threats suggesting that a fire at the store wasæimminent.

Event Description: Abdullahi Dahir andæAbdifatahæHassan file suit against UPS andæDoherty Staffing Solutions for religious discrimination. The plaintiffsæallege that a new supervisor, departing from previous practice, refused to make accommodationsæfor the religious practices of Muslim employees. They claim that the supervisor singled out Muslim employees in public settings to suggest that he would replace them because they refused to comply with his rules.

Event Description: Patrick Keogan makes threats on the Facebook page of the Islamic Society of Boston Cultural Center in Boston, Massechusetts. The post was addressed "hello scumbags" with a smiling emoji, and had a photo attached of a symbol of a mosque burning with the accompanying text "burn your local mosque". Keogan allegedly posted the same image on the Facebook page of the Islamic Society of Northeastern University. Further investigations into Keogan's online activity revealed a long history of threatening mosques and anti-Muslim sentiments. When investigators searched Keogan's home, they found a large collection of weapons, with court papers listing some 49 rifles, shotguns, and pistols seized. Keogan eventually pleaded guilty to making a threat over Facebook to injure or intimidate another individual or to unlawfully damage or destroy a building by means of fire, being a convicted felon in possession of ammunition, and child pornography.æ

A dozen members of a group calling itself the Bureau of American Islamic Relations protested in front of the Islamic Center of Irving, Texas. They had guns, a flag, a Ted Cruz sign, and a sign that read ñStop the Islamization of America.î

68 year-old Amrik Singh Bal is assaulted and then run over with a car while walking to work in Fresno, California.æDaniel Coronel Wilson Jr. allegedly said to his friend,æAlexis Mendoza, ñISIS. Terrorist. LetÍs get himî before physically attacking Bal, an elderly Sikh man.æAs Bal tried to get away from his assailants, they climbed into a car and ran him over. Bal sustainedæa broken collarbone, cuts on his head and to one of his ears, and a swollen jaw.æThe assault was captured on a security camera, and Wilson was found guilty of felony assault causing great bodily injury to Bal, and the assault was ruled a hate crime.

Thomas Giese shouts anti-Muslim threats and sentiments at a convenience store clerk at a Ravi Food Mart in South Kingstown, Rhode Island. Mohamed Ahmed Radwan is escorted off an American Airlines flight flying from Charlotte to Detroit after he made a flight attendant "uncomfortable". The 23-year old college student left the restruant to buyæa pack of cigarettesæwhen two tipsy men told him he looked like a "terrorist." Hadjeres tried to ignore the two men, but got into a physicalæaltercationæand was able to fight off the two men.

Many of the events attract white nationalist groups and militias as well as significant counter-protests. 597 residents of Somers, Wisconsin, submit a petition to village administrators advocating that a rezoning proposal around a mosque be placed on an election ballotæfor popular vote rather than proceed through the typical planning commission process. Owned by the Islamic Society of Southeast Wisconsin, the 21 acres included in the rezoning proposal are part of 2000 acres that the Southeast WisconsinæRegional Planning Commission designated "prime farmland"æin 2013. The development of any portion of such land requiresæa variance. A May 2017 public hearing around the proposal featured significant anti-Muslim sentiment.

Leaflets promoting the Klu Klux Klan, as well as anti-gay, anti-immigrant, and racist rhetoric, are distributed outside of the Baymeadows Islamic Center, as well as other residential buildings in Jacksonville, Florida.

A plan to turn a dormant industrial site into a mosque facesæopposition from local residents in Bayonne, New Jersey. The Bayonne Muslim Community, a nonprofit organization, was seeking approval from the Zoning Board of Adjustmentæfor any necessary renovations. Local residents voiced their displeasure by creating the Facebook page Neighbors United Against Building the Mosque, which quickly grew toæ599 members.æThe opposition was organized around ideas that the mosque was funded by oil and terrorist activity, that Muslims were "infiltrating" their community, and that the presence of the mosque would make people "uncomfortable".

The U.S Justice Department files a lawsuit against Pittsfield Township, Michigan, alleging it unlawfully denied a religious group the right to build an Islamic school on a vacant plot of land. The township denied zoning approval to the Michigan Islamic Academy, which wants to build a school on undeveloped land in, violating the Religious Land æUse and Institutionalized Persons Act.
Anti-Islam posters associated with theæ"Stop the Jihad on Campus" campaign are found on the campus of American University in Washington, D.C.

Anti-Islam posters associated with the "Stop the Jihad on Campus" campaign and that link Muslim student associations and Students for Justice in Palestine with terrorism are posted around the campus of the University of California, Los Angeles.æ

The American Freedom Defense Initiative, a known anti-Islam organization, hosts The Muhammad Art Exhibit and Cartoon Contest in Garland, Texas. The event, which organizer and anti-Muslim activist Pamela Geller noted was intentionally provocative, featured a speech byæanti-Muslim Dutch politician Geert Wilders and military-style security. Towards the end of the event, two armed gunmen arrived in a car and began shooting at the venue, wounding an unarmed security guard. Police, who were assisting with security at the event, shot and killed both suspects.

Three men beat up a Muslim taxi driver and yell "we will f- you up like we f- up your country" at him in Newport Beach, California.æA woman at a cigar lounge called a cab, and as she was talking to the driver, three men walked out of the lounge and screamed at the driver. They then entered the cab,æalong with the owner of the lounge, held the man in a headlock, and continuously punched him.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A group of protestersæarrive at the Texas Muslim Capitol Day at the state capitol in Austin, Texas, and begin to shout anti-Islam sentiments and hate speech at the assembled crowd.æ

Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University Police Department receive a report concerning graffiti that had been left inside a bathroom stall on the campus in Blacksburg, Virginia. The graffiti read "I will be here 11/11/2015 to kill all muslims (sic)". The police alerted the campus and the graffiti was investigated, though no suspect was found.æ

An unidentified person spray-paints "He is dead"æand a happy face on the wall of a construction site for a mosque in Brooklyn, New York. This vandalism comes four days after the killing of Osama bin Laden.
In Rochester, Minnesota, somebody spray-paints "KKK" and a swastika on the side of the home of a Somali immigrant home. No suspects have been identified.

Gerald Prebe purposely hits Terry Butler,æa public services technician, in a hit and run in Clearwater, Florida. Prebeæstated later that he wanted to murder Butler because he assumed he was a terroist andæcould have been of Middle Eastern descent. Butler is African-American. Prebe has been arrested and charged with attempted murder.

Unidentified vandals were caught on security camera shooting paintballs at the doors of the Grand Mosque in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma. The mosque's imam said that he could hear the vandals shooting and thought that they were "shooting bullets," before he quickly came to the mosque and saw that they had been paintballs. The vandals fled before the imam arrived and before they could have been identified.

Two women were seen throwing pig legs onto the temporary prayer area as worshippers were leaving prayer at a proposed mosque site in Ontario, California. The center's chairman said that a guard had seen the two women throw pork legs onto the site before speeding away in a white pickup. Additionally, the incident was likely part of a larger opposition to the building of this proposed mosque by some residents in the area. The incidentæis being investigated as a hate crime.æ

Four male teenagers are charged with throwing lemons at the American Muslim Association mosque in Hayward, California, while worshippers were inside for prayer. æAt least one person was hit in the arm by the lemons. The suspects fled the scene, but were later arrested and charged with defacing property and "interfering with the civil rights of the worshippers."

A man is seen walking up to the sign of the Masjid Al-Islam mosque in North Smithfield, Rhode Island, before struggling with a piece of it, eventually ripping it off, taking it, putting it in his car, and driving away. The incident was being investigated as vandalism and as a possible hate crime, and the leaders of the mosque congregation requested the help of the FBI to deal with the case.

Someone throws a 7-Up bottle filled with household chemicals- described as a "homemade MacGyver bomb"- at the College Preparatory School of America in Lombard, Illinois, as worshippers are inside for a night prayer. The bomb caused a loud bang, but no injuries, as the bomb had failed to pierce the window and exploded outside. No suspects had been charged in connection to the attack.æ

The construction of a mosque in Sheepshead Bay in Brooklyn, New York is challenged in court by The Bay People. This group is considered an anti-mosque organizaton, and they argued that members of the mosque had connections to terrorism. There was no evidence to support the claim, and Judge mark Partnow ruled that the consruction should continue. æ

An unknown person spray-paintsæcurse words, a phallic symbol, and references to Allah being gay on the side of the Islamic Centeræof Springfield in Springfield, Missouri. Members of the community notified the local police and the FBI to the incident, and they reported that it will cost up to $1,000 to remove the graffiti. No suspects have been identified. æ

Joseph Brignola uses a lighter andæpaper to light the handicap access ramp of the Islamic Society of Greater Worcester on fire in Worcester, Massachusetts.æA neighbor called the police, and officers came to stomp out the fire. The lower portion of a support column was damaged in addition to the ramp.æBrignola was arrested on the street and charged withæburning a building and damages to a churchæor synagogue.æ

Gerald Sloane Wallace leaves an expletive-filled voice mail at the Muslim Communities Association of South Florida, a mosque in Miami Gardens, Florida. Wallace threatens to shoot and kill members of the community, leading authorities to charge him with threatening to injure.æ

Yussuf Awadir Abdi returns to Salt Lake City, Utah, with his wife and kids after having been refused re-entry to the United States after visiting his native Kenya. Abdi, a US citizen, is the imam at the Madina Masjid Islamic Center in Salt Lake City.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Asad Khan, owner of Zaza Bar and Bites, in Galveston, Texas, announces that he is closing his restaurant because of persistent threats. The establishment has been subject to multiple instances of anti-Muslim vandalism in the past, and Khan suggested that recently he has been receiving death threats.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Marvin Meyer calls Sufyan Sohel, a civil rights attorney for the Council and American Islamic Relations,æand threatens to kill him if he does not move back to Syria. Sohel, whose parents immigrated to the United States from India, is American-born. Authorities charge Meyer with a felony hate crime and misdemeanor count of a telephone threat.

Authorities charge Kenneth Sjarpe with malicious and felony harassment for a May incident in Bellevue, Washington, in which he verbally harasses, threatens to kill, and narrowly avoids hitting three men with his car.æHe repeatedly made it clear that the incident was motivated by anti-Muslim animus.
Oregon State Senator Brian Boquist, R-Dallas, introducesæSenate Bill 176 which prohibits courts from applying Shari'a law.æ

South Carolina State Representative Chip Limehouse,æR-Charleston, introducesæthe H3521 Bill whichæseeks to keep Islamic and other foreign laws out of South Carolina courts.æThe bill is called the "Sharia Law bill" in discussions of the bill, and supporters of the bill use arguments ofæa war against radical Islam asæthe impetus for the legislation.

Arkansas Rep. Brandt Smith,æR-Jonesboro, introduces House Bill 1474,æwhich he calls "American Laws for American Courts", and which aims to protect American courts from foreign law. While, like similar bills nationwide, this bill does not explicitly mention Shari'a Law,æthe rhetoric surrounding the bill is anti-Shari'a and Shari'a Law is seen as the focus of the legislation.

The Arkansas State Senate passes Senate Bill 229, whichædeclares american laws for american courts, or bans foreign law in the american court system.æThis bill is similar to other measures around the country to target Shari'a Law.æ

House File 135 is introduced to the Iowa House of Representatives. The billæaimed to protect Iowa residents from the application of foreign laws when it would have violated their constitutional rights.æThis bill is similar to other measures around the country to target Shari'a Law.

Darwin Martinez Torres allegedly kills Nabra Hassanen, a teenager fromæReston, Virginia. Hassanen was on her way to the All Dulles Area Muslim Society with a group of friends for Ramadan celebrations, walking along a heavily-trafficked road. Circumstances are unclear, but reports suggest that Martinez Torres, who was driving, began yelling and throwing bottles at the group, later following them into a parking lot and chasing them, during which time police believe he struck Hassanen with a bat. He is alleged to have dumped her body some miles away. Authorities have charged Martinez Torres in the case.

An unidentified person throws a rock through a glass door of a La Mirada mosque in La Mirada, California.æNobody was injured, and the incident was reported to the police, although no suspects have been arrested.æ

An Idaho child support bill is rejected by the Idaho House of Representatives because it includes an international treaty for extracting child support payments from abroad that House Republicans fear invites Islamic Law into American courts. æ

An anti-Shari'a house bill, filed by Representative Jeff Leach, R-Plano,æis presented to the Texas House of Representatives in Austin, Texas.æThe bill itself aims to control the influence of foreign laws in American court systems, but is referred to as the Anti-Sharia law House Bill 562.

Texas State Representative Molly White, R-Belton, writes a Facebook post on Texas Muslim Capitol Day stating that anyone who visits her officeæin Austin, Texas, would be asked to "renounce Islamic terrorist groups and publicly announce allegiance to America and our laws."

Carolyn Walker-Diallo, a judge who was elected in BrooklynÍs 7th Municipal District, took her oath of office using the Quran inæBrooklyn, New York. A video of the ceremony was posted online with immediate anti-Muslim backlash, including accusations that Walker-Diallo would uphold Islamic Law rather than "American" law.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Brooklyn Civil Court Judge Carolyn Walker-Diallo recieves two threatening phonecalls after she is sworn into office using the Quran in Brooklyn, New York. The two calls, which came minutes apart, both called Walker-Diallo a terrorist and asserted that she was not American, and then threatenedæ"we are going to get you."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Representative Steve King, Republican of Iowa,æsays on air on MSNBC that Representative Keith Ellison should be asked when taking an oath to support and defend the Constitution: ñWhich is superior: the Constitution or Shariah law?î Ellison is one of only two Muslim Congresspeople.æ
Dallas City Councilor Micky Garus posts an anti-Muslim statement on his campaign's Facebook page in Dallas, Oregon. The post contained hate speech and called Islam "pure evil".

Wakulla County Commission Chairman Ralph Thomasæposts a photo of a group of Muslim men praying on a beach along with a caption conveying surprise at seeing them there. The photo immediately garners significant negative and anti-Muslim responses online, while also prompting radio-host and a Wakulla County Sheriff candidate,æWill Dance, to urge his listeners to go toæthe Wakulla County commissioners meeting in Crawforville, Florida, to share concerns and anti-Muslim sentiments.

Beth Van Duyne, Mayor of Irving, Texas, posts a long Facebook messageæresponding to a controversy centered around about a Muslim mediation panel comprised of arbitrators settling civil disputes using Sharia law in non-binding decisions. The postæis anti-Sharia, and asserts that the existence of this panelæñviolates public policy, statutory, or federal lawsî and that she and her staff are working toæfight the presence of Islam in Irving.æ

Tennessee State Representative Susan Lynn, R-Mt. Juliet,æintroduces a "no-go zone" bill in Nashville, Tennessee. The bill does not explicitly mention Muslims, but was written in the midst of an international fervor over the concept of Muslims allegedly banning people from going to certain areas, including entire cities.æThe Senate sponsor of the bill, Bill Ketron, R-Murfreesboro, asserted that he had seen these Muslim "no-go zones" on a recent trip to Europe.æ

Hundreds of people protestæa fundraising event held by the Islamic Circle of North America Relief in Yorba Linda, California. The group was raising money for various social programs relating to women's shelters and homelessness. The protesters were yelling "go home" and "no Sharia law," and many of them were singing patriotic songs. The protesters said that they were angry because the event's keynote speakers have had previous allegations of supporting alleged terrorist activity.

In Fairfield, Iowa, four men beat up a filmaker at a house party and call him "Osama bin Laden" after he introduces himself as Usama.æHe reports that he walked into the party without knowing anybody and, after stating his name, was repeatedly kicked and punched.æHe went to the hospital for injuries to his head and nose.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Maine State Representative Michael McClellan, R-Raymond, introduces legistlation LD 330, which attempted to codify the state and U.S. constitutions as the only acceptable law in Maine. This bill was modeled after other foreign law legislation, and is understood to be aimed at preventing the use of Shari'a Law.

Sean Devlin allegedly assaults a 61-year-old woman wearing a headscarf, hitting her, yelling anti-Mulsim slurs, and accusing her of having a bomb. The incident, which took place on the subway in Boston, Massachusettes, led authorities to charge Devlin with violating a person's civil rights, making a false bomb threat, and destruction of property. Further charges are pending.

Pamela Geller, the head of the American Freedom Defense Initiative, a known anti-Muslim organization, submits an ad featuring a cartoon of theæProphet Muhammad to the Washington, D.C, transit authority. Gellar intended for the ads to run on the Washington bus system, and released anti-Islam statements shortly after submitting the ad. The ad featured the winning cartoon from the "Draw Muhammad" cartoon contest Gellar held earlier in the year.æ

Rev. Terry Jones burns a copy of aæQur'anæin a fire pitæand streams it on the internet in Gainsville, Florida. This action resulted in many death threats, and he had a bounty on his head for $2.4 million dollars in Pakistan.æHe had considered burning the Qur'an in September and attracted national attention at the time. He wanted to burn thousands of Qur'ans on 9/11 and label the event "International Burn a Koran Day." The Facebook page for the event had over 7,800 followers although Jones did not follow through with the event. On his church property, he has posted signs that say "Islam is of the Devil."æ

The Portland Halaal Market in Portland, Maine, is vandalized withæan anti-Muslim message, referencing Allah and including a sexual epithet. The incident was captured on camera, but no suspects were found.

Two imamsæare removed from a Delta Airline plane in Memphis, Tennesse, because the pilot felt uncomfortable with their presence on the flight. The plane was taxiing when it returned to the gate and Masudur Rahman and Mmohamed Zaghloul were asked to leave. They were not allowed to reboard because the pilot would not allow them.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic Society of Portland in Portland, Maine, receives a letter threatening anti-Muslim bloodshed in August of 2017.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Masjid Manhattan in New York City receives a letter threatening anti-Muslim bloodshed in August of 2017.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Residents of Jaffrey, New Hampshire, discover a road-side sign posted on private property that read, "Islam is a Death Cult."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Members of the Masjid Annur Islamic Center in Sacramento, California, find a burned Qur'an stuffed with bacon handcuffed to a fence on the property.æThe event occured during Ramadan.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unidentified driver throws shredded pages of the Qur'an out of a moving car in front of the Islamic Center of Davis in Davis, California. It is the second time in 2017 that the mosque has been the target of Islamophobic activity.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A federal judge rules that a class-action lawsuit challenging a once-secret immigration-related program may move forward. The Controlled Application Review and Resolution Program, created in 2008 and secret until 2012, imposes criteria for review of citizenship and permanent residency application beyond what Congress has authorized, enabling indefinite delays in processing.æThe program appears to have targeted Muslim applicants.

Bernhard Laufer, 55, stabs Bashir Ahmad as he opens the Masjid Al-Saaliheen Mosque in Flushing, New York, for morning prayers. Asæhe stabbed Ahmad he allegedly shouted an anti-Muslim slur. Laufer was charged withæattempted murder and a hate crime.

Duke University in Durham, North Carolina, announces that it will begin weekly prayer services by broadcasting the adhan, theætraditional Muslim call to prayer. The announcement recieved negative responses, including an online movement using the hashtag #boycottduke, threats to theæMuslim staff and students, and a localæevagelist, Franklin Graham, posted an anti-Muslim Facebook message and created a campaign urging donors of the college to withhold funding until the prayer was canceled.æ

The Mississippi State House of Representativesævotes to pass House Bill 177, which bans the use of Foreign Law in Mississippi. While this bill is not explicitly directed at Shari'a Law, the bill is similar to other legistlation across the country that targets Islamic Law.

Demin Zawity is banned from walking in her high school's homecoming parade as a member of junior ROTC unless she removes her head scarf inæBrentwood, Tennesse.æThe U.S. army sets the junior ROTC dress code which states that head coverings must be concealed underneath the ROTC head gear.æZawity quit the junior ROTC at her school andæcontacted CAIR, who asked the school to let her participate and sent a letter to the Department of Defense about the dress code.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unidentified person sets a mosque on fire in Wichita, Kansas, and causes over $100,000 in damages. It took seven months to repair the mosque, and no suspect has been found. The mosque received several threatening letters and experienced vandalism on a smaller scale before the event. æ

Two passengers are taken off an American Airlines flight to Boston, Massachusetts.æThe passengers were removed at the request of the airline for acting "suspiciously", and a K-9 unit was sent in to sweep the plane. The passengers were questioned by the police, and then released.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Christian Alexander Pean is waiting in line and texting on his phone at an AMC theater in New York City, New York, when a man confronts him about what he is typing on his phone, and questions him about the Paris attacks. The man said æ"Guys like you texting and standing, itÍs very suspiciousî, and then motioned for Pean to open his coat. Pean filmed the entire encounter and posted it on his Facebook.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The FBI alerts New York law enforcement agencies to the presence of Jon Ritzheimer, a known anti-Islam organizer, after he posts a video online in which he threatens theægroup Muslims of America in Hancock, New York. In the video he brandished a gun, made profane anti-Obama statements, and threatened the group. New York police agencies warned Ritzheimer he would be arrested if he crossed state lines.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Pullman Police Department in Pullman, Washington, provides extra patrols to the Pullman Islamic Center after they recieved reports of the mosque being placed on a list of "radicalized" mosques, and of mutiple online social media threats against the mosque.æThe community, and the Washington State University Students who attend the mosque, were placed on alert.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A series of threatening, anti-Islam fliers are found scattered around Revere, Massachusetts,æparticularily focused in a neighborhood populated with Muslim-owned businesses. Police investigated the fliers, one read, ñWe must kill all Muslims in America Destroy + burn all Koran booksî, while another read ñAll Muslims will be killed in America + Europe."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: As part of the Global Rally for Humanity, a national event originally conceived by organizer Jon Ritzheimer as a counter movement for the 20th anniversary celebration of the Million Man March in Washington D.C,æa Facebook group forms to organize a protest at the Huntsville Islamic Center in Huntsville, Alabama, to protest Islam in the United States. This event was planned alongside 19 other anti-Islam rallies at mosques around the country.

An unidentified suspect setsæa mosque on fire in Stockton, California and causes $400,000 worth of damages.æThe suspect was caught on video, and the police offered a reward for anybody who could identify him with $10,000.æAlmost forty firefighters were needed to control the fire, and nobody was injured.æ

An Islamic group sues Bridgewater, New Jersey, for religious discrimination after the town changed zoning rules during the application process for building a mosque in a residential neighborhood. After many citizens protested the building of a mosque on a side road, the city changed its zoning laws so that places of worship can only be built on busy roads. The town cited traffic concerns when altering the law, but some protesters wondered if the proposed mosque was related to terrorism and questioned the sources of its funding.

Tahera Ahmad is refused an unopen can of Coke by a flight attendant on a United Airlines flight from Chicago to Washington, D.C, because she "may use it as a weapon on the plane." When Ahmad pointed out that the passenger next to her had an unopened beer can, another passenger told her "you Moslem, you need to shut the f** up."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Two unidentified people set a mosque in Houston, Texas on fire in the middle of the night.æA security video shows them shattering a window and spilling gasoline onto the ground. No suspects have been identified.

Irum Abbasi is removed from a Southwest Airlines flight after a flight attendant overhears her say "It's a go" when, in reality, Abbasi says "I've got to go" in San Diego, California. After she was removed, she was cleared to re-board, but the pilot refused to allow her on because the crew was uncomfortable with her on the plane.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Center for American Islamic Relations faxes a formal complaint of discrimination to Leuzinger High School and the Centinela Valley Union High School Districtæin Lawndale, California. The complaint came after Sumaya Ali reported that her history teacher had asked "Who thinks all Muslims should die?" and a few kids had raised their hands. On another occaision, after another student told the teacher thatæAli was Muslim,æhe responded with "oh, you're a terrorist."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A former deputy of the Orange County Sheriff's Office in Orlando, Florida,æfiles a civil rights lawsuit against his former employer alleging that they discrimated against him for being Muslim. Heædescribed his coworkers calling him "terrorist", and asserts that the investigation against him that lead to his firing was in retaliation for his speaking out against the hostile work environment.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Two Muslim truck drivers who were fired by Star Transport Inc in Morton, Illinois for refusing to deliver shipments containing alcohol are awarded $40,000 in compensatory damages and $200,000 in punitive damages by aæjury in their discrimination claim.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Two Muslim professors at the Southern University at New Orleans, Louisiana, file a complaint of discrimination against the school in the hiring process of Muslim professors and job candidates.æThe U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission investigated the incident on grounds of religious and ethnic discrimination.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Yaqub Bham goes to David Nienberg's house to install a home security system in Tomball, Texas, and Nienberg violently punches and bites him after learning his name and country of origin. Bham was in the hospital for several days after a portion of his ear was bit off and ten of his ribs were broken. The police arrested Nienberg after arriving at the house and tasering him, and he was charged for aggravated assault.æ

The U.S. Justice Department sues the city of Des Plaines, Illinois, alleging that the suburb violated federal law by refusing to allow the American Islamic Center to operate a place of worship in a vacant office building.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Bernhard Laufer, 59, vandalizes the front door of the Masjid Al-Saaliheen Mosque in Flushing, New York, and later leaves several threatening voicemails in which he threatens to "kill all Muslims," on the mosque's answering machine. He is charged with fourth-degree criminal mischief as a hate crime.

The Council on American-Islamic Relations Florida files a complaint with the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission on behalf of Marlondejuan Guy, against a Denny's restaurant in Ocala, Florida. The Denny's faces a religious discrimination charge after managers fired Guy after he refused to remove his head covering.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Ray Lazier Lengend, 40,æof Queens, drops five firebombs onto the worshipping crowd from a balcony at the Imam Al-KhoeiæIslamic Center in Jamaica, New York. The firebombs, which were described as Molotov cocktails, ignited upon impact with the ground. Lengend plainly told cops that he had planned to "take out as many Muslims and Arabs as possible." He faces 18 charges including arson as a hate crime and weapon possession. ææ

A permit to use Darby Park in Inglewood, California, for a daytime picnic and talent show hosted by a local Islamic organization is suddenly revoked just days before the event.æThe permit was revoked after the group released a promotion reading ñCome share your talent with your Muslim family.î The group believes that the permit was denied after the local law enforcement saw the Muslim names.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Erika Menendez, 33, pushes Sunando Sen onto the train tracks in front of an oncoming train at the 40th Street subway station in Sunnyside, New York, thus killing him. Menendez, who was later charged withæfirst-degree manslaughter and sentenced to 24 years in prison, has said that she committed this act because she has "hated Muslims æ... and wanted to hurt [them] since 9/11", although Sen was actually a Hindu.
A lawsuit is filed against Half Shell Inc., the parent company of Rotten Ralph's in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, after the general manager fired a Muslim staff member for wearing a head covering.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Samantha Elauf, who sued retailer Abercrombie & Fitch for religious discrimination in 2008, has her lawsuit supported by the Supreme Court, and the case is sent back to the appeals court for more consideration. The lawsuit was against the retailer Abercrombie & Fitch for refusing to hire Elauf, who wears a hjab, on the grounds that her scarf did not fit the company's dress code.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Hakima Benaddi files a lawsuit against Michael JÍs Pizzaria, Inc., the previous owner of the Domino's Pizza which wrongfully accused her of making a bomb threat in Davenport, Florida. In 2012 Benaddi was wrongfully arrested for making a bomb threat at the pizzeria, an accusation made by the store's manager at the time, and though those charges were dropped, Benaddi is suing the company for discrimination.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A woman files a federal lawsuit againstæthe Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, Department of Labor and Industry for discriminating against her because she is Muslim. The woman alleged that theædepartment refused to allow her breaks to perform her daily prayers and began reprimanding her for actions it tolerated from non-Muslim employees, and when she filed discrimination complaints, they fired her.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Terry Ali files a lawsuit against Livonia Dermatology in Livonia, Michigan, for terminating Ali, a recent hire as a receptionist, just days after the San Bernardino, California, shooting.æAli claims that on her second day, the day after the tragedy in California, she was moved from the front desk to the back room, and then only a day later she was fired.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: California U.S Representative Loretta Sanchez, D-Orange, says that between ñ5 and 20 percentî of Muslims could be extremists willing to participate in terrorism, live on television showæñPoliticKING with Larry King".

An unknown person spray-paints the word "F***" on the side of a mosque in Hamden, Connecticut.æThis is the third time somebody has vandalized the mosque, and the mosque's imam, Abdul-Majid Karim Hasan, has also had his house vandalized. No suspects have been identified.æ

Jose Alcantara files a lawsuit against a Bed Bath & Beyond in New York, New York, for firing him because of his beard and his faith. The suit describes months of coworkers calling him "terrorist", as well as other anti-Muslim sentiments, and conversations about Alcantara's faith and his beard with a company HR representative. æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Mervat Soliman files a lawsuit against the NYPD in Brooklyn, New York, alleging that they forced her to take her hijab off in the police car, and then again to be photographed, and did not allow Soliman to be processed by a female police officer or in a private room.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Residents protestæa proposed mosque at aæCity Council meeting in Temecula, California. They cited traffic problems even though city planners said that traffic would not be interrupted. Some residents stated that the mosque would be a site for extremists.æAfter hours of testimony, the City Council unanimously allowed the mosque to be built.æ

Saira Ali, a Muslim high schooler at Colonia High School in Colonia, New Jersey, creates a Facebook post drawing attention to a social media post of another student who took a picture of her with the caption "ISIS".æAli filed a report with theæWoodbridge Township School District, though after four months of investigation the school board determined that Ali was notæ'harassed, intimidated, or bullied.'æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Andy Vita, a town employee in Babylon, New York, allegedly posts derisive comments aboutæYasmin Zohny, the salutatorian ofæthe Lindenhurst School District's 2017 graduating class. His comments, which appeared on a community post celebrating the district's high achieving students, specifically reference her religious identity. The town suspended him pending investigation.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic Center of Cincinnati receives a package containing a written threat and white powder. Authorities determine the substance to be non-threatening. The Centeræreceived a bomb threat in March 2017.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Authorities arrestæJames Patrick Billiot andæJustin William Rifanburg, of Fargo, North Dakota, for allegedly making derogatory remarks toward and then attacking a Somali-American man.

Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruzæcalls for all Muslim refugees from Syria to be barred from entering the United States, but supports opening the borders to displaced Christians, arguing there is not a "meaningful risk" that Christians will commit terrorist acts in speech given in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina. This rhetoric is used by other republican politicians and presidential candidates, notably candidate Jeb Bush on the very same day.æ

Darlene Hider is on a Delta Airlines flight from Florida back to Detroit, Michigan, when another passenger shouts "this is America" and singles Hider out for her faith and her hjab. The flight crew responds by forcing Hider and her children to move seats, allegedly telling Hider "You are at my wit's end. You better be quiet before I kick you off of this plane!"
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The lawsuit filed by Husam D. Abed againstæthe Bath Iron Works shipyard isæshifted to US District Court in Maine. The suit claims that Abed was singled out and subjected to hate speech by his coworkers for being Palestinian and Muslim, and that the company displayed an Afghan flag that was defaced and spit on by his coworkers. Abed resigned from his job at BIW inæ2007, citing emotional distress.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A moment of silence for the November Paris Attacks is interrupted during a Green Bay Packers football game in Greenbay, Wisconsin, by a fan yelling "Muslims suck!"
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Tennessee State Representative Sheila Butt, R-Columbia, sponsors an "anti-indoctrination" bill, House Billæ1418. The premise of the bill is that Tennessee schools are allowing children to be religiously indoctrinated, andæwhile the language is neutral, the sponsors of the bill have made previous statements of worry about the islamic indoctrination of students, and the dangers of Islam in general.

A court allowed fourteen plaintiffs to be added to a lawsuit against Rutherford County that is trying to preventæthe construction of the Islamic Centeræof Murfreesboro in Murfreesboro, Tennesse. The court ruled that the plaintiffs failed to prove their case in 2010, and the addition of these plaintiffs allows the lawsuit to continue.æIn 2010, the plaintiffs argued that Islam is not an official religion and that Sharia law is dangerous.æ

The American Arab Anti-Discrimination Committee of Michigan files a lawsuit in federal court against the city of Dearborn, Michigan, and its police department for forcing a Muslim woman to remove her hijab after she was arrested in 2004. The suit claims that afteræMaha Aldhalimi was arrested for an unpaid parking ticket, the Dearborn Police Department would not let Aldhalimi be photographed by a woman or keep her hjab on in the mugshot.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit, operated in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, reinstates a civil rights lawsuit that had challenged wide-ranging surveillance by the New York Police Department of Muslim communities in New Jersey. The suit wasæfiled in Federal District Court in Newark by a group of individuals, businesses, student associations and mosques, and claimed that the police surveillance started after the September 11 attacks illegally targeted them on the grounds that they were Muslim and that their religious identity was a ñpermissible proxy for criminality.î
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The grave of Hassan Mustafa Hassan Abdullah, in Evergreen Cemetery in Evergreen Park, Illinois, is vandalized with anti-Muslim slogans and gang symbols. This was the sixth instance of vandalism at this specific grave in the previous 17 months, and police suspected that the same person or group was responsible for all of the vandalism.

A promotional poster for a panel on free speech in the wake of the Charlie Hebdo shooting at the University of Minnesota in Minneapolis, Minnesota, contains a cartoon of the Prophet Muhammad with the word "censored" written over it. A group of concerned and offended students and faculty reached outæto the Office of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action to have the poster investigated.
Scott Lees, the boy's lacrosse coach at Fryeberg Academy in Fryeberg, Maine, resigns after posting a Facebook post containing derogatory and inflammatory statements against Muslims.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Khairuldeen Makhzoomi is removed from a Southwest Airlines flight from Los Angeles toæOakland, California. Makhzoomi was removed after another passenger reported him to the flight crew after hearing him speaking arabic to his uncle on the phone when he bid his uncle ñinshallah,î meaning ñgod willing.î
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: At an appearance in Newton, Iowa, Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump affirms that he would implement aædatabase for all Muslims in the country to register in, and asserts that they must be managed. When an audience member questions whether Trump's proposed datebase compares to Nazi Germany, Trump repeatedly said, ñYou tell me,î until he stopped responding to the question. Trump also voiced the desire to increase surveillance on Muslim-American communities during his campaign.

The Supreme Court in Washington, DC, unanimously rules that Arkansas corrections officials had violated the religious liberty rights of Muslim inmates by forbidding them to grow beards. The case concerned Gregory H. Holt, also known as Abdul Maalik Muhammad, who was serving a life sentence for burglary and domestic battery and wished to grow a beard, but was denied this by the Arkansas prison officials.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Representative Peter King holds a Congressional hearing to question whether Muslim Americans comply with law enforcment and accuse certain Muslim advocacy groups, like CAIR, of having ties with terroism in Washington D.C. A law enforcement officer testified that Muslim Americans cooperate with them, and many Muslim Americans recounted stories of how Muslim Americans have contributed to the community. Although, some Muslim Americans testified thatætheir relatives converted to Islamic extremism.æ

A manager at Mattress Firm refuses to sell Syeeda Hussaini a mattress unless she uncovers her face in Manchester, Missouri. The manager cited safety reasons when he told Hussaini and her husband that he could not sell them a mattress. After Hussaini wrote to the Mattress Firm headquarters, the manager was fired.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Al Maghrah Cemetery Association sues the Castle Rock Township in Minnesota after it rejects their proposal to build a cemetery. The suit claims that there is not legal grounds to deny the proposal, as theætownship cited loss of tax base as the reason for denial. An expert testimony in the deliberation asserted that the tax loss would be negligible for the township.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Hundreds of residents arrive at the Farmersville Planning and Zoning meeting in Farmersville, Texas, toæexpress concern over the planned construction of a Muslim cemetery. The cemetery building permit had already been approved, but many residents contested the approval and shared anti-Muslim sentiments.

North Carolina becomes the seventh state to ban Sharia Law. Governor Pat McCroy allowed the bill to become law without his signature one month after passed by the state legislature.æThe legislation does not mention Sharia or Islam, but uses the language banning "any foregin law" from consideration in North Carolina.æThis follows a pattern similar to other efforts across the country.

Councilman Bill DeSteph of Virgina Beach, Virginia, says a city council approved mosque is a threat to national security and has ties to the Muslim Brotherhood. He provided no evidence to support his claim, and was the only councilmember to vote against the mosque.æ

The Islamic Center of St. Cloud, Minnesota, removes their proposal for building a second, larger mosque on vacant land. The proposal had been in the works for two years, but concerns about traffic, parking, and the size of the development fueled strong opposition to the project. Following the removal of the proposal, dozens of hateful emails opposing the proposed mosque were posted on the city's website as a part of the public record.æ

Gwinnett County comissioners reject a proposal to build a cemetery by the æCommunity of Bosniaks Georgia in Gwinnett County, Georgia. The countyÍs Planning Commission approved the cemetery, but the Board of Commissioners voted unanimously to deny it after hearing the concerns of the neighbors, centered on lowered property values and anti-Muslim sentiments.æ

Angry residents in La Verne, California, notify city officals that American flags were removed from grave cites at the La Verne Cemetery. The complaints included assertions that the religious identity of the owners of the cemetery, who are Muslim, motivated the removal. City officials investigated the claims and found that the removal of the flags was a timely post-Memorial Day practice in cemeteries nationwide.æ

The Christian Action Network (CAN) protests imam FeisalæAbdul Rauf's speech at Hill Hall in Chapel Hill, North Carolina. Abdul Rauf lead the effort to build a community center with a mosque near ground zero, and the leader of CAN said in response to the building: "This is nothing more than an act of triumphalism. They tore down two of our buildings, and now they want to build a mosque on it." CAN protested Abdul Rauf's speech by holding another event simultaneously in a nearby building that discussed 9/11, and after the event, they held a candlelight walk to Hall Hill. æ

The Council on American Islamic Relations (CAIR) in Los Angeles, California, receives an email comparing Muslims to rodents, threatening violence against Muslims, and declaring that the President of the United States defends the American Judeo-Christian heritage. Other CAIR branches receive the same message.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Council on American Islamic Relations (CAIR) in Minneapolis, Minnesota, receives an email comparing Muslims to rodents, threatening violence against Muslims, and declaring that the President of the United States defends the American Judeo-Christian heritage. This is the second message the CAIR branch has received from the same sender. Other CAIR branches receive the same message.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
