Event Description: ChristopheræHayden of Burlington, Vermont, is arraigned on charges of disturbing the peace by electronic means with a hate crime enhancement for sending a series of threatening, anti-Muslim emails toæFaisal Gill,æhead of the Vermont Democratic Party, in May and June.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Unknown vandalsæspray-paint anti-Muslim messages and spread bacon around the on the building at the Islamic Center of Murfreesboro in Murfreesboro, Tennessee.æThe Center has been subject to multiple instances of anti-Muslim activity since its construction began in 2010.æ

At least $4,000 is stolen from the Islamic Center of Murfreesboro in Murfreesboro, Tennessee. The robbery occured just after Eid al-Fitr, which marks the end of Ramadan and is often a time of increased charitable giving in Muslim communities.
An employee at the Hillside Islamic Center in New Hyde Park, New York, find a large oil painting of a crucified Jesus hanging from the property's fence.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Wisconsin state RepresentativeæThomas Weatherston introducesæAB401, which seeks to ban foreign law from judicial proceedings in Wisconsin state courts. As with other similar efforts across the country, the bill does not mention shari'a, but Weatherston acknowledges that so-called  foreign religious law is his chief concern.

Massachusetts Governor Charlie Bakeræmakes a public statment saying that he does not want Syrian refugees to settle in Massachusetts, citing security concerns. He joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.æ

Illinois Governor Bruce Rauneræmakes a public statment saying that he does not want Syrian refugees to settle in Illinois, citing security concerns. He joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.æ

The Lilburn City Council approves a proposed mosque expansion afteræthe U.S. Department of Justice files a lawsuit against the City of Lilburn for religious bias in Lilburn, Georgia. The City Council had denied two rezoning applications over two years, and the U.S. Department of Justice accused the Lilburn City Council of denying these propositions because of religious based opposition in the community.æ

Cincinnati, Ohio, Mayor John Cranley reaffirms his public statement that the U.S. should halt the resettlement of Syrian refugees out of safety concerns.æHe joined more than two dozen other politicians who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.æ

Alabama Governor Robert Bentley says he'll refuse Syrian refugees relocating to the state. He issued a news release saying: "I will not stand complicit to a policy that places the citizens of Alabama in harm's way." He joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.

Arizona Governor Doug Ducey calls for the federal government to immediately halt placement of any new refugees in Arizona, with his comments specifically aimed at refugees coming from Syria. Ducey sites security concerns and lack of proper vetting for refugees as his reason for halting the placement of refugees.æHe joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.

Arkansas Governor Asa Hutchinson says he opposes Syrian refugees being relocated to Arkansas. He also asserts that the United States should not take in any Syrian refugees at all.æHe joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.

Florida Governor Rick Scott demands that congress block all Syrian refugees from entering the United States.æHe joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.æ

Georgia Governor Nathan Dealæsays the state will not accept Syrian refugees and issues an executive order to prevent resettlement of refugees in Georgia.æHe joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.

Idaho Governor C.L. "Butch" Otter calls for the immediate halt of Syrian refugees to his state.æHe joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.æ

Indiana Governor Mike Penceæorders state agencies to suspend the relocation of anymore Syrian refugees to Indiana. He joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.æ

Kansas Governor Sam Brownback issues an executive order directing that no state agency, or organization receiving grant money from the state, shall participate or assist in the relocation of Syrian refugees. He joined more than two dozen other governors who halted refugees from entering their states.æ

Kentucky Governor-elect Matt Bevin calls for a halt of Syrian refugees to his state.æHe joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.æ

Maine Governor Paul LePage calls it "irresponsible" to let Syrian refugees into the country, and releases a statement promising to prevent Maine from ever being a sanctuary state for refugees.æHe joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.

Michigan Governor Rick Snyder halts all relocation of Syrian refugees in Michigan, citing security concerns. He joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.æ

Mississippi GovernoræPhil Bryant promises to do "everything humanly possible" to keep Syrian refugees out of Mississippi.æHe joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.æ

Nebraska Governor Pete Ricketts sends a letter to Maine refugee resettling agencies, urging them not to resettle Syrian refugees in the state.æHe joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.

New Hampshire Governor Maggie Hassanæsays that the United States should halt the acceptance of Syrian refugees out of safety concerns.æShe joined more than two dozen other governors who echoed this sentiment and halted refugees from entering their states.

New Mexico Governor Susana Martinez says that she is opposed to accepting Syrian refugees in the United States. She joined over two dozen governors nationwide who expressed opposition to the U.S accepting Syrian refugees.æ

North Carolina Governor Pat McCrory asks the Obama administration to stop sending Syrian refugees to North Carolina out of fear for safety. He joined over two dozen other governors who echoed these sentiments and made efforts to ban refugees from their states.æ

Ohio Governor and Republican presidential nominee John Kasich releases a statement saying thatæboth Ohio, and the entire United States, should not accept Syrian refugees out of concerns for safety. He joined over two dozen other governors who echoed these sentiments and made efforts to ban refugees from their states.

Oklahoma Governor Mary Fallin publically urges President Barack Obama to suspend accepting Syrian refugees out of safety concerns. She joined over two dozen other governors who echoed these sentiments and made efforts to ban refugees from their states.

South Carolina Governor Nikki Haley says she supports allowing persecuted immigrants to come to South Carolina as long as they're not from Syria. She joined over two dozen other governors who echoed these sentiments and made efforts to ban refugees from their states.æ

Tennessee Governor Bill Haslam asks the federal government to suspend the relocation of Syrian refugees to Tennessee due to safety concerns.æHe joined over two dozen other governors who echoed these sentiments and made efforts to ban refugees from their states.æ

Texas GovernoræGreg Abbot orders refugee resettlement programs to refuse resettling Syrian refugees in the state of Texas, and he writes a letter to the Obama Administration urging them to halt all Syrian refugees from entering the United States. He joined over two dozen other governors who echoed these sentiments and made efforts to ban refugees from their states.æ

Wisconsin Governor Scott Walker announces that Wisconsin will not take any more Syrian refugees because they pose a security threat.æHe joined over two dozen other governors who echoed these sentiments and made efforts to ban refugees from their states.æ

New Jersey Governor and Republican presidential nominee Christ Christie goes onæHugh Hewitt's syndicated radio show and says that the United States should not take any Syrian refugees, not even "orphans under age 5."æHe joined over two dozen other governors who echoed these sentiments and made efforts to ban refugees from their states.æ

Alabama State Senator Geral Allen introduces a law, SB 62, that bans Sharia law in Alabama courts.æWhen asked about Sharia law, Senator Allen could not give a definition or explain what it was. The legislation did not pass the State Senate.æ

Maricopa County Attorney Bill Montgomeryæbrings ex-FBI agent John Guandolo to Tempe, Arizona, for a one-day seminar called "Understanding the Threat" that is aimed at teaching local prosecutors and law inforcement about the dangers of Islam.æ

An unidentified person or group left bacon bits on a small section of New Dorp Beach Park in Staten Island, New York, while Muslims were gathering there in the morning for Eid prayer. Police were unsure who committed the crime, and were investigating whether it was a hate crime.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Michael J. Germain, 68, accosts a woman at the counter of a Walgreen's in West Hartford, Connecticut, by yelling a stream of obscenities and anti-Muslim slurs at the woman. The woman also alleged that Germain had threatened to punch her, and, according to arrest reports, Germain was "upset that Americans were killed at the embassy." Germain was accused of hate crimes, second-degree breach of peace and second-degree threatening.æ

Tennessee state Senator Bill Ketron introduces Senate bill 1028 that would make it a felony to follow some aspects of Sharia law in Tennessee.æSenator Ketron later amended the bill and removed references to Sharia and religion after many news sources and legislators labeled it as the most radical anti-Sharia law to date.

Republican Presidential candidate Herman Cain reaffirms his stance that he would be uncomfortable appointing a Muslim in his Cabinetæin the Republican Presidential Debate inæManchester, New Hampsire.æHe had said it once previously in March, and when asked about the comment, he stated thatæhe would be uncomfortable because there are Muslims who "are trying to kill us".

A group of people plan to protest at the Islamic Society of Wichita mosque in Wichita, Kansas, for inviting Monzer Taleb, who they claim is associated with terrorism, to speak at the mosque. The online forum in which they planned the protest is filled with comments about terrorism, anti-Muslim sentiments, and hate speech. The plans began as a peaceful anti-Taleb protest, but escalated to an armed anti-Muslim protest.æ
A flag hanging outside of the Islamic Center of Bothell, Washington, is found burned. The mosque has been vandalized before and has a history of bias related incidents.

10 booklets related to Islam, each with handwritten hateful messages inside the front cover, are found intentionally placed in different parking spots in the parking lot of the Islamic Center of Bothell, Washington.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Bridgewater Township in Bridgewater, New Jersey, settles a lawsuit withæthe Al Falah Center. The location of the proposed mosque was changed in the settlement, but the Al Falah Center recieved $7.75 million. The suit was filed originally because the mosque was denied a building permit and experienced anti-Muslim backlash from the community.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Ammendment 1, which prohibits foreign law, is passed in Alabama, and added to the state constitution.æThe ammendment is similar to other efforts in the country to ban shari'a law.æ

State Senator Mike Fair introducesæa bill to the South Carolina legislature that bans foreign law. South Carolina introduced a law in 2010 that specifically banned Sharia law and failed to be passed. This revised law makes no explicit reference to religion but is similar to other efforts in the country to ban shari'a law. æ
Two unknown suspects beat a 70-year-old Queens, New York, man after asking him about his religious identity. The New York Police Department assigned the case to the Hate Crimes Division.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic Center of the Shenandoah Valley in Harrodsburg, Virginia, is vandalized by unknown perpetrators. Obsceneæhate graffiti is spray-painted on the wall, including vulgar objects, racial slurs against African-Americans, and vulgar references to Iraqis. The Council of American-Islamic Relations called on authorities to investigate the incident as a hate crime.

State Representative David Agema introduces an anti-Sharia bill in Lansing, Michigan, after stating that the Muslims are campaigning to install Sharia law in American courts. Even though Agema repeatedly cites Sharia law as a reason for the bill, he insists that it targets all foreign law and is not religiously motivated.æ

The Missouri House of Representatives passes an anti-shari'a bill in a 102-51 vote. Representative Paul Curtman sponsored the bill and said that the legislation targets all foreign law, although the debate was mainly about the role of Sharia law in state courts.æ

Pennsylvania state Representative RoseMarie Swanger introduces House Bill 2029 prohibiting foreign law in state courts.æSwanger stated that the bill's main goal is to help women and children in custody cases, and she said, "I'm thinking of the Near East, where women are not as highly regarded and don't have the same rights as men. If those women come here, I want them to have the same rights that we have."
State Representative Carl Gatto introduces an anti-shari'a bill in Alaska. He fails to cite an example of foreign law being used in Alaska courts, but he says the bill is a preventative measure.

Defending his effort to ban shari'a from courts in Missouri, State Representative Don Wells compares Islamic law to polio during a House Committee meeting in Jefferson City, Missouri. He claims that shari'a is a threat to public safety and well-being in much the same as polio and therefore requires urgent counter-measures.

A physical education teacher at Bellwood Elementary School inæRichmond, Virginia,æallegedly refuses a student's request for religious accommodationæduring Ramadan, making her (and the entire class) run extra laps because he perceived her to be loafing.æOther anti-Muslim incidents at the school prompted an internal investigation.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A family in Helena, Alabama, wakes to find their cars with significant damage, including broken windows, slashed tires,æand spray-painted hate speech.

Judge Alfonso Charles, speaking at a Bar Association event in Longview, Texas, provides a rundown of bills under consideration by the Texas legislature. Among them is HB 45, which seeks to ban foreign law from consideration in judicial proceedings in the state regarding family law. Although the legislation does not mention shari'a specifically, the judge hints that the bill reflects fear that shari'a will be imposed in Texas.æ [Editor's Note: The bill went on to pass, becoming law in Texas. The passage of this legislation, similar to (though somewhat more circumscribed than) other efforts around the country, garnered no attention in mainstream media outlets. Christian and conservative publications reported on the passage.]
Anti-Muslim comic book-like leaflets warning of a Muslim world-wide takeover appear on cars in Presque Isle, Maine.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Muslim resident of Murfreesboro, Tennessee, wakes to find his car littered with bologna and a used condom.

Deedra Abboud, a candidate for US Senate from Arizona, posts praise of the secular vision of the Constitution and its crafters to her campaign Facebook page. Almost immediately, other users began posting hateful messages about Islam and her candidacy. The campaign suggests this is an all-too-common response to her candidacy, which has prompted the need for police escorts at many campaign events.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unidentified caller leaves over twenty minutes of voicemails at an Augusta, Georgia, area mosque, during which he makes anti-Muslim and anti-Islam remarks and makes explicit violent threats about killing Muslims. The calls came over a period of days in late June and early July. [Editor's Note: The mosque has requested that its identity remain private for fear of further threats. It has, however, provided civil rights organizations and media outlets with recordings to support the claims. We have used the location of theæMuslim Community Center-Augusta for the purposes of this map, but we do not know for certain at the time of this entry which Augusta area mosque received the threats.]
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Former Congressperson and candidate for US President delivers remarks at a Republican gubernatorial forum at the American Legion in Waconia, Minnesota, during which she centers attention on the threat that migration from Muslim countries poses to the United States.æ

A container filled with lard and a copy of the Qur'an arrives via Federal Express at the Council on American Islamic Relations offices in Sacramento, California. The package originated in Missouri City, Texas.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Subway employee stops a couple at the entrance and asks whether they are Muslim. When the couple responds affirmatively the employee informs them that they are not welcome in the establishment. After the couple call the police, an officer informs them that they should leave the establishment because they are scaring the manager.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: House Bill 1552, which seeks to ban foreign law from judicial proceedings in Oklahoma state courts,æpasses the Oklahoma House of Representatives in aæ76-3 vote. State Representative Sally Kernæintroduced the billæafter an anti-shari'a ballot measure, which Oklahoma voters overwhelmingly approved, is struck down in federal court because of its discriminatory nature. [Editor's note: Although the Oklahoma Senate did not take up the legislation, it set an important precedent for future efforts of a similar kind. Written by the Center foræSecurity Policy, HB 1552 became a template for bills across the country, omitting explicit mention of the shari'a to avoid charges of targeting Islam and Muslims.]
An unidentified suspect burglarizes the Islamic Society of Greater Philadelphia Mosque on July 12 and July 17. The suspect, who was caught camera, steals money from the donation box.
A Muslim family in Malverne, New York, awoke to find two hate messages in their mailbox. Each hand-written message references the KKK and threatened to kill Muslims.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Amber Elizabeth Hensley threatens three Muslim women during a disagreement in the parking lot of a Fargo, North Dakota, Walmart, telling them that they should go home and that she will kill them. Hensley was subsequently terminated from her job, and in an effort of peacemaking the three Muslim women reached out to Hensley for a public conversation and tried to help her regain her job.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Police arrest Brandon Ricardo Pascual for a March 2017 incident in an Irvine, California, parking lot. He allegedly yelled religious slurs at two Muslim women and followed the pair in his car, throwing coins at their vehicle as they tried to get away from him. Authorities charged him with assault-hate crime.

Sixteen Muslim men file suit against Warren, Michigan, auto supplier Brose Jefferson, alleging religious descrimination. The suit stems from a May 2017 incident in which a supervisor, frustrated by specific requests for accommodations during Ramadan, allegedly told the employees they had to choose between their religion and their jobs.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Hazem Mahmoud, who is running for mayor in Newburyport, Massachusetts,æfinds a campaign sign in his yard has been destroyed. He notes that he has experienced anti-Muslim in the past, though he is not certain whether this incident is motivated by hate or political disagreement.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Approximately 50 protestors gather in New Orleans, Louisiana, to highlight the threat that shari'a poses to the United States.

Sharon Brannigan, a trustee of Palos Township, Illinois, steps down from her position on the Cook County's Commission on Women's Issues, citing scheduling conflicts. Some residents have called for Brannigan's resignation from the township board because of social media posts questioning Muslim immigration to the United States, claiming that Muslims do not integrate into American society, and suggesting that area schools were filling with undocumented immigrants from the Middle East. Brannigan is a former Republic candidate for a seat in Congress. She has refused to step down from the town board.

In the aftermath of an anti-sharia protest in Seattle, Washington, the coalition behind the counter-protest movement submits a letter to Mayor Ed MurrayÍs office, the Seattle Police Department, and the Office of Police Accountability alleging that the Seattle Police Department allowed violent demonstrators to repeatedly attack peaceful counter-protesters.æThe police allegedly ñtreated [the counter protestors] as the primary threat, instead of the armed militia and anti-Muslim hate group members.î
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: British newlyweds Natasha Politakis and Ali Gul are detained in the Los Angeles International Airport for 26 hours and then put on a plane back to the UK. The couple alleges that they were barred and detained because Gul is a Muslim, and that the airport staff looked at Gul's name and passport before immediately taking their phones and detaining them.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The city of Minneapolis, Minnesota, creates a hotline for people to report hate crimes, prompting former Minnesota congresswoman Michele Bachmann to label the hotline as a stealthy means of imposing ñIslamic anti-blasphemy laws on non-Muslims,î and to compare the hotline to fascism and shari'a law.æ

The Freedom of Conscience Defense Fund and a group of parents sue the San Diego Unified School District in San Diego, California, after the district implemented a plan for their anti-bullying policy that was aimed to protect Muslim students. The lawsuit challenges the constitutionality of the policy, and accuses the school board of favoring Islam and promoting the islamization of schools. Ultimately the plan was recinded.æThe group also has a history of protesting school board meetings and accusing the school board of working with the Council on American-Islamic Relations towards extremist goals. æ

RepresentativeæTrent Franks, Republican from Arizona, proposes an amendment to a defense spending bill that would have charged the Department of Defense with analyzing the work of Muslim intellectuals for evidence of extremist views. The amendment, which failed, did not define what constitutes extremism.

Abdisalam Wilwal and Sagal Abdigani of Eagan, Minnesota, file suit againstæthe US government alleging unreasonable searchæand violation of due process during an 11-hour detention at the US-Canadian border on 30 March 2015. The suit claims that without explanation customs and border officials detained the couple and their four children, all US citizens, and subjected them to interrogation without legal representation. The family was returning from a short vacation in Canada.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A family visiting Decatur, Alabama, discovers that each of the 14 chicken sandwiches they ordered at McDonalds contained strips of bacon, which is not listed as an ingredient of the menu item.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Orlando, Florida, City CommissioneræRobert Stuart, who is running for re-election, admits conducting a poll that asked about his opponent's religion. He is running againstæAsima Azam.
The Al-Maghfirah Cemetery in Castle Rock Township, Minnesota, is vandalized. The town originally denied the permit for the cemetery, a decision that was overruled byæa district court.

Action for Rural Crescent and the residents of Prince William County, Virginia, sue theæPrince William Board of County Supervisors after they award a special permit to the All Dulles Area Muslim Society to build a new mosque. The lawsuit followed three years of contentious debate about the proposed construction, and while many of the residents argued against the mosque on grounds of environmental and traffic concerns, county meetings contained anti-Muslim complaints.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: In response to a growing number of bias related incidents in Fargo, North Dakota,æspecifically the recent anti-Muslim altercation at a local Walmart, around 200 anti-hate protestors gather at Fargo city hall. The rally drew a small group of counter protestors who shouted anti-Islamæsentiments at the assembled crowd.

The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission files a lawsuit against Swift Aviation Services, Inc., in Phoenix, Arizona, on behalf of former employee Adam Donmez. The lawsuit alleges that Donmez was harrased because of his Turkish heritage and because he is Muslim. Donmez was subjected to such statements as "I don't know why we don't kill all of those towelheads already" and "why are you dressed like [you are] going to blow up the World Trade Center?" The lawsuit's settlement required Swift to pay Donmez $50,000 in compensation and furnish other reliefs, and banned them from any sort of harassment in the future.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unidentified vandal writes an anti-Muslim slur on the walls ofæa TDS Insurance building in Kensington, New York. The incident was investigated as a bias crime.

Michele Bachmann,æU.S Representative from Minnesota, asserts in an interview that Keith Ellison, a fellow Democratic Representative from Minnesota, has ties with the Muslim Brotherhood, an Islamist group allegedly connected to terrorist activity. Her allegation was a broadening of what Bachmann called the "Islamic infiltration" of the United States government by radical Muslims.

Rodney Raspberry and Chester Johnson, two African American Muslims andæformer employees of Project Renewal in Manhattan, New York, file a lawsuit against their former employer alleging that they were discriminated against and that the company violated their civil rights based on their religion. ææ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Debbie Schlussel,æa lawyer known for her anti-Muslim rhetoric, is suing the city of Dearborn Heights, Michigan, for refusing to give her access to police booking photos of Muslim women without their hjabs. After a lawsuit in 2015, the police department of Dearborn created a policy where Muslim women are allowed to be processed by female officers and keep their heads covered during the booking process. In her lawsuit, Schlussel refers to this as "Sharia Law" and alleges that the policy is unlawful.æ

The police in Redlands, California, are investigating a series of break-ins at the Islamic Society of California in Redlands. The incidents have included vandalism of mosque property, remants of meals and cigarette butts,æand theft of mosque donations.

Citizens from Iran and Yemen sue theæU.S State Department for not processing their visa applications guarenteed through the randomized U.S. government lottery last year. These people were left in limbo after the travel ban was partially reinstated by the Supreme Court in June, temporarily barring citizens of Yemen, Iran and four other Muslim-majority countries with no "bona fide" U.S. connections from traveling to the United States.

A student painting that depicts the Statue of Liberty as a Muslim American woman wearing a hijab, displayed in congressman Lou CorreaÍs office in Santa Ana, California, is criticized as an unpatriotic violation of the separation of church and state by members of We the People Rising, an activist group that advocates stricter enforcement of immigration laws. The painting has also resutled in threats against the congressman's office, though police cannot confirm whether these threats are connected to the We the People Rising organization.æ

An explosion caused by what the FBI is calling an "improvised explosive devise" heavily damages the Dar Al Farooq Center in Minneapolis, Minnesota.æThe blast went off early in the morning, alarming residents and congregants praying in the mosque, but not injuring anyone present. The incident is being investigated by the FBI and the federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives. Prior to the attack the mosque had recieved multiple hateful messages.æMinnesota Governor Mark Dayton denounced the incident as a "criminal act of terrorism."

Residents of Kalkaska County, Michigan, are calling for the resignation ofæJeff Sieting, theæKalkaska village President, after multiple anti-Muslim Facebook posts surface, including posts that call for the deaths of all American Muslims.æ

James Prater puts his house on the market along with a sign that says "No Foreigners Iraq Vet" inæMason, Michigan.æThe Michigan Department of Civil Rights released a statement saying that this sign violates the federal Fair Housing Act, which prohibits ñany notice, statement or advertisementî in real estate transactions that discriminate based on national origin. Prater has been known to make anti-immigrant comments, and has often vocalized his support for President Trump's travel ban.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Members of NYUÍs Muslim Student Association found graffiti of the word "Trump!" written at their facilities at the Tandon School of Engineering in Downtown Brooklyn, New York. The group made a public post about the graffiti and asked for support from their fellow students.æ

A food vendor in Astoria, New York, is pelted with eggs by an unknown assailant. The vendor called the police, but did not file a report. When the police left, the assailant returned and continued to throw eggs at the vendor.æAttached to the second set of eggs was a note that read ñF--k Arab. F--k Muslim.îæNYPDÍs Hate Crime Task Force is investigating.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: As part of an ongoing lawsuit betweenæthe television program 'Top Chef' and a group of teamsters, one of the producers, Ellie Carbajal, testifies about her experience being assualted by the fouræteamsters, including anti-Muslim hate speech. The teamsters allegedly surrounded the 'Top Chef' staff's car, and hurled insults, including "towel head", a derogatory term for a Muslim.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: While waiting a nearby bustop afteræpraying at the Islamic Center of Reseda in Tarzana, California, a man is attacked by four males who got out of a car and beat him up while using anti-Muslim slurs. The staff of the mosque ran out to check on the injured man who insisted that he did not want to call the police and press charges.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Sebastian Gorka, a White House national security adviser, publically suggests that the bombing of the Dar Al Farooq Islamic Center in Bloomington, Minnesota, is a "fake" hate crime "propogated by the left". This comment was made while President Trump was being criticized for remaining silent about the bombing.æ

The local planning officials in Bernards Township, New Jersey, approve the mosque building plans of the Islamic Society of Basking Ridge after more than five years of conflict that included aæ$3.25 million settlement of two federal discrimination lawsuits. The planning committee readily admitted that they finally approved the building plans to avoid further litigation, and the construction still faces opposition from locals.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission rules in favor of 130 employees who filed complaints against Wayzata-based Cargill Meatpacking Solutions and in favor of 20 workers who filed complaints against the Teamsters Local No. 455 in Fort Morgan, Colorado, over a dispute about prayer breaks.æThe EEOC determined there was ñreasonable causeî that Cargill had discriminated against the workers because they were black, immigrated from Somalia, and practiced Islam.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The city of Long Beach, California, agrees to pay $85,000 to settle a federal lawsuit filed by a Muslim woman whose hijab was pulled off by a male officer while she was in police custody.æThe settlement concludes the lawsuit filed in 2016 by Kirsty Powell, which prompted the Long Beach Police Department to reverse its policy barring inmates from wearing religious head coverings.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A husband and wife are walking and speaking in Arabic in Rockville, Maryland, when an unknown man stops them and assaults them while shouting derogatory things about Muslims. The incident is being investigated by theæMontgomery County Police as a hate crime.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Republican Senate Candidate Roy Moore claims that entire communities in parts of Indiana are subject to shari'a law. He has in the past also claimed that Islam is a false religion.

Joe Fernkes of Willmar, Minnesota, curses Somali merchants at a farmers market and throws a pig's foot at them, claiming that there are lots of people who don't like them but are afraid to speak up. Authorities charge him with disorderly conduct.
Regina Mustafa, a Democratic candidate for Congress from Rochester, Minnesota, receives an on-line death threat.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Jerry Omara, a fire district commissioner inæRonkomkoma, New York, allegedly posts a threat to throw members of the Long IslandæMuslim Society off the roofæshould they add a new story to their building.

Oklahoma state RepresentativeæJohn Bennett announces on social media that if communities continue to remove Confederate statues and monuments, then communities should also remove mosques. After initially defending the post, Bennett deletes it from his account.

TheæWest Sacramento Planning Commission approves the use of a residential property for worship services. TheæMadinah Islamic Center, which had been openly operating as a small mosque foræsixteen years before being damaged by a fire at an adjacent property, was subject to a public campaign leading up to the Planning Commission hearing warning of the dangers of having the mosque in the area.æ
Anti-Muslim leaflets, with a swastika and a woman wearing hijab, appear in various locations around Alameda, California, including in proximity to the Islamic Center of Alameda.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A 22-year-old man, thought to be from Bangladesh, suffers a broken jaw and other injuries when he is attacked by a man in Cleveland, Ohio. The incident began when the suspect approached the victim and began making anti-immigrant statements.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Plainfield, Illinois, village board denied the Islamic Foundation of Southwest Suburbs, a Muslim organization, permission to use a recently-purchased property for religious assembly, organized prayer, and community development. Members of the board who voted no cited residential zoning restrictions, although the building on the site served as Christian church and school for over three decades.
An unknown suspect pelts Farid el-Baghdadi with eggs at his food truck in the Astoria section of Queens, New York. One of the eggs had an anti-Muslim hate note attached.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Anti-Islam leaflets appear in Norwalk, Connecticut, warning of the threats that Muslim immigrants pose.
Three men vandalizeæMasjid al-Salam, a mosque in Fort Smith, Arkansas, spraypaintingæanti-Muslim, anti-Islam, anti-Semitic, and anti-immigrant messages onto signage and the building itself.æ

Jonathan Matusitz, an associate professor at University of Central Florida, gives a talk entitled "The Islamic Threat to America" at an ACT! For Space Coast Florida event in Melbourne, Florida. The Council for American-Islamic Relations asked theæBrevard County comissioners to cancel the event, held in their comission meeting room,ædue to the known anti-Islam opinions of Matusitz, who has in the past been criticized by CAIR for anti-Muslim components in his curriculum. The county did not cancel the event.æ

An Oklahoma constitutional amendment that would have barred the state's courts from considering or using Shar'ia law is ruled unconstitutional fot violating the U.S. Constitution's Establishment Clause. U.S. District Judge Vicki Miles-LaGrange issued a permanent injunction, the end of a three year process beginning with Muneer Awad, who filed a lawsuit on Nov. 4, 2010, seeking to block the so-called "Save Our State" constitutional amendment.

North Carolina passes a law that prohibits state judges from considering foreign law in North Carolina courts. As in similar proposed and enacted legislation across the country, the law does not mention shari'a specifically, but the rhetoric surrounding the law is aimed at prohibiting shari'a law. Gov. Pat McCrory allowed the law, which was passed by state lawmakers in July, to take effect without his signature.

In a trial convicting two women from Rochester, Minnesota, of sending money to an Islamist terrorist group in Somalia,æU.S. District Judge Michael Davis asks each woman whether she supports "jihad, suicide bombings and Sharia law". Many spectators found this questioningæinappropriate, and it prompted the Council on American-Islamic Relations to file a complaint against judge Davisæfor equating mainstream Islamic principles with terrorism.

A group of parents protest outside of the Volusia County school district headquarters in DeLand, Florida, in response to the presence of Islam in a world history textbook used by the district. The parents claim that the chapter dedicated to Islam in the book indicates a pro-Islam bias from the district, as no other religion has an entire chapter to itself. The parents also urged students to rip this chapter out of their book until the school district responds to their demands.æ

Adam Soltani, the director of the Council on American-Islamic Relations Oklahoma, is told that he is not allowed to register for a seminar entitled, "Iran, Hezbollah and the Drug Cartels: Counterterrorism Considerations," which was hosted in theæOklahoma House of Representatives' chamber and sponsored by the House's Counterterrorism Caucus. The event was advertised as open to all law enforcement and the public, and featured speakers that have been criticized for anti-Muslim views.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An assistant principal at an elementary school in Kent, Washington, receives an email stating that because she is Muslim she should not have a leadership role in the school. Others in the district have received anti-Muslim correspondence.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Members of the Islamic Foundation of Iowa in Waterloo, Iowa, catch four people attempting to start fires near the building entrance and cars in the parking lot. The four ran off when confronted.

An unknown suspect breaks into Maktoob Hookah Lounge in Flagstaff, Arizona, spray-painting walls with swastikas, breaking mirrors, and setting objects on fire. Aaron Jasim, the owner of the business, reports having received multiple threats in the past.

Isam and Tina Saed, owners of the Middle Eastern Bakery and Deli in Phoenix, Arizona, discover that someone has broken the large front window of their shop. They report that this is the second such incident since the 2016 presidential election.

Residents in Northeast Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, raise concerns over the opening of a free medical clinic affiliated with the Islamic Circle of North America. The clinic is open to anyone. TheæCity Zoning Boardæof Adjustment approved the clinic in August of 2017.
Members of Masjid Abu-Bakar in Portland, Oregon, discover anti-Muslim graffiti on the front of the building.
Sado Elmi is shot multiple times while driving home from work in Columbus, Ohio. The unidentified suspect, who was also driving a vehicle, followed Elmi and fired into the car without warning.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unidentified suspect is caught on video breaking intoæthe Bangladesh Islamic Center Hammtrack in Detroit, Michigan.

House Bill 911, which prohibits the use of foreign law, is passed out of the Judiciary and Civil Jurisprudence Committee in the Texas State Legislature. While shari'a law is not mentioned in the language, Rep. Berman has cited the spread of shari'a law when defending the legislation.æ

Muslim panelists are asked to recite the pledge of alleigance by an audience member at an educational panel at the Orland Park Library in Orland Park, Illinois. The organizer of the event denied the request, but the panelists were interrupted throughout the event by shouted accusations andæanti-Islam statements.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Holtz, Michael. 2013. "Forum on Islam Gets Contentious in Orland Park." Chicago Tribune, Aug 25, 11-1.11.

Event Description: Dimitrious Zias attacks an Orthodox Jewish mother and daughter in Queens, New York, mistaking them for Muslims. He screems anti-Muslim epithets while punching them repeatedly. Authorities charged him with assault as a hate crime.

The National Report publishes a fake news article that claims that the city of Dearborn, Michigan, voted to become the first city to fully implement shari'a law. The article was widely circulated on social media and other news sites prompting citizens to call Dearborn City Hall in a panic. The response was so extreme that the mayor released a statement affirming the city's governance by the U.S Constitution, and expressed concern over the article's use in promoting anti-Muslim sentiment in Dearborn.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Food bank volunteers at the BaitulæEhsaan (Abode of Kindness) mosque in Monroe, Washington, arrive to find expletives spray-painted on the building.æ
Members of The Official Street Preachers, a Los Angeles-based group, demonstrate in front of theæOmar Ibn El-Khattab Mosque in Columbus, Ohio, chanting pro-Trump and anti-Muslim sentiments.

The Global Faith Institute hosts former FBI agent John Guandolo at an event in Oakland, Iowa. Guandolo is well known for making public presentations that claim Islam poses an existential threat to the United States. The chairman of the Pottwattamie County GOP organized the event.

An unidentified suspect attacks a man in the Bushwick section of Brooklyn, New York, making anti-Muslim remarks, slapping the victim's cell-phone to the ground, and punching him in the neck. The attack occured at a subway stop in broad daylight.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Two boys shatter every window of the Islamic Society of Greater Manchester in Manchester, New Hampshire.æPolice reported that the vandals bragged about the damage caused to the mosque online and left comments on anti-Muslim hate sites.

The Council on American-Islamic Relations calls for the police of Fairfax county, Virgina, to charge Jenny Tesh-Crabbe with assault after she allegedlyæmade anti-Muslim comments to a cab driver and poked him repeatedly in the back.æThe encounter was recorded by the cabdriver and submitted to the police.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Ed Dahlberg is served with a misdemeanor assault charge after attacking a taxi driver and fleeing the scene on foot in Fairfax, Virginia.æThe driver, Mohamed Salim, told police that Dahlberg compared him to the Boston Marathon bombing suspects and repeatedly punched him, resulting in a fractured jaw, a head injury, and hearing loss.

A college student is attacked by two men outside of a Boston, Massachusetts, restaurant. The assailants called the student a terrorist andætold him he looked like a suspect of the Boston Marathon Bombing.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A woman is assaulted while pushing her baby in a stroller in Malden, Massachusetts.æA man ran towards Heba Abolaban and punched in the shoulder before screaming anti-Muslimæstatements, including accusing Abolaban of the Boston Marathon Bombing.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Someone graffitis a image of planes hitting the World Trade Center on the office door of the Muslim Student Association at Montclair State Universityæin Montclair, New Jersey.æ

Sheree Sabater and Antoinette Ivey assault Quratul Ain on her weekly walk to the grocery store in Niagra Falls, New York. Ain was walking with her husband and two children when Sabater and Ivey approached and shouted an ethnic slur at her and yelled, "She's Pakistani and I want to kill her."æThey proceeded to beat Ain unconscious. Ivey was arrested and charged with third-degree assault as a hate crime.
Source: Specht, Charlie. 2011. "Hate Crime Victim Won't Give in to Fear." McClatchy - Tribune Business News, Jul 20.æ

Event Description: Aissatou Diallo is attacked in New York City, New York, after she asks a woman to stop taking her picture on her cell phone. The woman responded that Diallo was a terroist and that she wanted to kill her. She proceeded to punch Diallo, pulled off Diallo's head scarf, and pushed her to the ground. The two women were charged with assault.æ

Several students pulled at the head scarf of a 13-year-old Muslim girl in Staten Island, New York.  One of the 11-year-old students was charged with third-degree assault as a hate crime and placed in a juvenile detention center without bail.
Source: Sandoval, Edgar, Matthew Lysiak, Rich Schapiro, Meredith Kolodner, Rocco Parascandola, and Alison Gendar. 2011. "CALLED HER A TERRORIST Muslim Girl Tells of Attacks by Her Two S.I. Schoolmates & Hate they Spewed." New York Daily News, Apr 01, 12.

Event Description: A group of unidenitifed suspects call a man a terrorist, hit him with a bottle, and punch him as he leaves a store in San Jose, California.æNobody was arrested for the attack.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Joshua Scaggs stabs Snurudha Udeni Dhammika Dharmapala in the throat on a platform in the Illinois Terminalæin Champaign, Illinois. Scaggs claimed that he was trying to "save his country" and was charged with attempted murder and aggravated battery.æ

The Gainesville Police Department in Gainesville, Flordia, suspends OfficeræNicholas Domicoæafter finding that he violated the department's anti-discrimination policy. Domico admitted to approaching select area businesses, advising them to contact him if customers of Middle Eastern appearance were acting suspiciously in their establishments.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Police in Wichita, Kansas, arrestæSattar Ali under suspicison of attempted forgery. Ali, who had recently moved to Wichita to enroll in graduate school, was depositing a check from the sale of his former home when police arrived and arrested him. They verified the check only after his arrest. Officers also arrested Ali's wife and daughter, who had been waiting in the car.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: TheæMinnehaha County Republic Party organizes and hosts a Liberty Rally in Sioux Falls, South Dakota, at which the featured speaker urged South Dakota lawmakers to pass legislation labeling Muslim advocacy organizations hate groups and restricting refugee settlement in and immigration to the state. The event was attended byæfive state legislators and two Republic gubernatorial candidates. At least one legislator reported that they intended to introduce legislation along the lines proposed during the event.

Prabhjot Singh and a friend are walking in New York City, New York, when a group of young men on bicycles shoutæïTerrorist, Osama, get him,Í and begin to chase Singh.æThey caught up to the men and attacked them, fracturing Singh's jaw, until a group of pedestrians intervened. The men on bikes were not identified.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The San Diego Police bring a bomb squad to Larry Michael Rodgers apartment in San Diego, California, after he allegedly walked into the Islamic Center of San Diego, caused a disruption, then walked out saying, ñIÍm going to kill all of you.îæRodgers was arrested on suspicion of making terrorist threats.æPolice also investigated Rodger's possible connection to bomb threats made against the Islamic School of Sand Diego earlier that summer.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Daniel Quinnellæshoots Cameron Mohammed point-blank in the head with a pellet gun in a Walmart parking lot in Lutz, Florida. Before shooting Mohammed, Quinnell shouted racial epithets and asked Mohammed if he was from the Middle East or a Muslim. When Mohammed said no, Quinnell shot off 20 rounds while saying "n----- with a white girl." Mohammed survived with wounds, and Quinnell was charged with a hate crime.

Students at the University of Houston in Houston, Texas, find posters in arts and humanities buildings espousing white nationalist sentiments, including a call to imagine a Muslim-free America. Although no one has claimed responsibility, the posters are similar to others that Vanguard America, formerly known as American Vanguard, has left at other campuses.

Mathew Dunn of Houston, Texas, is charged with assault that caused bodily injury with hate crime additions. Dunn is alleged to have attacked a Lyft driver after verbally attacking him on the basis of his perceived ethnicity and Muslim religious identity.

Simchon Schwartz calls his neighbor an "Arab terrorist" and pours a beer on her in an unprovoked attack in Brooklyn, New York. When Turan's husband attempts to defend her, Schwartz punches him in the face after yelling "F---ing Arabs! F---ing terrorists!" He then keyed their car. Schwartz was arrested that night and was held on $60,000 bail.æ

William Blackford kicks and shatters the glass door of a Son's Stop & Shop in Houma, Louisiana, and calls the police to tell them that he did it because of the store owners' heritage. He told the police "I want to kill them all. We need to get them out of our country." The family who owns the store is Muslim. Blackford was arrested and was released on a $7,500 bond.æ

Yusuf Mohamed finds the inside of his vehicle smeared with animal feces in Fargo, South Dakota. He suspects that the incident may be an extension of a verbal assault he suffered at the hands of a neighbor a few days prior, during which the neighbor used a series of ethnic and religious slurs in telling Mohamed that he does not belong in the United States.

Mohamed Salahudeen files a lawsuit againt Terrace on the Green, in Queens, New York, alleging that his supervisor at the establishment regularly harassed and belittled him on the basis of his religious and ethnic identity.æThe suit claims that the company ignored Salahudeen repeated complaints.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The chairman of the Republican Party inæRussell County, Alabama, confirms that he and Republican candidate for Senate Roy Moore are both anti-Muslim, adding that he does not understand why this is a problem and that he does not have any issues with anyone else's religion as long as they are Christian.

After the fire alarm goes off during a seminar for Houston WorldFest in Houston, Texas,æthe executive director of the film festival approaches a woman who is wearing a head scarf and asks to search her backpack.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Kanwaljit Singh, a Sikh man who was wearing a turban, is shot at six times by an unknown person in black truck as he is driving his son home in Dunlawton, Florida. Singh was hit twice and was taken to intensive care.æThe U.S. Department of Justice and local police investigated the incident as a hate crime.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A truck pulls up next to Aisha, a Muslim student, and the passengers begin to shout "you don't belong here," "your people need to be killed," and "you are a terrorist." She began to pull out her cell phone, but the driver pulled out a gun and pointed it at her. Nobody has been arrested or identified relating to the incident.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Men, Calvin. 2011. "Woman: Scarf Spurred Threat." Detroit News, Aug 08. https://search.proquest.com/docview/881485536?accountid=7379.

Event Description: A Rutherford County Chancery Court judge in Murfreesboro, Tennesee, denies a temporary restraining order request that opponents of the Islamic Center of Murfreesboro submitted to halt the construction of the center's proposed cemetery. Opponents of the cemetery have tried for over three years to halt the construction of the cemetery through various lawsuits and appeals.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: In an interview with the Christian radio host, Jan Markel,æin Maple Grove, Minnesota, Rep. Michele Bachmann (R-MN) states that American mosquesæseek to "advance the goals" of terrorist organizations.æ
Source: "6th Rep. Input on Mosque, Refugees Knocked." 2013. St.Cloud Times, Oct 13, 1.æ

Event Description: Vandals target theæIslamic Society of the Appalachian Region in Princeton, West Virginia.æThe vandals wrote defamatory phrases about Allah, anti-Muslimæwords, and "666", in reference to the anti-christ.

The Islamic Society of Delaware in Newark, Delaware, is vandalized by three teenagers.æThe teenagers broke the fence, knocked down a wooden sign, and damaged an LED message sign. The teenagers were charged with criminal mischief andæsecond degree conspiracy.
Someone spray paints a swastika on the side of the Islamic Center of Morris County in Rockaway, New Jersey. The vandalism was investigated as a possible hate crime.
The Mehfil-e-Shah-e-Khorasan Charitable Trust Mosque in Englewood, New Jersey, recieves several bomb threats. As a precaution, the local police sent a bomb squad and a K9 unit to the mosque.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Someone throws a piece of metal through the window of the Masjid Noor Mosqueæin Huntington, New York.
Someone spray paints "USA" on the welcome sign of the Islamic Center of Burlington in Burlington, Massachusetts.æ

Charles Ernest Lundquist, Jr.,ætries to run Rose Garcia-Corrigan off the road inæPoinciana, Florida. Garcia-Corrigan alleged that Lundquist almost ran her off the road three times, and that Lundquist made fun of her hijab as he drove.æLundquist denied targeting Garcia-Corrigan because of her faith, and told authorities that he was enraged by Garcia-Corrigan trying to pass him on the roadway.æPolice determined that the event was not a hate crime.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Immediately after Nina Davuluri is crownedæMiss America in Las Vegas, Nevada,æpeople take to Twitter to condemn her as a terrorist and make anti-Muslim comments.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown vandal defaces a campaign sign for Zainab Baloch, a candidate for city council in Raleigh, North Carolina, with racial and religious epithets. Baloch, a longtimeæresident of the city, reported that though she is not surprised the incident remains hurtful and traumatizing.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Employees at the Multnomah County Health Department discover a sticker advocating violence against Muslims in a break room.æIt is unclear if it was left in the room by a county employee.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A staff member at Western Washington University, in Bellingham, Washington, discovers flyers and graffiti on a "free-speech board" in a university building advocating violence against Muslims. This is the third such incident since the beginning of the academic year.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Great Neck Synagogue in Great Neck, New York, invites Pamela Geller to speak to the synagogue's men's club on the ñImposition of Sharia in America.î Geller is a knownæanti-Muslim organizer and author. After many organizations protested the talk, the synagogue canceled Geller's appearance.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Kentucky Senator Rand Paul (R) declares that there is a global "war on Christianity" at the Values Voters Summit in Washington, D.C. He told the crowd to be ready to go to war against radical Islam, andædeclared that Muslims should be policing other Muslims in the U.S.

A worker at a Walmart store in Hamburg, New York, posts a picture of two Muslim women along with an anti-Muslim rant on Facebook. The Council for American-Islamic Relations reached out to the Walmart management, and the employee was fired.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Police investigate a vandalism done at Joe Davidson Park in Burlington, North Carolina. Vandals drew graphic images, a swastika, and racial slurs towards Muslims and other groups.

Protestors fromæthe Tea Party of Fort Lauderdale demand that a mosque in Margate, Florida, be shut down after its imam was charged with sending money to the Pakistani Taliban. The protesters wanted the whole mosque community to be investigated, although members of law enforcement continued to remind the protesters that they should not assume that a whole community is involved in a situation based on one member's actions.æ

Tim Brown, a firefighter during 9/11, states thatæa mosque near Gound Zero would be a "victory tower" andæcalls Feisal Abdul Rauf an "imposter imam" in Chapel Hill, North Carolina.æHe talked about how the terrorists who crashed the planes into the Twin Towers had the same beliefs as Imam Rauf. During his speech, he discussed how Imam Rauf was endangering the United States by trying to implement Sharia law.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Way, Dan E. 2011. "9/11 Survivors Appear with the Christian Action Network." Herald Sun with Chapel Hill Herald, Mar 17. https://search.proquest.com/docview/861044412?accountid=7379.

Event Description: Members of the Islamic Center of Prince Edward County in Farmville, Virginia, discover anti-Muslim graffiti on an exterior wall of the building.
Faud Masireh, owner of a small grocery store in the Bronx, New York, arrives at work to find anti-Arab graffiti on the front door of the building.

Police at the University of South Florida in Tampa, Florida, confirm that they investigated a threat againstæLinda Sarsour, a guest speaker at the university. The investigation found that the threat by Wes Giuliano, posted on social media, did not warrant criminal charges, but that he would be arrested if found on campus.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Minnesota chapter of the Council on American-Islamic Relations filesæa claim of discrimination with the Minnesota Department of Human Rights on behalf of Rania Elsweisy, who was asked to leave the Hibbing Area WomenÍs Retreat in Hibbing, Minnesota, because of her religion.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Six inmates in the Greene County Jail in Springfield, Missouri, claim religious discrimination and are seeking $20 million in damages under the Civil Rights Act, the Religious Land Use and Institutionalized Persons Act, and the U.S. Constitution. The inmates allege that they have been denied congregational Friday prayer, no access to religious materials such as the Quran and Hadith, and insufficient space for daily prayers.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Rollins, Jess. 2013. "Muslim Inmates File Discrimination Suit." Springfield News Leader, Aug 10.

Event Description: Two FDNY firefightersæfile notices of claim informing the city of New York, New York, of their intent to sue over workplace discrimination.æThe two men allege that they regularily experienced anti-Hispanic and anti-Muslimæslurs and discrimination.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A 12-year-old boy in Brooklyn, New York, files a lawsuit after he is barred entry from a public city bus for being Muslim. The boy alleges that he was called derogatory names and barred to enter the bus by the driver afteræthe boy recited a prayer aloud.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: 24 Muslim workers are fired from DHL Global Mail in Hebron, Kentucky, for stopping to say five-minute evening prayers. The incident happened after supervisors reversed a flexible break timeæpolicy.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unidentified male attacks University of Washington student Nasro Hassan, hitting her in the face with a bottle. The attack took place on the University of Washington's campus in Seattle, Washington. Hassan suffered from bruising and a concussion as a result of the incident.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Police arrest Zachary Phinney, a student at Salem State University in Salem, Massachusetts, after he shoved a policy officer investigating public hate speech on campus. In custody, Phinney claimed that he hates all black people and thinks that Muslims should die.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A former mechanic-in-training at Metro Cars in Taylor, Michigan, files a compaint with the Michigan Department of Civil Rights, alleging that he was harassed, disciplined, and ultimately fired after disclosing his religious identity. æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Bob Marley, a member of the Taylor Township board in Taylor Township, Indiana, defends his confrontation with protestors at Solid Rock Ministries, who were disrupting a presentation by noted anti-Muslim activist and preacher Usama Dakdok. Marley, who is on record calling Islam an evil religion, claimed that he was acting in his capacity as an elected official in confronting the protestors. The visit came out of Marley's disagreement with the Kokomo City Council's decision to include a Muslim prayer at the start of a council meeting in 2017.

Prosecutors charge Joe Nereim with malicious harassment, a hate crime, after he allegedly pepper-sprayed three people following an anti-Muslim tirade at a Seattle, Washington, 7-Eleven.æNereim appeared to target a woman wearing a headscarf.

Local residents in Lebanon, Pennsylvania, argue against the contruction of the Lebanon Valley mosque on grounds that the traffic from frequent prayer services held weekly could endanger children in the area. æOutside of the council meeting, residents used derogatory language when discussing the mosque.æ
Source: Latimer, John. 2011. "Sides Meet in Mosque Dispute." The Daily News, Sep 26. https://search.proquest.com/docview/894143884?accountid=7379.

Event Description: The U.S. Justice Department reaches a settlment in a case accusing Lilburn, Georgia, of discriminating against the proposed expansion of a mosque. The city blocked two rezoning permits that the mosque submitted without evidence that they violated city codes. In the settlement the city promised to apply the same requirements to every religiously oriented building, and city officials will also attend classes discussing federal anti-discrimination laws.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commissionæfiles a lawsuit againstæRizza Cadillac Inc. in Tinley Park, Illinois, for violating federal lawæby allegedly encouraging a work environment that was hostile and offensive to Muslim sales staff. The lawsuit seeks compensatory and punitive damages, and requires the implementation of measures to prevent a recurrence of discrimination.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: "Federal Agency Accuses Car Dealer of Workplace Bias." Chicago Tribune, Sep 26, 2013.

Event Description: The Florida Council on American-Islamic Relationsæappeals the decision of the Hillsborough Area Regional Transit board who voted unanimously not to allow the council to advertise on their buses. The advertisement was about the legal aid that CAIR offers people of any identity, but one of the board members stated that he believed that the rejection had to do with the organization behind the ad, and promoting religion.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: In response to reports from local prisons, the ACLU sends letters to 159 sheriffs across Georgiaæreminding them that the Religious Land Use and Institutionalized Persons Act of 2000 says that governments must have a "compelling" reason to force the removal of scarfs and other head coverings that are worn for religious reasons.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Glen Crawford, a member of the KKK, is arrested for attempting to build a radiation-emitting device in order to attack a Muslim organization, President Obama, and ña political figureî, who authorities guess is Governor Cuomo.æHe was convicted of conspiring to use a weapon of mass destruction and distributing information relating to weapons of mass destruction, and sentenced to 30 years in prison.

U.S. District Judge Jane Magnus-Stinson rules in favor of John Walker Lindh and other Muslim inmates who were barred from having group prayer by a high security prison inæTerre Haute, Indiana.æThe lawsuit was originally filed in 2009.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Des Plaines City Council rejects theæAmerican Islamic Center's proposal to convert empty office buildings into a mosque in Des Plaines, Illinois.æThe proposal was allegedly rejected because the rezoning of the office building would lose the city tax revenue, though the planning comission recommended that the council accept the proposal. Representatives of the Islamic Center made it clear that they would sue the city if the proposal was rejectedæbecause it would be inæviolation of federal laws regarding religious discrimination.æ

An unidentified person calls the Murfreesboro Islamic Centeræand threatens to blow it up on September 11 in Murfreesboro, Tennesse. The person also made derogatory comments about Muslims in the call.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Haas, Brian. 2011. "Murfreesboro Mosque Receives Bomb Threat; Feds Investigate." The Tennessean, Sep 07.

Event Description: The American Freedom Defense Intitiative submits an anti-Islam ad campaign to theæMetropolitan Transportation Authority inæNew York, New York.æ
Source: "Activist Submits Anti-Islam Ads to MTA". The Journal News, Mar 30, 2013.æ

Event Description: The American Freedom Defense Initiative submits an anti-Islam add campaign for display in Boston, Massachusetts-area public transportation. The Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority rejected the campaign, a decision upheld in federal court.

The Maryland Conservative Action Network hosts a daylong conference entitled "Turning the Tides," in Annapolis, Maryland, which features Pamela Geller and Frank Gaffney. Gelleræheads Stop the Islamization of America.æFrank Gaffney, another known anti-Muslim activist, heads the Center for Security Policy.æ

The Minnesota chapter of the Council on American Islamic Relations asks the Little Falls school district to cancel an appearanceæby anti-Muslim speaker Brigitte Gabriel at Little Falls Community High School in Little Falls, Minnesota.æGabrielæis an active member of ACT! for America, a known anti-Muslim organization.
Source: "Islamic Civil Rights Group Asks Little Falls School to Drop Tea Party Speaker." St.Cloud Times, Jul 24, 2013.

Event Description: Tennessee State Representative Rick Womick, speaking at the Preserving Freedom conference in Madison, Tennessee,æstates that he does not trust Muslims in the U.S. military. When an attendee asked him if he would remove all Muslims from the military, he responded, "absolutely, yeah."

Tarek Ghalayani, a Muslim man,æorders a takeout burger in Houston, Texas, and receives it with "Happy September 11" and a picture of the Twin Towers and a plane scrawled on the container. As he left the restaurant, an employee shouted racially charged insults at him.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Authorities at the Sherburne County jail in Elk River, Minnesota, refuse to allow Amina Farah Ali, a Muslim inmate, to wear her headscarf, citing safety concerns. County SheriffæJoel Brott stated that her headscarf could be used to hurt people or to hide contraband.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A small group of residents in Greeley,æColorado, publicly urge the City Council to reject a proposed mosque out of concern for the threat of shari'a and terrorism.
Unknown suspects break windows andæenter the Dar al-Farooq Islamic Center in Bloomington, Minnesota. In early August of 2017, unknown suspects planted and detonated a bomb at the same mosque.

Campus security at Wright State University inæDayton, Ohio, report the discovery anti-Muslim graffitiæin buildings across campus. This was part of a series of incidents over a two-week period that included sexist, racist, and anti-semitic graffiti as well.

Glenn Mack accuses Whole Foods of firing him for being Muslim. He states that after hiding his faith for his first few years of employment at a Whole Foods location in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, he told his supervisor that he needed time off toægo to Mecca. After he returned from the trip, they began to watch him pray, forcing him to pray by a dumpster, and they eventually fired him. Whole Foods insists that they fired him foræabsenteeism.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Authorities chargeæGerard Medvec of Delaware City, Delaware, withæterroristic threatening in association with a hate crime after he speaks with police about firebombing his neighbors' house because they are Muslim. Speaking with investigators, he claimed that his neighbors were tracking his movements and were part of a Muslim conspiracy in the United States. Medvec's neighbors are not Muslim.

After congressman Mike Quigley gives a speech atæthe American Islamic College in Chicago, Illinois, in which he apologized to attendees for Islmophobia in the U.S.,æhe recieves hundreds of complaints, and even many death threats at his office. He was also publically criticized on Fox News for making up statistics about Islamophobia in the U.S.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A grave site in the Muslim burial section of the Evergreen Cemetery in Evergreen Park, Illinois, is defaced for the second time in two weeks, and the seventh time in the last few years.æ Authorities believe that it is the same perpetrators.æ

The U.S. attorney's office in Minneapolis, Minnesota, launches a formal civil rights investigation into the rejection of a proposed Islamic center in the St. Anthony neighborhood.æThe mosque was formally rejected on grounds of zoning issues, but St. Anthony residents expressed opposition to the project and made disparaging remarks about Muslims at meetings.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Civil Rights Division of the Justice Department and the Islamic Center of Murfreesboro file seperate lawsuits so that the community can finally use the facilities of the Islamic Center of Murfreesboro inæMurfreesboro, Tennessee. The new mosque was builtæafter a two year conflict between neighbors and the center. Judge Todd J. Campbell of Federal District Court in Nashville issued a temporary restraining order, allowing the community to use the new mosque in time for Ramadan.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Worshippers arriveæatæthe Dar al Hijrah Mosque in Falls Church, Virginia, to findæanti-Muslim and racist grafitti on the walls of the building.
Members of the Dar al Hijrah Mosque in Falls Church, Virginia, leave their morning prayer to findæthat someone smashed in the windows of the 30 parked cars surrounding the mosque.æ

A federal judge throws out a lawsuit filed against the U.S. government and the FBI over the agency's spying on Orange County, California, Muslims, ruling that allowing the suit to go forward would risk divulging sensitive state secrets. The suit was filed on grounds that the FBI indiscriminately targeted Muslims based on their religion, planted bugs in offices and homes, and listened in on private religious conversations.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Terry Jones, a pastor from Florida who is a known anti-Muslim activist stages an anti-Islam protest outside ofæEdsel Ford High School in Dearborn, Michigan, and urges students to join with him by walking out of school to protest the bullying of non-Muslim students by Muslim students. The Dearborn police were present in force for the protest butænever intervened.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Police chargeæChristopher Lee Beckham of Nashville, Tennessee, withæmisdemeanoræasssault for allegedlyæthreatening two girls walking home from school. Beckham allegedlyætold them they were not welcome in the United States and that they should go back to where they came from before threatening to beat them up. When the girls' father, who happened to be in the area, intervened, Beckham allegedly swung a knife at him, leading to a further charge ofæfelony aggrevated assault.

School officials at Kent-Meridian High School in Kent, Washington, find anti-Muslim graffiti in a girls bathroom.æTheæmessage claimed that all Muslims would die on 10/30 and included swastikas and MAGA, a reference to Donald Trump's campaign slogan, Make American Great Again.

White nationalist groups stage an anti-refugee protest in Shelbyville, Tennessee. It is the largest gathering of white nationalist groups following a gathering in Charlottesville, Virginia, in August of 2017. The protest attracted a sizable counter-protest.

White nationalist groups stage an anti-refugee protest in Murfreesboro, Tennessee. Event organizers cancelled the official event, meant to follow an earlier gathering in Shelbyville, Tennessee, although a small group of white nationalists continued the protest. The event attracted a larger counter-protest.

Gunman Michael Page goes on a rampage in the Sikh Temple of Wisconsin in Oak Creek, Wisconsin, killing six people and wounding three.æPage was shot and killed by responding police officers, and was an army veteran and known white supremacist.
The manager of TDS Insurance in Brooklyn, New York, arrives at work to find anti-Islam graffiti that says "Allah is s--t".
After the Muslim Public Affairs Council plans to hold its meeting at the All Saints Episcopal Church in Pasadena, California, the church recieves a large amount of threatening and anti-Muslim mail.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A muslimæcemetery and funeral home is lit on fire by an unknown person in Las Vegas, Nevada, and experiencesædamages between $1.5 million and $2 million.æ
