Federal Judge Paul A. Engelmayer rules that the Metropolitan Transport Authority in New York, New York, violated theæFirst Ammendment Rights of a pro-Israel group when itærejected an anti-Islam advertisement on grounds of it being derogatory and demeaning. As a result an anti-Islam ad was run across the nation on public buses.æ

Stephen Kirby, a retired Los Angeles police detective, speaks at a Sioux County Conservatives' Pizza and Policy meeting in Sioux City, Iowa. Kirby, who is the author of numerous self-published works on Islam based on his understanding of the Qur'an and traditions of the Prophet, questions whether Islam is compatible with American values. The event was held at the public library.

Clifford Adams, a faculty member at the College-Conservatoryæof Music at the University of Cincinnati in Cincinnati, Ohio, writes demeaning anti-Muslim comments in response to a Muslim student's essay in his "What's Hot in Popular Music" class. His comments, appearing on a course web site, were visible to all students in the class.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Unknown suspects place a bacon-draped cross in the yard of the Islamic Center of Twin Falls in Twin Falls, Idaho. The police are treating the event as a hate crime, calling it malicious harassment The Islamic Center has been the subject of previous vandalism and threats.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: CongressmanæClay Higgins, a retired law enforcement officer who represents the third district in Louisiana, posts a message on social media calling for "Christendom" to kill all "radicalized Muslims."
The Islamic Center of Passaic County in Patterson, New Jersey, receives a series ofæeight phone calls threatening violence and calling for Muslims to leave the country.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A fire destroys the Petra Mediterranean Restaurant in Wichita, Kansas.æAuthorities suspect arson after the restaurant ownersæRanya Taha andæBashar Mahanweh discover the words "Go Home" painted on a storage unit behind the building.
The Omar Mosque in Patterson, New Jersey, receives threatening phone calls
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: TheæDayton Daily News reports that Mike Kilroy, a candidate for the ValleyæView School Boardæin Germantown, Ohio, made a series of virulently anti-Muslim social media posts, accusing Muslims of pedophiliaæand Barak Obama of treason, among other things. Kilroy claims his account had been hacked, thought the posts were removed shortly after the Daily News sought comment.

Campaign fliers appear in Hoboken, New Jersey, suggesting that RaviæBhalla, a member of the City Council who is running for mayor, is a terrorist or terrorist sympathiser. Bhalla is Sikh American and wears a turban.

Maryam Naziri, a student at UnionæCounty College inæCranford, New Jersey, files a federal lawsuit alleging thatæMarsha Worrell, a math professor at the College, discriminated against her in class because of her religious identity, berated her in front of other students, and accused her of making terroristic threats when speaking with the school's affirmative action officer after Naziri filed a complaint.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: New Vision Academy Charter School in Nashville, Tennessee, suspends a teacher after she posts two videos to social media of students removing a fellow-student's headscarf, adding the captions "pretty hair" and "lol all that hair covered up." The videos were shot in a classroom at the school.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A man approachesæSonia Ammar outside a store in Northumbria, Pennsylvania, and announces that all terrorists should be shot while mimicking firing a gun into the air.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A manæuses a hammer to break windows and security cameras at theæBeit al-Maqdis Islamic Center in Brooklyn, New York.
A man uses a hammer toævandalize the Fatih Camii Mosque in Brooklyn, New York.

Authorities charge Michael Dickey with battery, disorderly conduct, and two hate crimes for yelling anti-Muslim slurs and attempting to remove the headscarf of a woman outside of Walmart in Dekalb, Illinois.

Northeast Middle School in Bristol, Connecticut, cancels a visit byæAnnam Choudhry to a world religions course because of threats the teacher and school began receiving after the school announced the event. Choudhry founded YURSA, an organization that trains Muslim women in giving public presentations on Islam.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown suspect approaches a 19-year-old man in Ellensburg, Washington, and makes anti-Muslim comments before punching the victim, who the assailant presumed to be Muslim.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Anti-shari'a protestors gather at the Inland Regional Center in San Bernadino, California,æsite of a mass shooting in 2015. Anti-fascist protestors held a counter-rally.

The Fairfax County School Districtæplaced a teacher on leave after an incident at theæLake Braddock Secondary School in Burke, Virginia. The teacher allegedly removed a student's headscarf. The teacher apologized to the student and her family. Other students in the class question the student's account.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Chicago Tribune publishes excerpts from a Civilian Office of Police Accountability report documenting the activities of Brian Hansen, an officer in Chicago, Illinois, who has repeatedly violated department policies prohibiting employees from posting views on social media that disparage people on the basis of race, religion, or sexual orientation. His social media posts advocate violence against Muslims among other groups.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Anti-Muslim protestors assemble multiple times over a series of weeks outside the Islamic Center of Kent in Kent, Washington,æharassing worshipers, shouting anti-Muslim slurs and threats, and causing disturbances during Friday prayers.æ

Maimona Afzal Berta, an 8th grade special education teacher at Fischer Middle School in East San Jose, California, files a grievance against the AlumæRock Union School District for a failure to create a safe working environment. Berta reports 15æ incidents since the beginning of 2017, includingæanti-Muslim graffiti in her classroom on September 11 and numerous instances of hateful speech from students.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: At the White House in Washington, D.C., President Donald Trump retweets posts fromæBritain First, a far-right anti-Muslim British organization that claims Muslims are seeking to impose shari'a on the United Kingdom. Among those President Trump retweeted is Jayda Fransen, who is facing hate crimes charges in the United Kingdom related to her work with the organization.
A man is captured by security cameras leaving a sign with anti-Muslim messages at the Masjid al-Madinah mosque and educational center in Upper Darby, Pennsylvania.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: At a grocery store inæTahlequah, Oklahoma, a female customer approaches another customer and instructs her to remove her headscarf, adding that she appeared dangerous because terrorists use such clothing to hide bombs.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Reverend JohnæBoustead, founder of ForOurChildren.Care, invites Elisabeth Sabaditsch-Wolff, an Austrian anti-Muslim activists convicted of hate speech by an Austrian court in 2011, to speak in Bismarck, North Dakota.

Reverend Shahram Hadian, founder ofæTruth in Love Project ministry and anti-Muslim activist, speaks atæCalvary Baptist Church in Eau Claire, Wisconsin. The title of his talk was "The Trojan Horse of Interfaith Dialogue," during which he explained that interfaith initiatives were part of a subversive Muslim conspiracy.

Authorities arrestæBernandino Gawala Bolatete of Jacksonville, Florida, alleging that he was planning on carrying out a mass shooting at the Islamic Center of Northeast Florida. Bolatete has a known history of anti-Muslim posts on social media. The Islamic Center was firebombed in 2010.

Duha Dallah files a complaint with theæTexas Workforce Commission, alleging that after being offered a position at Dillard's department store in Garland, Texas, she was told that she would have to remove her headscarf while on the sales floor.æShe claims the offer was subsequently, though unofficially, rescinded.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Speaking at a rally for Senator Ted Cruz, Republican candidate for President, Representative Steve King of Iowaæquestions whether it is possible for Muslims immigrants and refugees to become part of Western societies. He claims thatædemographics and culture are destiny and that most refugees are economic migrants looking for welfare handouts.

Announcing his candidacy for the US Senate, EW Jackson, an attorney and preacher in Chesapeake, Virginia, and former Republican candidate for state-wide office claims that his chief opponent, Corey Stewart,æis unqualified for office because he does notæunderstand the threat that Muslims pose to the United States. The statement was an apparent reference toæStewart's time onæa county board of supervisors that approved a construction permit for a mosque.

In Washington, DC, The Supreme Court rules that an Executive Order barring citizens fromæsix Muslim-majority countries from entering the United States can go into effect pending further legal action. The Order, which covers immigration as well as tourist and student visas, is the Trump Administration's third attempt at such a measure.

Authorities charge Mark Thomas with second-degree murder in the shooting death ofæAbduh Yafaee, an elderly clerk at 797 Deli in Brooklyn, New York. Thomas was angry that a clerk at the deli would not give him a discount on a beverage, leading him to curse Muslims as terrorists and to return later in the day, when he shot Yafaee.

The Pine Orchard Yacht and Country Club inæBranford, Connecticut, settles a laswuit filed byæKamran and Kara Farid, who claim that their application for membership was denied on the basis of their religion and that other members falsely claimed they supported terrorism.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Tajuddin Ashaheed files a federal lawsuit against the Colorado Department of Corrections, allegingæthat an intake officer forced him to shave his beardæduring processing at the start of a 90-day sentence. The suit claims that the officer, who reportedly told Ashaheed that his beard was not full enough to qualify for religious accommodation, violated Ashaheed's first amendment rights.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic Society of Wichita in Wichita, Kansas, reports a threatening social media post that discussed using the building, which houses a mosque and a school, as a shooting range. Police step up patrols around the premises and investigate the post.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Unknown suspectsæbreak into theæIslamic Center of Frankfort in Frankfort, Kentucky,æfour times between August 30 and November 10. The suspects stole approximatelyæ$1000 from donation boxes.

Representative Bill Kidd, a Republican member of the Missouri state House of Representatives, files a bill to ban foreign law from consideration in state courts. Kidd denies that the bill targets Muslims, although similar efforts across the country have utilized a common approach developed by the American Freedom Law Center to avoid challenge on the basis of religious discrimination.æ

Authorities arrest a student at Franklin Delano Roosevelt High School in Brooklyn, New York, for faxing a bomb threat to his school. The message sought to portray the sender as Muslim, in part through anti-Semitic slurs. Police also suspect the student of two threats sent earlier in December.
Unknown suspects spray-paint graffitiæon the Islamic Center of Clovis. The graffiti includes references to President Trump.

A group of teenage girls attack SouadæKirama in Brooklyn, New York, punching and spitting at her while screaming anti-Muslim slurs. In a Facebook live post just after the attack, Kirama reported that other customers in Panera Bread, where the incident occured, ignored the situation.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Residents of Willmar, Minnesota, express concern over City Council member Ron Christianson' engagement with Islamophobic and racist social media posts.

Texas Commissioner of Agriculture Sid Miller acknowledges that he (inadvertantly) posted a false story on social media about President Trump's removal of a federal judge foræapplying shari'a in a court case.æThe innacurate post remained in place on Miller's Facebook page with the addition of a statement acknowledging that the story is false and declaring that shari'a has no place in the United States.

A teenager in Boca Raton, Flordia, is beaten by three other teenagers while others watch and film the incident. The victim's father claims the attack was motivated by anti-Muslim bias, saying that it is an extension of his daughter's prior experience of anti-Muslim bullying. Law enforcement offers a different account, finding that the incident was not motivated by racial or religious hatred.

William Whalen, a teacher atæNew River Middle School in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, resigns in lieu of termination afteræpreventing a student from entering his classroom, saying "We dont' need anotheræterrorist in this class."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Broward County School District places NancyæDean, a teacher atæWestern High school in Davie, Flordia, on one-year suspension for repeatedly calling students of Middle Eastern heritage terrorists over the fall of 2014 and spring of 2015.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Broward County School Districtæsuspends Maria Valdes, a teacher atæCyprus Bay High School in Weston, Flordia, for five days after sheæcalls a student a "raghead Taliban" in class.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Jan Morgan announces her candidacy for governor of Arkansas, challenging incumbent Asa Hutchinson in the Republican primary. Morgan gained notoriety in early 2015 when she refused entry to a father and son seeking to patronize her gun range, The Gun Cave in Hot Springs, Arkansas, claiming that her business was a Muslim-free zone.æ
Officers in the NYPD discover anti-Muslim graffiti in the men's locker room at Transit 11 station in the Bronx, New York.æThe vandalism appeared to target two Muslim officers.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Police arrest Chad Anton, owner of an auto-repair business in Iowa City, Iowa, for harassing a customer, asking him if he is Muslim, if he is a terrorist, if he is a suicide bomber, if he is wearing a bomb vest, if people fear him on the streets, and if he is planning on blowing up the repair shop. Authorities charged Anton with third degree harassment.

Police arrest Raheem Hassan, a firefighter in Brooklyn, New York, after he threatens to harm colleagues at his station, charging him with misdemeanor aggravated harassment. His lawyer claims that the outburst came after years of anti-Muslim hazing, which was ignored by superiors despite his pleas. Many of the firefighters at the station, including Hassan, have been transferred elsewhere.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Osman Hassan files a lawsuit against Secretary of State Rex Tillerson after waiting nineteen months for a new passport. Hassan, who became a citizen in 2013, lived and worked outside of the country for stretches, including in Saudi Arabia.æThe Department of State has continued to list his passport application as pending.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic Center ofæthe Appalachian Region inæPinceton, West Virginia, receives a letter saying thatæa bomb will be placed at the mosque during the month of August.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Authorities chargeæKevin Keating with harassment as a hate crime and menacing in the third degree after he approachedæa man exiting theæBangladesh Muslim Centre of New York in Brooklyn, New York, verbally threatening him and brandishing a taser.

State Senator Neal Tapio of Watertown, South Dakota, interrupts an interfaith day celebration at the state Capitol, declaring the need to ban travel to the United States by Muslim individuals. Interfaith day, he said, was a "political movement."

Shantel Krebs, Secretary of State of South Dakota and Republican candidate for Congress, declares her support for a new version of the National Security Entry-Exit Registration System, which was implemented in the wake of the September 11, 2001, attacks. Critics suggest that such a program is tantamount to a Muslim registry, though proponents, including Krebs, deny that it has any connection to religious identity.

Residents attending a City Council meeting voice objections to a proposed mosque in Carmel, Indiana. An on-line petition opposing the Center is also in circulation. Many objections follow a pattern of opposition based on property values, traffic concerns, and mixed-use zoning that is common in other cases across the country. Some posts on the petition are explicit in opposing the project on religious grounds.

McKinneyæIndependent School District officials learn thatæJustin Barton, a teacher atæCockrill Middle School inæMcKinney, Texas, has a documented history of making anti-Muslim and anti-Islam comments on social media. The district announced that they have taken actions to address the situation, but did not elaborate, saying that although the district does not condone the statements it defends Barton's right to expression.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Anti-Muslim and anti-Islam activist and founder of Straight Way of Grace Ministry Usama Dakdok speaks at the Cascade Town Hall in Cascade Township, Minnesota.æThe organizer of the event, Gary Froiland, rented the space for a "family affair," not mentioning the nature of Dakdok's three-hour presentation. The event, held in a public space, was invitation only.

In an interview with the Bangor Daily Mail, Jackman, Maine, Town Manager Tom Kawczynski says that Islam is fundamentally incompatible with Western civilization. Kawczynski started New Albion shortly after moving to Maine, an organization that advocates voluntary separation of races.

Carl Higbie, appointed by President Trump to serve as chief of external affairs in the Corporation for National and Community Service, in Washington, DC, which runs AmeriCorps and other volunteer programs, resigns his position after a history of openly racist and anti-Muslim public statements came to light.

Azfar Quddus, of Ventura County, California,æappeals to the CaliforniaæDepartment of Education to address the use of anti-Islamic and anti-Muslim educational materials from billionbibles.org in his son's middle school social studies class. Officials in the MesaæUnion School District took no visible action in response to Quddus' complaints, offering instead to remove his son from the class.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: President Donald Trump appoints Frank Wuco as a senior advisor at the Department of Homeland Security. Wuco, a former Nacy intelligence officer, has a history of anti-Muslim and anti-Islam activism.

A group of anti-Islam protestors gather outside of the Hillsbourough County School District's public office in Tampa, Florida, toæprotest a previous visit from a representative of the Council on American-Islamic Relations in the schools, and to demonstrate against the "radicalization" of students and the threat of Islam. A group of counter-protestors was also present at the district offices.

The board of the Hewlett-Woodmere Public School District, located inæWoodmere, New York, reject the request of district administrators to close schools on Muslim holy days, maintaining that insufficient secular purpose would be served by closure. The decision came amidst alleged anti-Muslim statements at meetings and circulating in the community.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Eidler, Scott. 2018. "School District Decides Not to Add Muslim Holy Days to Calendar." Newsday, Jan 23.æ

Event Description: The owners of Normandy Green Apartments inæFlorence, Kentucky, agree to settle a claim made to the Kentucky Commission on Human Rights byæMohamed Yesiem, who alleged the complex discriminated against him on the basis of religious identity when they turned down his rental application.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Republican leaders in the Idaho State House agree to introduce a bill banning foreign law in state judicial proceedings. The bill, which resembles other introduced in state legislatures across the country, does not mention shari'a specifically. However, when the bill was first introduced in 2016, sponspors circulated a draft along with materials making clear the bill's intent.

Anti-Islam social media posts byæJeanieæAmes, a candidate for school board in the Parkway School District just outside St. Louis, Missouri, come to light.æAmong the posts is a call to ban Islam in the United States.

Libby Hilsenrath, a resident ofæChatham, New Jersey, filesæa complain and request for trial in federal court, alleging that the Chathman School Districtærequired her son, who is a seventh-grader at Chatham Middle School, toæaccept lessons and homework assignments advocating conversion to Islam. The material in question was part of a unit inæWorld Cultures and Geography. The complaint was co-signed by theæThomas More Law Center, which has connections to anti-Muslim and anti-Islam activism and whose mission is to defend the Judeo-Christian heritage and moral values of the United States. The complaint alleges that the unit violates students'æreligious freedom.

Former FBI agent John Guandolo speaks at the 'Constituion or Sharia' conference in Madison, Tennesse. He declared that all mosques are a front for the Muslim Brotherhood andæthat First Amendment rights do not belong to their members. He also stated that the Muslim Brotherhood controlled U.S. national security.æ
Source: Smietana, Bob. 2011. "Anger, Fear, Determination Permeate Anti-Shariah Conference at Madison Church." The Tennessean, Nov 12. https://search.proquest.com/docview/903490689?accountid=7379

Event Description: Army Lt. Col. Matthew Dooley isæremoved as an instructor at the National Denfense University at Fort Lesley J. McNair in Washington, D.C. He was removed after his course on the dangers of radical Islam wasæfound to be inflammatory andæagainst theævalues of the institution.

The Florida Senate Criminal and Civil Justice Subcommittee approves legislation that would ban any court or legal authority from using any sort of religious or foreign law as part of a legal decision or contract. 50 people, primarily from Muslim and Jewish advocacy groups, appeared at the meeting to oppose the legislation but were not allowed to testify. Thisælegislation is similar to other legislation across the country that seeks to ban shari'a law from courts.

A religious discrimination lawsuit filed on behalf of Omayma Arafa against the Diocese of Allentown is settled out of court in Easton, Pennsylvania. Arafa filed the lawsuit after her position at the church was terminated, and alleged lonstanding patterns of workplace religious discrimination.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A woman alleges that she was discriminated against at the Valley National Bank branch in Tulsa, Oklahoma, for wearing a hijab. This was the second reported instance of religious discrimination inside the branch. A bank representative worked with a representative from the Islamic Society of Tulsa to establish a protocol that allowed religious expression and safety concerns of the bank, which does not allow one to wear hats and sunglasses inside the bank, to work together.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The U.S. Supreme Court in Washington, D.C. denies an appealæfrom Orange County, California, after the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals ruled thatæSouhair Khatib could sue after being forced to take off her hijab in a pre-trial detention facility.æKhatib sued on the grounds that she should be allowed to wear her hijab while detained.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The St. Louis County jailæin Clayton, Missouri, changes its search policies to allow Muslim women to wear their hijabs while being processed. The change was prompted by the experiences ofæBasra Noor who's hijab was forceably removed when she was arrested.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Imane Boudla files a lawsuit against the Walt Disney Company for anti-Muslim harassment in the workplace, and for wrongful termination over refusing to remove her hijab at work at a Disney operated cafe in Anaheim, California.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Michael Enright violently assaults a cab driver in New York City, New York, and is charged with second degree attempted murder as a hate crime.æ

Sikh and Muslim workers for the Metropolitan Transit Authority in New York settled a seven-year federal lawsuit that challenged a policy that required the workers to keep their religous headæcoverings out of the public eye. As a result of the settlement, workers were free to wear religious head coverings without fear of reprimand or discipline.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A group of taxi drivers file a complaint of discrimination against Star Taxi in Orlando, Florida. The drivers allege thatæthey were told not to speak Arabic to each other, and that they were warned not to pray while on shift, even while on a break.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Pamela Geller, a known anti-Islam activist, hosts an anti-Islam conference in Dearborn, Michigan.

An appeals court in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, upholds an injunction against a measure that would banæthe use of shari'a law in state courts. This measureæis similar to other proposed bans across that country that targetæshari'a law.

Fozyia Huri, a Muslimæchild care attendant, sues the Cook County Circuit Courtæfor a hostile work environment in Chicago, Illinois. She reports thatæher supervisor at the courthouse bullied her because she was not Christian and explicitly told another worker not to work with Huri because she was "evil."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Fifteen Muslim U.S Citizens, including two veterans, sue the federal government for being placed on the "no-fly" list without due process, an explanation, or a way to get off of the list.æThe ACLU represented the group to the 9th U.S. Appeals Court in Pasadena, California,æand claimed that the fifteen citizens had their constitutional rights violated as the FBI needs to prove ñarticulable intelligenceî in order to place a person on the no-fly list.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Four men file a lawsuit that would bar government from questioning Muslims about their faith after being detained byæU.S. Customs and Border Protection in Detroit, Michigan, when returning to the U.S from Canada. The men allege that they wereæheld at gunpoint, handcuffed, and repeatedly harassed about their religion.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Rep. _Michele Bachmann (R-Minn.) writes a letter toæthe State DepartmentÍs inspector generalÍs officeæthat accuses the Obama Administration of ties to the Muslim Brotherhood. In the letter Bachmann specifically attacked Huma Abedin, a longtime aide to Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton.

An official from the Islamic Educational Center of Orange County in Costa Mesa, California, reports that a burned copy of the Qur'an was found at the back entrance of the mosque during Friday prayers. Mosque officials reported another burned Qur'an that was left in the same spot one month ago, and the center was vandalized within the previous three weeks.

While drunk, Omar Rivera disrupts prayer services at the Al-Iman Mosque in Long Island City, New York, while shouting anti-Muslim slurs and urinating on prayer rugs. Rivera was detained by police and charged with criminal trespassing.

Worshippers arrive at the Islamic Center of Harrisonburg, Virginia, and discover graffiti scrawled on the building. This included obscene and racial insults against "Irakis" and a warning: "This is America," followed by another slur.
Source: Constable, Pamela and Tara Bahrampour. 2012. "After Mosque Vandalism, Muslim Leaders Seek Calm." The Washington Post, Sep 16.

Event Description: An Iraqi refugee and his motheræare physically and verbally assaulted during a community baseball game in Cedar Rapids, Iowa.æThe male victim suffered from a broken jaw and was called a "terrorist" and "raghead" by the opposing team.æPolice had a warrant for the attackers arrest on charges of assault but the suspect was never charged.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Raneen Albaghdady sues Wayne County and Judge William Callahan inæDetroit, Michigan, for forcing her to take off her hijab during a court appearance. The lawsuit sought to make it unconstitutional to make a Muslim woman remove her hijab while in court.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Warikoo, Niraj. 2009. Muslim woman sues judge in headscarf incident. McClatchy - Tribune News Service, Aug 26, 2009.

Event Description: An unknown suspect tapes posters with anti-Muslim messages on utility poles outside of a store that primarily serves Somalis in Minneapolis, Minnesota.æImages on the posters included swastikas and photos that were demeaning towards Muslims.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Following the Fort Hood shooting, Bryan Fischer, the leader ofæthe American Family Association in Tulepo, Mississippi, releases a statement stating that Muslims should not be allowed to serve in the military.æHe described that unless there is a way to separate moderates from jihadis, it was too risky to allow them to serve in the U.S. military.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: SUSAN, TAYLOR MARTIN. 2009. HISTORY OF SERVICE FOR MUSLIMS IN MILITARY. St.Petersburg Times, Nov 12, 2009.æ

Event Description: Two Republican Minnesota state legislators and a local Republican Party official claimed on social media that Muslims were seeking to infiltrate the party's early February caucuses in order to take over the party. The state Republican Party distanced itself from the comments.

When asked whether he agrees with fellow-Republican state officials that Muslims are actively seeking to infiltrate the Minnesota Republican Party, Jeff Johnson, Hennepin County Commissioner, says that they are raising an important issue. There are, he added, people who are trying to change what America is.

David Howard of Davis Islands, Florida, confronts a real estate agent and the Asgar family, who had purchased the house next door to him, saying that they were not welcome in the neighborhood and that he would destroy the house.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Ryan, Patty. 2018. "Man Who Hurt Home Sale Faces 10 Years." Tampa Bay Times, Feb 10.

Event Description: David Sina, chair of the Fourth Congressional District Republicans in the Saint Paul, Minnesota, area, urges state Republicans to introduce a resolution at precinct caucus meetings that would require attendees to take an anti-shari'a oath. Sina had earlier claimed that Muslims were seeking to infiltrate caucus meetings to implement an anti-American agenda.

The Department of Homeland Security releases a draft report urging that in the name of national security the government should conduct long-term surveillance of Muslim immigrants. President Trump praises the report.
Regina Mustafa, a candidate for mayor in Rochester, Minnesota, receives a threat via social media that calls for the execution of all Muslims in the United States.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Eric Lee Gardener draws a knife on a Muslim woman and her child, and threatens to cut their genitals and while yelling anti-Muslim phrases at them in Seattle, Washington.æThey were standing in line at the Seattle Indian Health Board.æGardener was arrested, and the police charged him with assault and a hate crime.æ

A fireworks store in Baldwin, Wisconsin, sells fireworks with packaging that contains an image of Uncle Sam pulling the beard of a Muslim man and states "Run Hadji Run." The store quickly took the item off their shelves, although the product's website still contained the packaging.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Nicholas Proffit throws rocks through multiple windows of the Islamic Centeræin CapeæGirardeau, Missouri.æHe was charged with property damage that was motivated by discrimination and was sentenced to three years in prison.æ
Valerie Kenney is charged with a hate crime after pulling the head scarf of a Muslim woman in Tinley Park, Illinois. Kenneyæapproached the victim while she was standing in line to check out.
Source: Janssen, Kim, and Joel Hood. 2009. Hate crime charged in scarf-pulling incident. Chicago Tribune, Nov 19, 2009.

Event Description: Jacob Billingsley andæMichael Goldsteinæattack their cab driver, Jaswinder Bangar, and call him a "terrorist" andæ"Taliban" in Pleasanton, California.æBillingsley and Goldstein were arrested later that day, and Bangar said they began yelling at him after he refused to allow them to pay with credit card.æThey broke his phone when he tried to call for help and punched him before running from the car.

Shazia Malik files a federal lawsuit against the University of California San Francisco, alleging that she faced retaliation after filing complaints of religious discrimination and sexual harassment through the university. Internal investigations validated her initial complaints.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Idaho House State Affairs Committee votes 12-2 sendæHouse Bill 419 to the full House for consideration. The bill seeks to ban the application of foreign law from judicial proceedings in Idaho. As in other similar efforts across the country, the bill does not mention shari'a specifically, but debate about the bill centers almost entirely on Islamic law.
The City Council of Plano, Texas, votes to censure council member Tom Harrison after he posts a video on social media that advocates banning Islam in American schools.

The Idaho State House votes overwhelmingly to approve House Bill 419, whichæseeks to ban the application of foreign law from judicial proceedings in Idaho. As in other similar efforts across the country, the bill does not mention shari'a specifically, but debate about the bill centers almost entirely on Islamic law.

Reverend Pat Robinson makes anti-Muslim comments on his radio show in Norfolk, Virginia,æin response to the Fort Hood shooting. He states that Islam is not a real religion andælabels it as a "violent political system."
A Muslim teacher recieves an unidentified white powder through a letter in the mail in Jacksonville, Florida. The powder, firstæbelieved to be Anthrax, was found to be harmless. æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Mahdera Islamic Center in Fresno, California,æexperiences a sequence ofæattacks including anti-Islam signage and a window smashed with a brick.  A week before, a sign was left that read, "No temple for the god of terrorism".

Sadique M. Jaffer files his second lawsuit against the Department of Homeland Security in Orlando, Florida, alleging years of being detained without explanation by authorities at airports and border crossings.æJaffer alleges that he drew the attention of the FBI when he filed a slander and libel lawsuit against members of a local Shia Muslim community board in 2007, which led to him being placed on a watch list.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Raja Awais Naeem sues the city of St. Louis, Missouri, the Metropolitan Taxicab Commission, and a private security company alleging that he was harassed and arrested for continuing to wear religious garb.æHis religious clothing allegedly conflicted with the required uniform of the taxicab company, which resulted in harassment and unwarranted termination.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An employee of UPS in Orlando, Florida, files a federal complaint alleging that he was called derogatory names and denied promotions at UPS because of his faith, and that he was subjected to a hostile work environment which promoted harassment and discriminatory behavior.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A proposed new mosque and cemetery inæSan Martin, California, is approved by the Santa Clara County Planning Commissionæbut receives pushback from the local community. The conflict surrounding the proposed project is driven by both environmental concerns, and explicit anti-Islam sentiments demonstrated at public hearings.æA local conservative group organized in opposition to the construction.

Jamal Tarhuni, a U.S citizen and 30 year resident of Oregon, is detained and interrogated before he can board his flight home from Tunisia. Tarhuni was abroad working with MedicalæTeams International, and was kept from re-entering the United States by the Portland FBI office without explanation.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Seven Muslim men are questioned by police for praying in a public parking lot in Henderson, Nevada.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A referee blocks NasihahæThompson-King, a sixteen-year-old studentæat the Mastery Charter School in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, from playing in a high school basketball game because she was wearing a headcovering. Atheletes wearing headcovering for religious reasons are supposed to furnish documentation to league officials attesting to the requirement.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Anti-Muslim vandalism is discovered at the Al-Farooq Mosque in Nashville, Tennessee. The words "Muslim go home'' and several crosses were spray-painted in red on the exterior of the building, and a hate-speech filled note was left at the youth center.
An unidentified suspect writes derogatory statements about Islam on the walls ofæthe Turkish Center Mosque in Houston, Texas.æ

Oklahoma state Representative Chuck Strohm, who coordinates the House chaplain program, offers new guidelines maintainting that legislators should nominate only faith leaders from their own houses of worship. The guidelines come after Strohm denied the nomination of Imam Imad Enchassi, though it is not certain that there is a connection. There are currently no non-Christian members of the Oklahoma House.
An unidentified suspect or suspects vandalize(s) the Martinsville-Henry County Islamic Center in Horsepasture, Virginia, throwing a rock through the glass on the building's front door.

A chapter of the US Naval Academy Association hosts John Guandolo, a former FBI agent and current director of Understanding the Threat, in San Diego, California. Guandolo claims that there is a vast conspiracy among Muslims to infiltrate the United States and impose Islamic law.

Authorities arrest and charge Steven Laverty with bias intimidation and harassment after he allegedly taunted a man at Parsippany Exxonæin Parsippany, New Jersey. The victim, who is Sikh, reported that Laverty called him a Muslim terrorist and told him to go back to his own country.

A survey funded byæTrump Make American Great Again Committee, a Washington, D.C.-based partnership between Donald. J. Trump for President and the Republican National Committee, asks respondents whether they are concerned by the spread of shari'a law.æ

Atif Irfan and his family are removed from a flight in Washington, DC, after another passenger heard him ask his wife where the safest part of the plane was to sit at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport. The family was not allowed back onto the flight and was forced to pay for another flight on a different airline.æIrfan has a beard and his wife wears a hijab.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Mustafa Elogbi, a U.S citizen and longtime resident of Oregon, is kept from flying back to the United States by the Portland office of the FBI.æElogbi was visiting Libya to see his family, but was detained by authorities in the United Kingdom where he was questioned and kept in solitary confinement for two days. He was not allowed to continue home and was sent back to Tunisia.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Heather Lawrence, a student in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, confronts a Muslim student in the hallway after they did not stand for the pledge of allegiance, saying, "take that thing off your head and act like you're a proud American." She said that she told the student to take off her hijab becauseæit made her look Middle Eastern, which made her the enemy. Lawrence received a five day suspension.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: STUDENT TELLS MUSLIM GIRL TO STAND FOR PLEDGE. RIGHT OR WRONG? YOU DECIDE. South Florida Sun - Sentinel, Aug 31, 2009.

Event Description: Authorities arrest and chargeæChad Horsely ofæDenham Spring, Louisiana, with a hate crime andæcriminal damage to property after he drives his truck into a convenience store, threatens people with a gun, and steals an ATM. Horsely admitted to authorities that he targeted the business because it is owned by Muslims.

The Deschutes County Republican Party hosts John Guandolo in Bend, Oregon, where he gives a talk on the threat that Muslims and Islam pose to the United States. Guandolo is a well-known anti-Muslim activist and director of Understanding the Threat.

An unknown suspectæor suspect vandalizes a car belonging to someone of Middle Eastern descent in Cincinnati, Ohio, slashing the tires, breaking windows, scratching swastikas into the paint,æand spray-painting anti-Muslim and pro-Trump messages on the vehicle.
Vandals spraypaint 9-1-1 on windows and counter topsæat the Jaffa Market in Columbus, Ohio. Several display cases were vandalized, and money and a computer were stolen.æ
Source: CAIR: Ohio Muslim's Business Targeted with Hate Graffiti. U.S.Newswire, Sep 13, 2010.

Event Description: Saida J. Said isfollowed by a white man to the parking lot of the Abubakar Siddique Islamic Center in Columbus, Ohio. In the parking lot Said was pepper-sprayed by a white while the man threatened bodily harm and shouted anti-Muslim hate speech. Police investigated the incident but no suspect was charged.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: While Amal Hersi is in line at the Navy Federal Credit Union in San Diego, California, an employee approaches her and tells her that she must remove her hijab.æThe employee told her that it was necessary so that the security cameras could see her face.æThe senior vice presidentæof security later apologized to Hersi.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Donald Trump nominatesæKen Isaacs, Vice President and Head of International Relief for Samaritan's Purse in Boone, North Carolina, to direct the United Nations International Organization for Migration.æIsaac's has a history of anti-Muslim statements, especially on social media, among them suggestions that Islam is an inherently violent religion.

The Citrus County School District inæIverness, Florida, discovers thatæDayanna Volitich, a middle school teacher, hosts and operates a white nationalism podcast and social media accounts. She is known to have advocated for the eradication of Muslims and to have stated that it is her responsibility to inculcate her students with white nationalist views.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown person releases an irritant during prayer at the Islamic Society of Greater Dayton, in Dayton, Ohio. Authorities investigated the disturbance and no suspects have been charged.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Doug Page, "Incident Baffles Islamic Society." Dayton Daily News, Sep 29, 2008.

Event Description: The Orange County school district contacts parents to address reports thatæSundai Brown, a teacher atæBridgewater Middle School inæWinter Garden, Florida, had made a series of anti-Muslim social media posts. The message explained that the posts date back to 2017 and that the district had addressed the issue with Brown, who is still teaching in the district.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Donald Trump nominates Mike Pompeo, director of the Central Intelligence Agency and former member of Congress, to serve as Secretary of State. Pompeo has a history of anti-Muslim statements and has close ties to prominent anti-Muslim activists and public figures.

Tahnee Gonzales and Liz Dauenhauer, with their children accompanying them, trespass at the Islamic Community Center of Tempe in Tempe, Arizona. Broadcasting on Facebook Live, the pair makes disparaging and hateful remarks as they drive to the site, walk around the grounds, and enter the building. They also steal literature from the mosque. Throughout, they encourage their children to say hateful things about Muslims.

The Montana Green Partyædenounces John Gibney, a Green Party candidate for the Montana House, after he refuses to disavow statements he made at a 2016 anti-refugee protest in Missoula, Montana.æGibney and his wife held signs during the protest declaring that Muslims rape, kill, destroy and hate Jews, Christians, and gays.

Perry George Nicolopoulos allegedly intentionally hits Mohammad Fawad Mohammadi with his car multiple times in a parking lot in Lincoln City, Oregon. Nicolopoulos first allegedly hit Mohammadi's car, then hit Mohammadi twice after he exited his car to assess the damage. Mohammadi's wife and child were in the car. Authorities indicted Nicolopoulos on over a dozen charges, including attempted murder.

Turning Point for Women and Families, a non-profit advocacy group for Muslim women and children, file a federal lawsuit in New York, New York, on behalf ofæJamilla Clark andæArwa Aziz, who allege that the New York Police Departmentæforced them to remove their publicly remove their headscarves during the booking process, in violation of department policy. The incidents allegedly occurred during their respective arrests inæJanuary nad August of 2017.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: MuniræZanial, an engineer for Spirit Aerosystems, files a lawsuit in Kansas City, Kansas, alleging discrimination after an FBI investigation stemming from a party he hosted at a lake facility operated by the Spirit Boeing Employees' Association. Friends and family of Zanial attended the gathering, which was in celebration of Malaysian independence day. An onlooker reported people in "Muslim garb" displaying an American flag defaced with ISIS symbols. The FBI determined it was a Malaysian flag after conducting an investigation, including requesting access to his social media accounts. Zanial contends that the FBI investigation will affect his immigration status.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: TheæIslamic Center ofæEastside sustains extensive damage after a fire breaks out at the Bellvue, Washington, site. It was the second fire at the mosque in the space of one year, with the first having been ruled arson.

Donald Trump appoints John Bolton National Security Advisor.æBolton associates with known anti-Muslim activists and organizations, including his position at chair of the Galestone Institute, a think tank dedicated to publishing materials on the threat that Islam poses to the United States.

John Guandolo, a well-known anti-Muslim activist and head of Understanding the Threat, tweets a picture of a bearded Southwest Airlines employee, saying "I wish this were shocking...a sharia adherent Muslim (aka jihadi) at my plane." Guandolo was on his way to the Western Conservative Conference in Phoenix, Arizona, where he spoke on the threat that Islam poses to the United States. He tagged Donald Trump and National Security Advisor John Bolton, among others.

A Muslim student's jaw is broken in two places by another student at Beckendorff Junior High in Katy, Texas. The boy alleged that the bully was targeting him because he is Muslim, and called him names like "terrorist".
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: CAIR: Texas Muslim Student Targeted by Slurs has Jaw Broken. U.S.Newswire, Feb 04, 2010.

Event Description: A Phoenix, Arizona, mosque is vandalised while it is under construction. Paint was spilled on the floor and several tall, arched glass windows were broken by what appeared to be gunshots. Anti-muslim graffi was found on the walls.æ
Source: Snyder, Stephanie. "FBI Probes Phoenix Mosque Vandalism." Gannett News Service, Sep 08, 2010.

Event Description: Members of Masjid Noor in Huntington, New York, find broken glass and nails scattered on the driveway of the facility. It was the second incident of vandalism reported in a single week. The vandalism occurred while some 30 people attended religious classes in the mosque.æ

A Muslim student wearing a headscarf isæharrassed by a professor at Antelope Valley College in Lancaster, California, telling the student "to either stay and follow his rules (by removing the scarf) or leave the class." He allegedly made this demand despite being told the student wears the scarf for religious reasons. (The same professor allegedly did not react to the presence of a male student wearing a bandana.)
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: California college investigates anti-muslim discrimination; muslim student told to remove islamic head scarf in class. (2004, Feb 26). U.S.Newswire

Event Description: A Muslim student in Salient, Michigan,æis called a terrorist and punched in the face by another student while walkingænear his highschool. The offender faces two years in prison and aæfine of $5,000 if convicted.æ
Source: "CAIR-MI Welcomes Bias Charge for Attack on Muslim Teen." 2011.PR Newswire, Dec 06.

Event Description: A proposal to build a new mosque in NorthæRidgeville, Ohio, is met with anti-Muslim opposition, expressed both in a public Planning Commission meeting and an on-line public comments forum. The Planning Commission approved the proposal.

Police arrestæAnthony ThomasæStromdahl of Bellevue, Washington, and charge him with felony harassment for threatening his roommate, who is from Egypt. Stromdahlæallegedly told his roommate that he would "kill him and all his people."
An unidentified suspect smashes windows and steals computer moniters from the Fayetteville Street mosque inæDurham, North Carolina.
Source: Shimron, Yonat. 2009. Muslims say attacks are more than vandalism. McClatchy - Tribune Business News, Nov 05, 2009.

Event Description: An unidentified person pours red paint across the front steps of the Islamic Center of Pittsburgh in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.æThe mosque had been vandalized one time before in its 15 year existence.æ

Republican gubernatorial candidateæPatrick Colbeck speaks at an event sponsored by United West, an anti-Muslim group, inæHolland, Michigan. Colbeck discussed Muslim stealth infiltration of the United States for the purpose of imposing shari'a, a popular trope among anti-Muslim activists. He identifies Democratic gubernatorial candidateæAbdul El-Sayedæas an example of the threat. The Michigan Republican Party denounced Colbecks comments.
Authorities arrest John Salvator Deliz and charge him with assault after he attacks a Muslim woman in the emergency room waiting area at Beaumont Hospital in Dearborn, Michigan.
Authorities arrest and charge Larry Dewayne Hornsby with a felony count of making a threat after he threatens to blow up the Islamic Society of Greater Oklahoma inæOklahoma City, Oklahoma.

Opponents of the construction of an Islamic Life Center in Carmel, Indiana, appeal the city zoning board's approval of the project. The zoning board originally approved the construction of the proposed mosque in February of 2018 after a contentious series of meetings that drew hundreds of residents.
A pig is found in the mailbox of a California Mosque inscribed withæislamaphobic phrases like "Remember 9-11", "MO HAM MEDæthe Pig", andæ"No Temple for the God of Terrorism at Ground Zero".æ
Source: CAIR: 'no mosque in NYC' pig left at calif. islamic center. (2010, Aug 29). U.S.Newswire

Event Description: Police are investigating a possible hate crime at the Members of Masjid Noor in Huntington, New York, after a jar of nails is thrown onto their driveway. A similar incident of vandalism occured a few days after.

A proposed site of a new mosque is covered in gasoline and burned in Mufreesboro, Tenessee. The crime has been ruled as arson, with both a car and construction equipment having been damaged. The construction will continue despite this setback.
A burned Qur'an is found on the steps ofæIslamic Education Center inæCosta Mesa, California.æThis was one event in a series of anti-Muslim acts committed at the center.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: For the second time in a week a broken glass bottle filled with nails is found outside a mosque in the Huntington neighborhood ofæLong Island, New York.æ
Community members find a burned Qur'an on the steps of theæIslamic Center of East Lansing, Michigan.æThe Qur'an was burned, torn and some pages were covered in feces.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Domsic, M., & Mat. (2010, Sep 13). Burning of quran disappoints many in east lansing community (w/ video). Lansing State Journal

Event Description: Community members find a burned Qur'an on the sidewalk in front of a muslim community center in the northwest area of Chicago, Illinois.æNo arrests were made but it is believed this act was in response to the anniversary of the 9/11 attacks.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: State senator Anthony Sykes and State Attourney General Drew Edmonson help to pass SQ 755, a law banning Sharia law from state courts.æThe law was passed with a 70% majority, but later was blocked by the Oklahoma City federal judge Vicki Miles-LaGrangeæuntil it can be discussed in court.æ
Source: Johnson, S. (2010, Nov). Oklahoma's sharia law ban blocked by federal judge. New York Amsterdam News Retrieved from https://search.proquest.com/docview/846793917?accountid=7379

Event Description: In Mufreesboro, Tenessee, a witness in the case against Rutherford County Tennessee for allowing a Muslim Community Center to expand and purchase more land, accuses the Muslim community of being "sharia backers" and claimed they are a "red flag to security."
Source: Broden, S. 2010. "Witness accuses local muslim leaders of being shariah backers." The Daily News, Sep 27 2010æ

Event Description: Protesters shout "Ban Sharia" and other anti-Islam and anti-Muslim slogans at the site of the proposed Park 51 community center and mosque in New York City, New York. This is part of on-going opposition to the proposed mosque.æ

A Fort Walton Beach community member is suing the Fort Walton Beach city council to ensure that no local bussinesses are complying with Sharia law compliant financing. She is launching this public campaign because she believes Muslim organizations are using their "special treatment" to funnel money to international terrorist groups.æ

A 21 year old college student, Michael Enright, stabs his taxi driver after harassing him with questions about his faith, inæLower Manhattan, New York.æHe is being charged with attempted murder and a hate crime and will serve time.æ

Kamal Uddin is beaten and harassed in east Brooklyn, New York, outside of his construction worksite. His family reports that he has suffered a brain injury from the beating.æIt is not being tried as a hate crime because no witnesses can attest to the harassment that took place.
Source: Feeney, M. J. (2010, May 25). MUSLIM'S BEATING A HATE CRIME: KIN. New York Daily News Retrieved from https://search.proquest.com/docview/306362125?accountid=7379

Event Description: Two women harass and assault two muslim women at a gas station in Tukwila, Washington. The women shouted "suicide bomber" and "go back to where you came from" and proceeded to kick the women and slam their car door on them.æThe suspects are being charged with a hate crime.æ
Source: WASHINGTON STATE; attack called a hate crime. (2010, Oct 22). Los Angeles Times Retrieved from https://search.proquest.com/docview/759502484?accountid=7379

Event Description: Somail-owned Hormud Meat and Grocery in St. Cloud, Minnesota, is vandalized with the phrase "go home" in red spray paint.æNo arrests have been made.

The FBI is investigating after an envelope filled with an unknown white powder is left on the door step ofæa Muslim teacher,æYusha Evans, in Jacksonville, Florida. The powder was found to not be poisonous but it is believed that this attack was in connection withæa pipe bombing of a local mosque that occurred earlier in the year.æ

An unknown suspect vandalizes The Al-Farooq mosque in Nashville, Tennessee, with the phrase "Muslims go home," along with several crosses drawn in red spray paint.æThey left a threatening note on the front steps of the mosque as well that claimed that Islam isæthe enemy and is trying to destroy America.
Two unknown men strike a man in the face after asking him if he was Muslim in Sunnyvale, California. The suspects remain unknown.
Source: Fernandez, L. (2010, Jun 14). Sunnyvale: Man attacked for being muslim, public safety officers say. Oakland Tribune

Event Description: A man verbally harasses and attacks a Muslim woman with pepper spray in Columbus, Ohio. He shouted threats like "I'm going to kill all of you," he then sprayed her in the face.æ
Source: Woman reports attack outside mosque. (2010, Dec 22). Houston Chronicleæ

Event Description: Three men vandalize the Hudson Islamic Center in Hudson, New York. They used red spray paint and painted racial slurs on the wall of the Mosque. They are being charged with misdemeanors.

A man stabs a nurse while shouting anti-Muslim slurs in Houston, Texas. The woman was driving home from her shift when her car was run off the road. The unknown driver exited his car and began to shout hate speech while brandishing a knife. The police investigated the incident as a possible hate crime, though no suspect was arrested.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A suspect set fire to the office of The Salman Alfarisi Islamic Center ofæCorvallis, Oregon.æThe fire was contained to the office of the building and did not spread to other rooms.æThe FBI is investigating but has not made any arrests.

The city planning board delays their vote to approve the building of a new mosque inæMedford, New York. Community members are concerned that the new mosque will increase traffic in the area, but mosque-goers fear they have islamophobic sentiments.æ

A lawsuit is filed against theæIslamic Center of Mufreesboro in Mufreesboro, Tenessee. The suit started because community members worried that an expansion to the already existing community center would increase traffic in the area.æ
Source: Smietana, B. (2010, Oct 05). Legitimacy of islam at heart of tenn. mosque suit. Asbury Park Pressæ

Event Description: Adil Imdad recieves a threatening phone call fromæRoman Conway who explains in detail the plan he has to burn down a mosque in St. Louis, Missouri. Imdad contacted the FBI and they arrested Conway.æ
Source: Townsend, T. (2010, Sep 26). Unnerving phone call led to illinois standoff; suspect found mosque official's number on web, made threats to quran. then, FBI was called in. St.Louis Post

Event Description: The zoning board of Mayfield, Kentucky, denies the Muslim community's request to build a new mosque.æThe ACLU has taken steps to repeal this decision. The application was denied foræ"changes in characteristics and safety."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Smith, P. (2010, Sep 22). ACLU asks mayfield zoning board to reconsider rejection of mosque. Courier

Event Description: A conservative group is suing the city of New York for their decision to allow a mosque to be built two blocks from the Ground Zero memorial site. Supporters of the mosque are not worried because they have already gotten approval from the city.

Five teenage girls are stopped and subjected to an anti-Muslim tirade while walking to the mall in Jersey City,æNew Jersey. The man who approached themæcalled them "traitors to the country" and asserted thatæthey and their "s****y people" should leave the country. The girls captured the incident on video, but police were unable to identify the man.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Police investigate a possible hate crime after an unknown suspect shoots eight times at the sign of the Five Pillars halal butchery in Troy, Maine.æ

Five teenage boys shout obsenities and honk their car horns outside a Mosque during a religious service in Carlton, New York. One boy used his vehicle to side swipe mosque goers. The police charged him with assault. The other boys have been charged with misdemeanors.

An unknown suspect throws bricks into the windows ofæMasjid Madera mosque inæMadera, California. Signs were found that read "Wake up America, the Enemy is here" andæ"No Temple for the God of terrorism at Ground Zero."
Source: Vandalism of california mosque unacceptable. (2010, Aug 26). Targeted News Service

Event Description: The remnants of a pipe bomb are found on the ground of the Islamic Center of Northeast Florida, in Jacksonville, Florida, after an explosion occurred while 60 people were inside the building. No suspects have been arrested, and no one was injured.æ
An exhibit at the Art Institute of Chicago thatæaddresses Islamophobia is defaced with crude drawings and the phrase "kill all arabs" is written across it.æNo suspect has been charged.

An imam is robbed, assaulted and harassed by two men on a subway platform in China town, Manhatten, New York. Before they assaulted him they asked "Are you Muslim?" and when they heard his response they said "We hate Muslims." Both men have been charged with a hate crime.

A Muslim familyæalleges they were discriminated against at a Red Lobster restaurant in Rochester, Minnesota, when they asked multiple wait staff foræwater to break their fast for Ramadan and were ignored. They also allege that a waiter made a disparraging comment about Ramadan.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A federal judge issues an order to the Washington Department of Corrections to provide nighttime meals to all Muslim inmates who have been fasting during the month of Ramadan in Monroe, Washington. The order was issued as a response to a lawsuit filed on behalf of four inmates who were being refused food, andæwho were rapidly losing weight during the weeks of Ramadan.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Craig Caldwell and Rashad Khan file a federal lawsuit againstæCaldwell's landlady, Katina Gatchis, after she refuses to allow Caldwell to sublease his space to Khan's business in Denver, Colorado. In a recorded phonecall Gatchis tells Caldwell that she wants an "American person ... good like you and me." The lawsuit claims that Gatchis violated federal civil rights law and violated state and city unit-discrimination laws.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A group of Sufi Muslims is accussed of having an illegal cemetary inæSidney, New York. Leaders of the city are asking them to move the bodies, even though they obtained a permit to create the cemetery. Muslims in the community suspect the Ground Zero mosque proposal has created the new tensions.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Florida preacher Bill Keller tells crowd of supporters that "All these people will die and burn in hell"æand "Islam is not and has never been a religion of peace," at the New York Marriot Hotel overlooking ground zero and the contested ground zero mosque.æ
A burnt Qur'an is left on the steps of theæIslamic Society of Greater Lansing in Lansing, Michigan.æProsecutors refuse to press charges.
Source: Brand-Williams, O. 2010.  "No charges filed in quran burning." Detroit News, Sep 23 2010
