Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: "Muslim Group Says Police Detained 7 Praying Men." 2010.Gainesville Sun, Mar 05.

Event Description: Eric Garner violently threatens a Muslim woman and her six-month-old child in Seattle, Washington. He yelled slurs, wielded a knife and threatened to cut off her gentials. He is facing hate crime charges.æ
When two cars came to a stop at a stoplight one driver shouts anti-Islamic slurs at a Muslim woman driving another car on their way to Huntington Beach, California.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Cabrera, Yvette. 2010. "Anti-Muslim Sentiment Touches O.C." Orange County Register, Sep 21.

Event Description: A child social worker,æEzeadi Kelechi, is being investigated for yelling slurs againstæMuslims while out to dinner at Uncle Lou's Restaurant inæPaterson, New Jersey.æHe shouted slurs like, "Do you have your bomb belt?" andæ "Are you going to slit my throat?"æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Yellin, Deena. 2010. "MUSLIMS WANT PROBE OF DYFS CASEWORKER AFTER 'VERBAL ASSAULT'." The Record, Dec 22.

Event Description: An unknown suspect throws a brick in the window ofæthe Islamic Cultural Center of Fresno and left signs that read, "No temple for the god of terrorism at Ground Zero" and æ"Wake up America, the enemy is here," in Fresno, Califoria.æ
Source: Lloyd, Paula. 2010. "Leaders of Many Faiths Join Muslims in Fresno." The Fresno Bee, Sep 11.

Event Description: An unknown suspect vandalizes the newly renovated Muslim Student Center at Brandeis University in Waltham,æMassachusetts. All of the Qur'ans were taken, lamps destroyed and furniture upturned.
Source: Woods, Jason. 2010. "Chaplains Decry Vandalism of Muslim Center." Boston Globe, Mar 11.

Event Description: The Boulder City council in Boulder, Colorado, creates a list of rules of decorum for city council meetings that include having an uncovered face, students at the University of Colorado Boulder are protesting this change in rules.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Urie, Heath. 2010. "Muslim Group, ACLU Challenge Boulder's Proposed 'Rules of Decorum'." The Daily Camera, Jul 19.

Event Description: A TSA agent at Washington's Dulles International Airport in Dulles, Virginia, forced a Muslim woman to take off her hijab when crossing security and when she refused she forced her toæundergo a full pat down infront of male guards. The agent reportedly saidæshe was singled out because she was wearing the hijab.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Brand-Williams, Oralandar. 2010. "Muslims Question Full-Body Search of Woman in Head Scarf." Detroit News, Jan 07.

Event Description: An unknown suspect leaves strips of bacon spelling out, "PIG,"and, "CHUMP" outside a mosqueæinæFlorence, South Carolina.
Source: Jonsson, Patrik. 2010. "Bacon Attack on an American Mosque: Prank Or Hate Crime?" The Christian Science Monitor, Oct 15, 8.

Event Description: 165 employees at Electrolux in St. CLoud, Minnesota file a complaint with the equal employment oppurtunityæcomission because they were not allowed to break their fast during work hours when they specifically asked for a religious accomadation.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Johnsen, Britt. 2010. "Electrolux Under Criticism from Muslim Workers." St.Cloud Times, Jul 22.

Event Description: A Muslim family is denied access to the public pool inæLyan, Illinois, because the modest clothing they wore did not align with the pools dress code, which requirs a swimsuit. The mother offered to leave so her children and husband could go to the pool, but they were denied acces as well because their clothes were not made out of the right material.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Smith, Gerry. 2010. "State Agency: Public Pool Discriminated." Chicago Tribune, Oct 17, 8-1.8

Event Description: Samir Suljovic is suing the Gramercy Park Hotel in New York City, New York, because they allegedly wouldn't hire him as a security guard unless he shaved his beard.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: Cohen, Stefanie. 2010. "MUSLIM'S 'SHAVE' BIAS SUIT." New York Post, Apr 11, 10.

Event Description: Richard Penkoski secures the Thomas Law Center's assistance to file a lawsuit against Berkeley County Schools, in Gerrardstown, West Virginia, claiming that a middle school social studies unit on world religions favors Islam and promotes the faith above others. The Thomas Law Center is involved in similar lawsuits across the country.

The United States Supreme Court uphold's the Trump Administration's Executive Action banning travelers and immigrants from certain Muslim-majority countries, overturning decisions by lower courts blocking the measure. Speaking for the majority, Chief Justice John Roberts found that on its face the Executive Action is a religiously neutral measure that falls within the presidential powers relating to national security.æThe majority found that the Executive Order needs to be considered separately from candidate-Trump's campaign pledge to ban Muslims from entering the country, which remained on the Trump campaign web site after the 2016 election.
Robert Carrigg yanks on the headscarf ofæRiman Douedari as she eats at the the Farm Bar and Grille in Manchester, New Hampshire. Authorties charge Carrigg with misdemeanor assault.
Dove World Outreach Center, an anti-Muslim hate group, leads aæa demonstration in front ofæthe Oaks Mall inæGainesville, Florida.æThe group wore shirts that read, "Islam is of the devil."
Source: Crabbe, Nathan. 2009. "Muslim Students, Residents Hold Event to Feed Homeless." Gainesville Sun, Sep 16.

Event Description: Authorities in Baltimore County charge a 17-year-old woman with destruction of property after pelting the home of an Iraqi family with eggs. The family, who arrived from Iraq as refugees to settle in Dundalk, Maryland, two-and-a-half years ago, report previous incidents of harassment over the past several months.

The manager of the Foster Brown Public Pool in Wilmington, Delaware, ask a group of participants in a summer program for Muslim youth to leave the pool because their attire, including bathing suits and headscarves, do not conform to pool policies forbidding cotton clothing.æThe program director, Tahsiyn Ismaa'eel, claims that her students were singled out for enforcement of the unposted rule.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Michael "Scott" Maclay, a candidate for Spokane County Sheriff in Spokane, Washington, declares that if he is elected he will take care of the Muslim problem in the city, which he identifies as the only problem facing Spokane. He pledges to initiate round-the-clock surveillance of Muslims. When challenged, he points people to statements of Donald Trump as justification of his position.

An unidentified suspect sets a fire at the entrance to the ISGH Northshore Masjid Isa ibn Maryam in the Cloverleaf area of Houston, Texas. The tires on a car belonging to the mosque's imam were also found to have been slashed in the same evening.

After receiving a 911 call reporting suspicious activities and the presence of weapons, Minneapolis Park Police arrive at Minnehaha Regional Park and confront a group of Somali-American teenagers with their guns drawn. Police found no weapons. The teenagers allege that just before the police arrived a group of white kids shouted racial epithets at them. Authoritiesæare investigating the origins of the 911 call.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The city government of Walkersville, Maryland, denies a local Muslim community permission to use a plot of farmland for religious purposes.æ
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
Source: "Lawyer Calls Town's Denial of Mosque Discrimination." 2008.Capital, Feb 09, A4.

Event Description: The ACT for America Boston Chapter hosts anti-Islam activist Anyaz Anni Cyrus at an event titled "The US Constitution and Sharia. Can They Co-Exist?" in Newton, Massachusetts. The event was paid for by Concerned Citizens of New England, which advocates against the Council on American Islamic Relations, which it calls a threat to national security.
Construction workers find anti-Muslim graffiti at the site of a new mosque being built by the Islamic Foundation of New York.

Georgia State Representative Jason Spencer introduces House Bill 3, which would modify existing state anti-masking laws, aimed at male Ku Klux Klan, to include women, thereby effectively preventing Muslim women from wearing face coverings in public.æSpencer eventually abandoned the bill, saying that he did not intend to target any particular group, just "radical elements that could pose a threat to public safety."

The Santa Clara County Plannning Commission and the San Martin Planning Advisory Committee host a meeting to discuss an environmental impact report on a proposed mosque in San Martin, California. The South Valley Islamic Community purchased the land in 2006 and has made several attempts to meet demands of the project's opponents. The San Martin Neighborhood Alliance sites the effects of a proposed cemetary adjacent to the mosque as a threat to groundwater. Much of the discussion at the meeting did not address the environmental impact report.

Authorities charge Shawn Mason with menacing and ethnic initmidation stemming from a traffic incident in Cincinnati, Ohio, during which time he threatened to shoot the victim after using racial slurs and telling them to leave the United States.

A grand jury indicts Priscilla Protasowicki of Jackson, New Hampshire, for allegedly assaulting Mohamed Ghallami and Chahrazade Mounaji at the Covered Bridge Riverview Lodge. Protasowicki, who works at the establishment, also allegedly told the couple, who was traveling with their 8-year-old daughter, that Muslims are not welcome at the motel.

A student at Greenfield Middle School in El Cajon, California, reports that a large group of students follow her home, pull her hair, shout slurs, and demand to see identification as she walked home from school. The alleged incident followed months of bullying. The student arrived with her family as refugees from Syrian in 2016.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The city of Sandy Springs, Georgia, overturns Municipal Court Judge Sharon Dixon's ruling in a case involving Fazial Azizan, who was convicted of misdemeanor disorderly conduct after a small auto accident. At the sentencing portion of the bench trial, which yielded a five month prison term, Dickson had made multiple disparaging remarks about Azizan's ethnicity and religion.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Two men are caught on surveillance video spray-painting anti-Muslim and pro-Christian graffiti on the Islamic Institute of Minnesota's Al-Salam Mosque inæMaplewood, Minnesota.
Two unidentified suspects break into and steal donations from Masjid Al-Eiman Mosque in Buffalo, New York.

Kevin Rhoades, Republican candidate for the Idaho state legislature, posts a picture of a Muslim Idahoan on social media, using a derogatory term for Muslims to claim that he was happy to block the man from his Facebook page and that the Qur'an teaches Muslims to hate all non-Muslims.

Voters in western Massachusetts receive mailers attacking Tahirah Amatul-Wadud, a candidate for Congress from the state. The mailer refers negatively to Amatul-Wadud's religion and questions her role in the Council on American Islamic Relations, a common target of anti-Muslim activists. It is not clear who produced the materials.

Joey Hester, a candidate for city council in Shreveport, Louisiana, posts a message on social media questioning the rise in American Muslims running for office, suggesting that it is a conspiracy to turn American cities into so-called no-go zones and to implement shari'a law.

Anti-Muslim activist Laura Loomer disrupts a campaign event in Minneapolis, Minnesota, featuring Rashida Tlaid, a candidate for Congress from Michigan, andæIlhan Omar, a candidate for Congress from Minnesota. Loomer described her efforts as an attempt to bring attention to the candidates' association with the Council on American Islamic Relations, which she claims supports terrorism and is a threat to the United States.
An unidentified suspect walks into the Green Olive deli in New York, New York, asks the clerk if he is Arab (who said yes), and then punches him in the face.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Steve West, Republican candidate for the Missouri state legislature and radio host on KCXL talk radio in Liberty, Missouri, says that Islam is an ideology and not a religion, that Muslims are seeking to theocracy in the United States, and that Muslims should be stripped of first amendment protections. West won the Republic primary for state legislature in his district by 25 points over three other candidates, though the state party did disavow his comments.
A family in Shakopee, Minnesota is harassed by a person driving in a car beside them. The driver shoutd obsenities and made obscene hand gestures toward the family.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Renee Ayesh and her daughter Jenan Ayesh are harassed and Renee's hijab ripped off and her head pushed to ground at the Reunion Tower in Dallas, Texas. The woman responsible was not identified.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown suspect shoots at the Muslim American Society in Westside, Texas. Bullet holes were found in the wind shield of a truck in the parking lot and in the front window of the building.

Hallandale Beach commissioner Anabelle Lima-Taub shares a post on facebook that called for the removal of Congresswoman Rashida Tlaib and writes that she worries Tlaib will "blow up" Capitol hill and be a danger to congress.

David Allen Boileau breaks into the home of his Muslim neighbors in Holiday, Florida. Nothing was stolen. Earlier, he threw nails in the road in front of his neighbors home, attempting to pop the tires of the family's car. This is an escalation of continued harassment he has directed towards the family.
A man spits on a Muslim woman walking down the street in Long Island, New York.
Emails with Islamophobic rhetoric, jokes and memes between Joe Ricketts and Tom Ricketts, former and current partial owners of the Cubs baseball team in Chicago, are leaked.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Anti-Muslim graffiti is painted on the garage of the Bullet Cab company, a cab company owned by a Muslim family, in La Crosse, Wisconsin.

A man enters a 7-Eleven, attempts to steal a cup of coffee and assaults the store owner, leaving him covered in burns from hot coffee and many bruises in Marysville, Washington. The man told authorities he assaulted the man because he hates Muslims.

State Sen. Larry Grooms introduces legislation to prevent the use of "foreign law" in South Carolina. The bill does not specifically mention Islam or Sharia law but the Council for American-Islamic Relations described it as a part of a larger thinly veiled attempt to demonize Islam nation wide.

Chris Gaubatz, former national security consultant, delivers a speech to the North Carolina Republican party warning of the dangers of Islam and Marxism and the "total warfare" that is breaking out between Islam and the western world.
Dustin Passarelli shouts slurs about Muslims before fatally shooting Mustafa Ayoubi in the parking lot of his apartment complex in Carmel, Indiana.
A customer at Kroger in West Houston, Texas yells at Mai Mohamed to "Get the f--k back t her country."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The anti-Muslim group ACT! displays anti-Muslim posters and pamphlets in the State Capital building in Charleston, West Virginia.
Known anti-Muslim speaker gives presentation at the Idaho state house in Boise, Idaho. Their speech focused on discrimination against Christians by Muslim extremists.
Muslim students attending an event at Wingate University are threatened by a post on Facebook that says, "I hope anyone who does [attend], dies" in Wingate, North Carolina.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unkown suspect vandalizes a Muslim family's garage with Islamophobic slurs in Ypsilanti Township, Michigan.
Man threatens to "Kill all Muslims" and shoot random people at Glenn Burie Village Shopping Center in Glen Burnie, Maryland.
An unknown suspect throws rocks and bricks breaking the windows of a Mosque during a prayer service in Dayton, Ohio. One person was inside the Mosque at the time of the incident.

Man attacks his lyft driver because she is Muslim in Bloomingdale, Illinois. He began by shouting Islamophobic slurs and threatening to kill her, then attempted to punch the driver, then ripped off all of the door handles on her car.

After the Islamic Center of North America’s Dallas, Texas branch (ICNA) and sister organization GainPeace put up billboards in Dallas, TX, raising awareness about hijabs and why women wear them, the call center is flooded with hate calls. Sabeel Ahmed, director of the GainPeace call center, said the center receives over 200 hate calls per week.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Old Forge School Board removes its school president in Old Forge, PA, over anti-Muslim posts, which depicted Muslims as terrorists and rapists. The president, Frank Scavo, is running as a Republican for a special election in the state house.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Umber Nisar is assaulted by an unknown assailant while on her way home in Brooklyn, NY. Nisar reported that a man kicked her repeatedly before he walked away, adding that a witness saw the incident but decided not to help instead. They NYPD is investigating the incident as an assault, but Nisar wants the incident to be investigated as a hate crime.

Mark Jelks, principal at White Hall High School in White Hall, AR, makes anti-Muslim Facebook posts, saying "Kick Islam out of America – You can’t walk with God holding hands with the Devil." The post caused a backlash among the local residents pointing to its divisive message and the hostile environment it creates for students in the district.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An arsonist attacks the Islamic Center of Escondido in Escondido, CA. The attacker left  a note on the driveway of the mosque referring to the shootings at the Al Noor Mosque and the Linwood Islamic Centre in New Zealand that left 50 people dead.

Someone leaves a note on the Facebook page of Maryum Islamic Center in Columbia, MD, saying that “maybe you’ll be next,” a possible reference to the mass shooting at two mosques in New Zealand. The police are investigating the incident as a possible hate/bias incident.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Police arrest a man who violently threatened the leader of United Islamic Center of Arizona in Glendale, AZ. The arrest came a day after a mass-shooting at two mosques in New Zealand that left 50 people dead.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Muslim hijabi woman is told to “go back to your f***ing country” by another woman in Jersey City, NJ. The incident took place outside of School 23 and was caught on video.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Sullivan County Board of Education in Blountville, TN, deliberates the social studies textbook for seventh graders. Jane Thomas, a member of the board opposes the current textbook as it equates Allah with God and aimes to normalize Islam as one of the world's religions.

22-year-old Thomas A. Bolin is charged by the FBI after he postes a series of posts in Greece, NY, expressing support for the New Zealand mosque shooter and calling for similar attacks in Baltimore. The police found 12-gauge shotgun and several boxes of ammunition in Bolin's residency.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Muslim student at East Brunswick High School in Brunswick, NJ, was violently attacked and spat on until her hijab was yanked off. The attacker later posted snapchats with racial slurs against Muslims. The school, which reported the incident to the police said that the two students were initially just having a disagreement. The aggressor was charged with assault and harassment.

Corbin Kauffman, 30, is charged with interstate transmission of threats to injure the person of another, a federal crime that carries a maximum sentence of five years in prison, in Lehighton, PA. The charge came after he posted an image of him directing an AR15 at a congregation of Jewish men praying, along with other violent online threats against Muslims and black people.

A Muslim woman is harrassed and attacked in a Meijer grocery store in Kettering, OH. The victim reported that a man pointed to her hijab, then followed her to the store and proceeded to shove her. CAIR-OH called for the case to be investigated as a hate crime, but the authorities said that the incident did not warrant ethnic intimidation. He was later charged with assualt,  a first-degree misdemeanor.

Yucaipa Mayor Bobby Duncan and former city council member in Yucaipa, CA, posts a series of photos and memes on his Facebook page condeming Islam and mocking Rep. Ilhan Omar. After calls for his resignation, Duncan apologized for the possible hurt his posts caused.

The FBI arrests a man for threatening to shoot Rep. Ilhan Omar in Rathbone, NY. The assailant told the authorities that "he was a patriot, that he loves the President, and that he hates radical Muslims in our government."

Four young men are arrested and charged in Rochester, NY, after the police uncovered a serious plot to commit violence against Muslims. The four men were charged with three counts of first-degree criminal possession of a dangerous weapon and one count of fourth-degree conspiracy.

A trail is set for a woman who is charged with burglary at a Tempe Mosque in Tempe, AZ. The woman took her friend and three children to the mosque making derogatory, damaging bulletin boards, and causing disorderly conduct.

Spc. Cesilia Valdovinos, a soldier in the US Army in Fort Carson, CO, intends to sue the United States Army for  discrimination and harassment in the workplace. Valdovinos, who has been in the military for seven years and has served in Afghanistan, converted to Islam in 2016. She says that since she started wearing the hijab she had been subjected to name-calling, increased personal inspections, and has been demoted.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: John Kless is arrested in Fort Lauderdale, FL, after he made threatening phone calls to Democratic officials in which he ranted about Muslims, immigrants, black people, and Rep. Ilhan Omar.

Police say they have identified the man who called with a threatening phone call to the Muhammad Islamic Center of Greater Hartford in Hartford, CT.  The  man reportedly threatened to burn down the mosque and and disparaged its members with racist and homophobic epithets.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Bosnian Muslim woman Alma Cipranic, 20, calls the police after months of harassment, threatening texts and rumors online that culminated in bacon strips being left on her father's car in Fargo, ND. Cipranic wanted the case to be investigated as hate crime, but North Dakota doesn’t have hate crime laws like the federal government, so the police investigated the incident as disordely conduct.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh officials investigate racist images circulating on social media involving students in Oshkosh, WI. Photos posted to Twitter showed signs that said "No Liberals, Jews, Muslims, Queers or Hmongs." Another photo showed a swastika hanging on the wall during a party.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Police arrest a 15-year-old boy after he reportedly claimed that he wanted to "blow up a Muslim church" in Pinnacle High School in Pheonix, AZ. The police found potassium nitrate, which could be dangerous when mixed with other substances.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A group of Muslims workers file a complaint with U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission against LG Electronics for workplace discrimination in Hazel Park, MI. The workers alleged that the company held active shooter and terrorist attack training on April 11 that depicted Muslims and Islamic prayers as supporting terrorism and were mocked as Muslims.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Mubarak Ali Salam, a 25-year old employee at X-Ray Industries in Troy, MI, filed a complaint April 3, 2019, with the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission alleging that he was discriminated at work because of his faith and race. Salam said that he was taunted several times by supervisors or co-workers with bacon and pork rinds even putting pork in a sandwich he ordered at work.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A man doused gasoline on the North Austin Muslim Community Center in Austin, TX. The attempted arson was the latest apparent attack on the mosque and its community members.

A Muslim family experience drive-by shootings of their home after they displayed lights celebrating the holy month of Ramadan in Monroe, OH. No one was injured in either incident and the police said the drive-by shootings were targeting a specific person who lived in that house.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Members of the North Austin Muslim Community Center find shattered glass across the floor of a Sunday school classroom after someone threw rocks through the window in Austin, TX. This incident came after series of vandalisms and attempted arson against the center.
The home of a Muslim family is vandalized and spray painted with racial slurs in Bolingbrook, IL.

Rita E. Curran, St. Lawrence County lawmaker, reposts anti-Muslim posts on her social media in Massena, NY. The  Council on American-Islamic Relations- New York and the St. Lawrence County Democratic Committee have called for Curran's resignation. Curran said that she didn't write the post but merely reposted it.
The Diyanet Mosque of New Haven is set on fire in New Haven, CT. The police did not yet identify a suspect.

Joey Christian is charged with public intoxication and disorderly in  Friendswood, TX, after yelling racial slurs at an AT&T cashier. After the cashier said his name was Mohammad, Christian responded, "fucking Arabs," and claimed that he has been "killing his kind" for twenty years on numerous continents.

Anti-Muslim material is disseminated to the residents of Packanack Lake in Wayne, NJ, after a Muslim family puts up an Arabic sign on their home. The fliers, which encouraged the neighborhood to band together against unAmerican practices.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Del. Ibraheem Samirah of the Virginia House of Delegates is harassed at a town hall meeting. The protesters asked Samirah if he planned to implement Shariah law in Virginia.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Jalanda Calhoun files a discrimination complaint with Georgia Commission on Equal Opportunity against the Georgia Department of Corrections. Calhoun, a correctional officer at Georgia State Prison in Reidsville, GA, alleged that agency will not allow her to wear a hijab at work.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Penn-Trafford School District is accused of anti-Muslim sentiment when after a safety training drill in Penn Township, PA, showcased a shooter wearing a scarf. In response to the backlash, school authorities said that the garment was not intended to identify any race or religion.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Taco Bell employee loses her job after an Islamophobic rant against a Muslim customer goes viral in St. Louis, MO. Tarek Hamdan went to Taco Bell to get some suhoor when  he exchanged a 25-minute debate with an employee who insisted that all Muslims were terrorists.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Coffee County District Attorney General Craig Northcott faces calls to resign after posting anti-Islam remarks to social media in  Manchester, TN. In a Facebook post, Northcott compared support for Islam to support for the Ku Klux Klan. Northcott is under investigation with Supreme Court's Board of Professional Responsibility.

Zakaria Kabir, 37, faces up to 15 years in prison after he damages and harasses the attendees of Sunnat-ul-Jamaat mosque in South Richmond Hill, NY. Kabir reportedly smashed a TV, ripped up several Qurans, and overturned furniture while yelling “I’ll Kill These Muslims.” and "they need to leave the country."

The American Human Rights Council and the American Muslim Leadership Council express concern over the distribution of an anti-Muslim flyers that mocked and degraded Prophet Mohamed in Livonia, MI. The flyers were apparently left on the windshields of the cars of Costco customers.

Douglas Mastriano, a veteran and a Republican nominee for Pennsylvania state senate shares a series of conspiratorial anti-Muslim posts on social media suggesting that the fire of Norte Dame has been an act of Islamic terrorism.  Another posts said that Islam wanted to kill other identity groups, such as LGBTQ and Jews.

The New York Post features the collapse of the World Trade Center towers and a partial quote from Representative Omar on its cover in New York, NY. The quote, taken from a speech Rep. Omar delivered, suggested that she trivialized the 9/11 tragedy.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: President Donald Trump targets Rep. Ilhan Omar of Minnesota over remarks she made on civil rights and Muslims in America. Trump tweeted a graphic video featuring the burning World Trade Center towers and other images from Sept. 11, 2001, suggesting that Omar was mocking and minimizing the tragedy.

Three Somali women file a complaint with Equal Employment Opportunity Commission  against Amazon in Minneapolis, MN, for creating a hostile environment for Muslim workers and of retaliating against them for protesting their work conditions.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A man steals a donation box holding $2,200 from Masjid Nur Al-Islam in Bronx, NY.

Zachariah Manahan, 18, is charged with felony stalking committed because of bias as well as gross-misdemeanor property damage and misdemeanor disorderly conduct after he yelled ethnic slurs and sprayed Somali-American siblings with a garden hose in their home in southern Minnesota.

A University of California-Santa Cruz computer science professor is put on leave after complaints of abusive racially and sexually charged remarks toward students including calling a Muslim graduate student a “terrorist” come to light in Santa Cruz, CA. The professor allegedly called a graduate student that his beard made him look like he was on a "wanted list," and made another sexually charged remarks against another students.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Andre Sterling, 62, is charged with malicious harassment after he got aggressive at two men at the Masjid Al-Furqan in Seattle, WA.

Plans to build a bigger mosque for the 100 Muslim families of South Valley Islamic Center is met with resistance in San Martin, CA. The center,  to be called the Cordoba Center, would include a mosque, cemetery, and community center. The planning board later voted down the proposal.

The Austin chapter of the Council on American-Islamic Relations has one of their signs vandalized with slurs obscenities in Austin, TX. The vandalism said called the designated "Muslim space" as "bomb place."

A Muslim woman is attacked by two men in Lincoln, NE. The two men made threatening and derogatory remarks about her before they physically assaulted her. The police didn't identify any suspects but are investigating the incident as a possible hate crime.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Muslim students at the University of Minnesota discover anti-Muslim flyers at the Al-Madinah Cultural Center in Rosemount, CA, accusing multiple Muslim students of anti-Semitism. The flyers were a part of the "An Epidemic of Jew Hatred on Campus: The Top Ten Neo-Nazi Incidents" campaign headed by the David Horowitz Freedom Center, targeting college campuses across the States.

Bill Larion, a Dearborn employee, is fired after he made racist Islamophobic comments comparing a Muslim model to a camel in Dearborn, MI.  The remarks were referring to Halima Aden, a Somali model, appearing on the cover of Sports Illustrated's swimsuit edition.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Johnny Juica-Pena, 52, is charged with harassment, simple assault, and bias intimidation after an altercation with a man on the New Jersey Transit train in Morristown, NJ.

Zareen Khan, owner of the popular Palo Alto and Mountain View Pakistani-Indian restaurants Zareen's, is harassed by a man who called her a terrorist and followed her to the bathroom at a restaurant in Sunnyville, CA. Disheartened by the incident, Khan announced that she would be donating a portion of her restaurants' sales to the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) to help immigrant communities.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Jack Cairns, the chairman of the Robinson Township Republican Committee, resigns after a number of Islamophobic posts on Facebook were discovered in Pittsburgh, PA.
Heba Jassim reports that a man harassed and pulled a gun on her and her two children on their way to  Islamic Center of Columbia in Columbia, SC.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Delaware State Sen. Dave Lawson puts forth a bill to prevent “foreign laws” from being used in local courts. Despite drawing criticism from local civil liberties and Muslim organizations, Lawson insisted that the bill was not about religion.
Renee Marie Nunnally, 48, has been charged with threatening to bomb the Petersburg Muslim Center in Petersburg, PA.

Brandyn Luis Hernandez, 27, is arrested and charged after he made online threats to “kill Muslims one by one” and made threats against the "Islamic Center of Greater Miami-Masjid Miami Gardens" in Miami Gardens, FL.

Jeffrey Calhoun, 62, is arrested and charged with first-degree attempted robbery, one misdemeanor count of second-degree menacing, and second-degree harassment in Buffalo, NY. Calhoun was accused of attempting to steal Jeanneie Muhammad's purse, grabbing her, biting her, throwing her to the ground, and calling her the 'n' word multiple times.

An Arab-American family reports that a police officer told them to "go back to where you came from" on a visit to Lake Erie Metropolitan Park in Brownstown Township, MI. The family urged the police department to take action against the police officer.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Dan Leonard, member of Toms River Board of Education, in Toms River, NJ, receives backlash after he posted anti-Muslim remarks on his Facebook, including one that claimed that "my life would be complete if she/they die," referring to Rep. Rashida Tlaib. Leanard refused to apologize or resign.

The Sussex County Republican Committee fills its Twitter page with anti-Muslim and Islamophobic posts in Georgetown, DE, including one that called to "eradicate Islam from every town, city, county and state in our homeland." Jerry Scanlan, chairman of the Sussex GOP and vice chairman of the board of trustees at Sussex County Community College, did not disavow the comments in a statement.

Abrar Omeish, a candidate for a Fairfax County School Boardboard seat, alleges police brutality and discrimination after being pepper-sprayed and dragged from her car and was forced to remove her headscarf in Falls Church, VA. At the Fairfax County Adult Detention Center, Omeish said, she was forced to remove her headscarf when she was photographed, despite objecting to the request.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Isaiah Joel Peoples, 34-year-old Army veteran, is arrested and charged with eight counts of attempted murder in Sunnyvale, CA, after he drove his car into a crowd of people he believed to be Muslims. One of the victims was a 13-year-old girl, sending her into a coma with swelling to her brain.

Jeanine Pirro, a television host at FOX News, gets a two-week suspension after she criticzed Rep. Ilhan Omar's hijab and suggested that her faith collides with her alliagence to the United States and its constitution. President Trump voiced his support for Pirro.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Former Sturgeon Police Chief Greg Halderman is fired for the second time after he posted anti-Muslim and anti-immigrant views on Facebook in Sturgeon, MO. Among other things, Halderman claimed immigrants should leave their cultures in their "shithole countries," and accused Muslims of wanting to wage jihad.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unknown suspect spray-paints "Cease the Needless Slaughter" and "Muslims go home" on the doors of Saba Live Poultry in Bloomfield, CT. The owner of the store declined to file a police report.
Maria Disney is arrested in connection to the writing of "No Muslims Go Away 2 Hell" on the outside of International Market & Grille in Concord, CA.

Wesley David Gilreath of Boulder, CO is arrested for a potential domestic terrorist attack after being linked to an attempted purchase of a gun and posting "Hunting Guides" including lists of mosques and their addresses.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Fatima Abdelrahman, a US National Squash player, is forced to remove her hijab by representatives of Air Canada during the boarding process. The airline employees refused to allow her to remove her hijab in a private space.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Shahin Indorewala, files a lawsuit against Fast Trak Management of Falls Church, Virginia due to the chief executive, Ramses Gavilondo, making mocking and discriminating comments towards her faith during a job interview.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Rudina Cinari, of Ditmas Park, New York has naturalization oath ceremony, delayed for over 1,700 days for "unforseen circumstances."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Lou Reiner, Deputy Mayor of Raritan Township in New Jersey, resigns his position after being publicly confronted over a post on his Facebook page calling Islam a cancer and needing to be "treated with radiation."
The Anti-Muslim group ACT, known for organizing the "March Against Sha'ria" in 2017, hosts its annual gala at Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago Resort in Palm Beach, FL.

Kyle Allen, 50, is arrested after shoving and berating three Muslim women on the street. In addition, the incident also included Allen trying to forcibly remove the women's hijabs, and telling them to "go back to their country."
Two Muslim families are barred from boarding a New York City ferry, with officials citing "security concerns" as their rationale.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Hal Pierce, chairman of the Combat Sports Authority of Maine, is called to resign after posting several Islamophobic statements to his Facebook page, including one which claims that Muslim refugees are entering the United States to “kill all those who do not submit to Islam.”
Washington DC think tank The Center for Security Policy, whose founder is known for his Islamophobic comments, hosts its annual Flame dinner at Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago Resort.

Madinah Brown, a Youth Detention counselor at New Castle County Detention Center, is barred from wearing her hijab to work, with her employer citing the workplace dress code. The code does not specifically prevent the wearing of hijabs, only "attire which impedes movement or poses unneccesary risk".
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Rosemarie Mohammed and her toddler are refused service at a Hampton Inn in West Palm Beach, where they had pre-booked a room. Hampton employees stated to her, "we don't want your kind here" as they were forced out.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A.J. Cameron, a candidate for City Council in Roeland Park, KS is brought under fire after a community group uncovers several Islamophobic tweets, including one which decrees President Obama is a "pro-Islamic traitor".

A Muslim family shopping at a TJ Maxx in Brooklyn, is ambushed by another woman, who curses and yells at them to "go back to their own country", and hits the husband. When police arrive, they refuse the family's request to file hate-crime charges, instead documenting the incident as a harrassment complaint.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Noor Abukaram, a high school cross country athlete, is disqualified after winning a race, because her hijab did not meet dress code requirements.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: North Dakota state senator Oley Larson shares an inflammatory and debunked photo on his Facebook page, which appears to show Congresswoman Ilhan Omar at an Al’ Qaida training camp in Somalia.
Julius Lara, 12, and Syend Smith, 14, are arrested on hate-crime assault charges after attacking and mocking off duty school safety agent Md Islam.

Parents sue the Lakeview Local School District, after their 10-year old Muslim son is questioned by his teacher about whether he believes in god and his patriotism, and is later strip-searched by the school nurse for signs of abuse.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A 17-year old Syrian boy was riding the San Diego lightrail home from school when he was approached by a man who, upon finding out the boy's Arab ethnicity, attacked him while shouting Islamophobic slurs. The boy was left with several facial injuries. No arrests have been made, despite video evidence.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Hailey Riddle, 18, is arrested in connection to the vandalism of the Islamic Center of Charleston. She is suspected of painting the words "utterly blessed" on the side of the building.

Roger Stewart, the newly appinted councilman for Distict 4 of the Kokomo Common Council, shares Islamophobic content stating that "Muslims must bend to the rules of America or get out" on his Facebook page. This comes just weeks after Stewart's predecessor resigned amid controversy for Islamophic posts.

A Muslim woman is repeatedly asked to remove her hijab when passing through security checkpoints at a Denver Nuggets game at the Pepsi Center. After refusing, staff became hostile towards the until a manager intervened.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An unidentified student at Andrew High School in Tinley Park, IL brings a Qur'an to school, and burns it in front of a Muslim student, before spitting in his face. No formal charges have been brought, after internal discipline by the school.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Anthony Cole, 22, and two male juveniles, 16 and 17, are arrested in connection with a series of violent robberies committed against Muslim families in the Buffalo area.

Usama Dakdok, the outspoken founder anti-Islamic "THEE Book Club" is delivers a public address on "the dangers of Islam" at Kennedy Elementary School in Willmar, MN despite pushback from Islamic organizations in the community.
A business professor at Henry Ford College launches into an Islamophobic rant against one of his students, Ali Jaber, after he asks for help with work on a website related to Lebanon.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A nine year-old Muslim boy fasting for Ramadan is forced by a teacher to watch his classmates eat lunch, as punishment for laughing in class.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An armed man was arrested outside of Masjid al-Shuhadaa after threatening four Muslim men outside, shouting anti-Islamic slurs, and trying to gain entry to the mosque.
Wolodymyr Pidluznyj, 62, is charged with a hate crime after attacking a Muslim woman and her child with a knife outside of their home, while yelling Islamophobic slurs.
Kristen Hitchcock, 49, is ticketed by police for a public disturbance after publically berating a Muslim woman for her wearing of a hijab inside a Macy's department store.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Despite its denouncement of Islamophobia, the Douglas County GOP continues to post anti-Muslim rhetoric on its Facebook page.

State Sen. Michael Gianaris calls upon the NYPD to investigate Islamophobic graffiti found on a bus station shelter as a hate crime, also alerting the New York Department of Transportation. No charges have been filed.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Danielle Stella, a Republican challenging Muslim Minnesota Congresswoman lhan Omar, has her Twitter account suspended after posting several tweets which seemed to allude to Omar's hanging.
Jason R. Gerardy, 39, is charged with two felonies after threatening to kill and destroying the car of a Somali Muslim man outside of his apartment building.
A Muslim woman is sues a movie theatre for discrimination after they served her pork, despite her having explicitly told employees that consuming pork is a violation of her Muslim faith.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A fire at Majid al-Farooq in Chicago is ruled Arson by local officials. The fire caused substatial damage, but no arrests were made.
A woman disrupts two Muslim men praying in a computer lab at Metropolitan State University of Denver, telling them forcibly to "go pray somewhere else" and loudly playing music.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Joseph Cecil Vandevere, 53, is convicted of soliciting violence against Virginia state senate candidate Qasim Rashid over the internet. These violent threats were made against Rashid because Vandevere disagreed with his Muslim faith.

A 17-year old Muslim student at Pleasant Grove High School is verbally attacked and doused in water by a masked perpetrator in a school bathroom, while wearing her Muslim Student Association t-shirt. Police and school officials documented the incident, but there are no suspects.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A public talk featuring Muslim congresswoman Rashida Tlaib at Westview High School's theatre is cancelled at the last minute, after a conservative legal fund sent a letter to district officials protesting the event on account of its "anti-Israel" nature.
The attempted-buglary of a St. Paul mosque is being ruled a hate crime, after burglers left a whiteboard scrawled with anti-Islamophobic sentiments. No arrests have been made.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Hussein Altaweel is suing Longent LLC, who fired him after he asked to take off from work on Eid al-Adha. His former company's CEO is quoted as saying, "we have our own holidays in this country. Aren't those enough for you?"
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Prosecution is shocked, after David Allen Boileau, 58, is sentenced to no jail time and only a year of supervised release for his harassment and threats towards his Muslim neighbor Rana Al-Hakeem and her family.
A zoning board in Fort Wayne, Indidana votes 4-1 against a proposal for a Muslim cemetary, citing concerns over the size of the cemetary and the land's previous agricultural use.

The Florida Bar announces the Florida Supreme Court's 91-day suspension of lawyer and former judicial candidate Donald McBath in light of several Islamophobic comments he made on his social media accounts.

Georgetown Advisory Neighborhood Commissioner Bill Starrels threatens to shoot customers and the Muslim owner of Charcoal Town Hookah and Shwarma after a disagreement about noise coming from the restaurant. Starrells later plead not guilty to charges of threats to do bodily harm.

Three Muslim inmates at the Men's Centra Jail in Los Angeles sue the Los Angeles Sherrif's department after failing to be provided with religious accomodations such as access Halal meals and copies of the Qur'an.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Sikeson Public Safety Officer is placed on administrative leave after making inflammatory anti-Muslim comments on social media. The post brought to the attention of his director read, I get to choose whom I dislike and it just so happens to be all Muslims", and has since been removed.
Prospect Park Mayor Mohamed Khairullah speaks out about his experience being detained and questioned about ties to terrorism because of his Muslim faith and Arab descent at JFK International Airport.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The manager of a Saginaw, TX Chicken Expresses tells employee Stefanae Coleman that she must remove her hijab or leave work, though there is nothing prohibiting the wearing of hijabs in the company's dress code.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: San Luis Obispo County planning commissioner Jim Harrison resigns amid criticism for a Facebook post which claimed that "the Islamic religioun should be banned".

A Muslim family recieves a one-dollar bill stamped with a message reading "No Muslim Immigrants in USA". They believe the bill originated at a gas station owned by the family, and was purposefully given to them by a customer.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Reports emerge that incarcerated Muslims at The Adams County Adult Correctional Facility in Lancaster, PA are charged nearly three times more for Qur'ans than incarcerated Christians are charged for Bibles.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Muslim family is harrassed by an intoxicated man while eating dinner in a local Applebee's. After the incident, both the family and the instigator are asked to leave the restaurant.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Rep. Ilhan Omar speaks out about a death threat she recieved while attending the Minnesota State Fair, which occured just hours after Republican Senate candidate Roy Moore publically urged her to "go back to Somalia." The threat was reported to law enforcement, but no arrests have been made.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Bloomington, MN woman challenges a ban on recording Muslim children outside of the Dar Al-Farooq Mosque and Success Academy, stating that it is a violation of her first amendment rights. The Muslim community maintains that unconsented recordings are a threat to the safety of their children.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: A Muslim employee of the New York DMV files a complaint after the employer refused to accomodate his requests for adjusted schedules during Ramadan and Friday prayers.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Kokomo Common Councilman Greg Jones resigns from his position after Facebook several of his Islamophobic Facebook posts, including those referring to Islam as a "theocratic moon cult" emerge.

Christopher Paul Bonaminio, 40, was arrested at The Islamic Center of Riverside on a number of charges, including violation of civil rights, after making a number of criminal threats and derogatory comments against Muslims and the mosque itself.

An unidentified man threatens to physically harm a Muslim family while they are shopping at a local Sam's Club, also telling them to "go back to their own country". Despite action from CAIR Ohio, no arrests have been made.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: James Verrett, 23, is arrested in connection with a racial slur spray painted on the side of Lux Hookah Lounge, which is owned and frequented by Muslim community members.
The first annual Muslim Day at the Kentucky State Capitol is met with counterprotesters weilding signs with Islamophobic messaging, and yelling proclaimations of Islam as "a false religion".

Massachusetts's first Muslim mayor, Sumbul Siddiqui, speaks out about her experiences with Islamophobia as a public figure, both during her 2017 City Council campaign and running and serving as mayor.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic Center of Charleston's exterior wall is vandalized with the words "Utterly Blessed" and an unidentified symbol in the early hours of the morning. Police are not classifying the incident as a hate crime, and no charges have been made.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Islamic Center of Charleston's exterior wall is vandalized with the words "Utterly Blessed" and an unidentified symbol in for the second time in two weeks. Police are not classifying the incident as a hate crime, and no charges have been made.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: An educational forum for 25th Congressional District seat candidates sponsored by the American Islamic Institute of Antelope Valley and Council on American-Islamic Relations Greater Los Angeles Area Chapter was ended early after repeated disruptions from a dozen Trump 2020 protesters shouting Islamophobic remarks.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Jasmine Renee Campbell, 23, is charged with a hate crime after forcefully removing and making obscene gestures with the hijab of a Saudi foreign exchange student at Oregon State University.

Michigan chain restaurant Anna's House is sued by two former employees-- one Hispanic and one Muslim-- for racial and religious discrimination in their time with the chain. Aliou Diao, a Senegalese Muslim, stated that she was disciplined for wearing a hijab, and eventually fired for being "a poor fit to the culture Anna's House was trying to create."
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Stefan Keco, 28, is arrested and charged with terroristic threats and bias intimidation after sending threatening and Islamophobic text messages to Muslim police chief Ibrahim “Mike” Baycora.

A large crowd attends the County Council meeting to discuss the construction of the Harford Islamic Center in Harford County. The meeting comes after weeks of pushback and Islamophobic rhetoric on social media after the original announcement.
Heather Meisel, 43, is charged with arson, burgulary, and destruction of property after smashing the widows and throwing incendiary devices into a house and Islamic center in Halethorpe, MD.
Pablo Lima, a Bay Harbor Island Police Officer, is suspended after showing support for Islamohobic content on social media.

Melissa Lovins, 39, is arrested for assualt after attacking her Muslim Uber driver in the early hours of the morning. The driver stated that after he refused to discuss politics with Lovins, she became agitated, and then attacked and yelled Islamoophobic slurs at the driver when she was asked to leave the car.
Jaran Ali Rasanjani Tyrell, 29, is arrested for aggravated stalking after making several threatening and Islamophobic phone calls to the American Muslim Leadership Council.

California State University, San Bernardino Campus, announces the cancellation of the course "History of Islam: Mohammed to ISIS" after tremendous backlash from Muslim students and community members over the Islamophobic and inaccurate content of the course.

The Muslim community of Delaware is forced to go to significant measures to provide a 1-year old girl with an Islamic burial after a cease-and-desist order is placed on the only Muslim cemetary in Deleware after complaints of "suspicious activity" made during traditional Islamic funeral ceremonies. The cease-and-desist was temporarily removed for the girl's funeral to proceed.
Masjid an-Nur in northern Minneapolish is vandalized with defamatory words graffitied on the outside of the building. No arrests have been made.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Reports emerge of the Camden County GOP frequently sharing anti-Muslim content on its Facebook page, some of which target Rep. Ilhan Omar directly, sparking community backlash. The posts were deleted in the days following the release of this story.
$1,000 is stolen in the buglary of Mevlana Camii Mosque in Paterson, NJ. No arrests have been made.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Scott Kenneth Alexander, 37, is arrested on two counts of assault against an Arab man in a grocery store parking lot. The incident is being investigaed as a hate crime after Alexander stated that he was "detaining" the victim "so he would not commit and act of terrorism".
Corbin Kauffman, 31, is arrested after posting hundreds of threatening and violent images towards Muslim, Jewish, and Black communities.

Republican Rick Phillips, a congressional candidate in Iowa's second district, includes removing Islam's religious status and First Amendment protections. He has also been quoted as referring to Islam as "militant cultural imperialism seeking world domination".
A Muslim New York City firefighter contracts COVID-19 after three teenagers deliberately sneezed on him while on duty, while taunting him.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Nicholas John Proffitt, 42, faces charges of arson, buglary, and property damage after deliberately setting fire to the Islamic Center of Cape Girardeau. He was also arrested in 2009 in connection for damage to the same Islamic Center.
The Islamic Center of Northern New York is burgalarized, also leaving a number of religous items damaged. Though CAIR-NY called for further investigation, no suspects have been named.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: After being arrested at a Black Lives Matter protest in downtown Miami, Alaa Massri, a young Muslim woman, had her hijab removed by authorities at the Turner Guilford Knight Correctional Center. It was not returned to her for more than seven hours.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Tennessean newspaper publishes an ad featuring a "biazarre, pseudo-religious prophecy" claiming that there would be an attack on Nashville "by Islam". After public outcry, the paper has apologized and launched an investigation into how the ad was published.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Videos of Georgia US House candidate with ties to QAanon, Marjorie Taylor Greene, making blantantly Islamophobic and Antisemitic claims emerge, leading several GOP-leaders to condemn her candidacy.
E'Lon Brown, a Muslim man, is wrongfully terminated from his position at Automatic Distributors Corp. and Staffmax in Indianapolis after requesting prayer breaks throughout the day.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: The Al Ihsaan Islamic Center in Warren, MI is vandalized, having several windows broken with a hammer. The center had been open for only a few months. While an investigation has been launched, no arrests have been made.
Rania Barakat, a Muslim woman, was turned away from Frontier Justice gun range in Lee's Summit, MO for refusing to remove her hijab.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)

Event Description: Suud Olat, a Muslim candidate for Minneapolis City Council, discusses the Islamophobic hate speech he's faced throughout his campaign with the St. Cloud Times.
Event Class: bias-related incident (targeting individual or specific group)
